loans.name: Binti

texts.en:
Binti is married, she owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a shoe-selling business for the past one year. She sells to her town dwellers, passersby and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of transportation in  her business. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase 30 pairs of shoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 30 pairs of shoes for resale.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki appreciates the support and help from Yehu and Kiva at large. She operates a food stall which gives her funds to take care of her family. 

Here again she comes to you requesting another loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy two sacks of vegetables and a bunch of firewood for use during the food preparation to meet the demands of her customers. She appreciates the support.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of vegetables and a bunch of firewood for sale.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en: Rehema appreciates Kiva and Yehu for the support given. She sells charcoal from her home to her customers. Here again she comes to you requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase nine sacks of charcoal for sale to her customers. She says "thank you" to all.

loans.use: to purchase nine sacks of charcoal for sale to her customers.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence has been in the spice-making industry for 10 years now and has an established business called Ty’s Spices, Smoked Meats & Catering.  He is a popular chef who often caters special events and recently has seen an increase in business since his return from culinary training in Italy.

His original and zesty mixes are low in salt, his plum and lemon flavors have zero salt, and all spice mixes are free of MSG, gluten, preservatives, additives and dyes.  In addition to offering these seasonings for sale, he uses them to liven up his catered offerings of baked, grilled, sautéed and smoked meats, as well as stir-fried and steamed vegetables.  

Lawrence’s main goal is to create seasonings that are both delicious and healthful, offering everybody tasty options – even people who must follow restricted diets.  

Since 2000, Lawrence has sold his products at Williams-Sonoma in Sugar Land, Texas, where he resides, and he regularly sells at the Farmer’s Market at Imperial, also in Sugar Land.  His next goal is to attract the interest of a major grocery chain.  In order to reach that goal, he needed financial assistance to purchase more ingredients to produce more inventory.  His Accion Texas loan enabled him to do this and now he is seeking a major contract.  He says that by partnering with a major chain, he could increase his business by as much as 30 percent.

Discover more on his Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/tysspice/photos#!/tysspice/ or his website at: http://tysspice.com.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients to produce more inventory.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas lives in Mombasa, Kenya. He is 42 years old, married and blessed with three children. Two of his children are in school. He has had a Kiva loan before and he paid it back without challenges and now he seeks another loan to buy more oranges, passion fruit and mangoes for sale. He heard about Milango through friends who invited him to join. 

The major challenges in the business are competition from other traders and lack of funding. The extra income that he will raise from the business will go towards his chlidren's education and the health of his family.

loans.use: To purchase fruit, e.g., oranges, passion fruit, limes, mangoes, etc. and groceries

loans.name: Katsaka

texts.en:
Katsaka is widowed and blessed with five children and only one attends school. She owns a house that has electricity, but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She cooks food for sale at the market and sells to town-dwellers and passersby. She cites food left-overs, leading to losses, as her major challenge in the business. She dreams of establishing a modern cafe business in the future.

With the KES 25,000 loan, she wants to purchase food ingredients, such as beans, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access financial support to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase food ingredients, such as beans, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is married and has five adult children. She rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a charcoal selling business for the past year. She sells from home to her neighbors. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation. She dreams of incorporating firewood into her existing business in the near future.

With the loan she is requesting she plans to purchase four sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support.

loans.use: to purchase four sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Kotognongontala  I Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe   KOTOGNONGONTALA  I sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à TOUROUMADIE, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution, le prêt passé à été bien remboursé.
La spéculation cultivée est  le riz avec   RAMATOU debout en deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte payer les frais de labour et les engrais  pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et au marché après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 115.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group called  KOTOGNONGONTALA  I are married women with an average age of 42 and four children on average, all living in polygamous families in TOUROUMADIE, one of the villages of Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali. 
 
They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to succeed with their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their second loan with the institution, their first loan having been correctly reimbursed. 

The crop cultivated is rice in the case of Ramatou, standing second from right to left in the photo. With her loan she intends to pay for plowing and fertilizer to farm one half hectare. Her produce is sold right in the village and in the market, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women. She expects to make an average profit of 115,000 F CFA per season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing and farm inputs.

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita, 45 years of age, is married to a farmer, and they are blessed with five children. 

She has managed a hog-raising business for almost 10 years. When she sells a hog, she has a net income of PHP 3,000. 

Due to lack of capital, she decided to request a loan from generous lenders amounting to PHP 14,000 to purchase hog feeds for her pigs. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that her business will continue to grow and develop.

loans.use: To purchase hog feeds for her pigs.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is a 59-year-old married woman from Getafe, Bohol.

She toils the land. She grows and sells rice to earn a living. She has been growing rice for more than 10 years.

To sustain her farming activity, Paulina requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy fertilizers to improve her harvest and bring higher earnings. Paulina hopes to have a bountiful harvest to set aside some of the profits to build a sari-sari (variety) store in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is a married woman and a mother of three children. She lives in San Miguel, Bohol. 

Margarita has been engaged in a hog-raising business for more than 10 years now. This is the source of her income.

Margarita is asking for a loan to buy feeds for the pigs. With this, she will be able to improve her hog-raising business, thus augmenting her income and profit. In the future, Margarita hopes to make her business a success and a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy feeds for the pigs.

loans.name: Raymunda

texts.en:
Raymunda is a 51-year-old married woman from Getafe, Bohol. She has four children. The oldest child is 15 and the youngest is 5. 

She engages in a furniture-making business. She makes furniture made of wood like tables and chairs. She has been in furniture making for more than 10 years. 

Aside from furniture business, she grows rice for additional earnings.

Raymunda requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy materials like wood and also to buy fertilizer. In the future, Raymunda would like to expand her furniture-making business to improve. She would like to be able to purchase a new cutting machine, which is very important in her furniture business, as well as to provide her children with the best.

loans.use: to buy wood for furniture and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is 35 years old and married to Ruth. They have two children, ages eleven and five. 

He has a business in Naivasha where he has been selling items such as wallets, watches, and socks, which he has operated for the past three years. He plans to open a shop with the anticipated profit where he will sell his items.

In the near future, Thomas hopes to have a big shop and to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy wallets, watches, socks and other items for resale.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is married, 37 years old, and has three children. She lives in Poblacion, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental with her family. Their main source of income comes from their farm. 

She plans to make a vegetable garden in a little portion of a lot beside their farm to have extra income for the family. She helped her husband to cultivate the said lot and recently borrowed a loan from Gata Daku MPC to buy fertilizer and seedlings. This loan will be a big help in order to realize their new vegetable garden. She hopes to have a bountiful harvest in the next cropping season for the good of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Carina

texts.en:
Carina lives in Ozamis City and helps her family through a manufacturing business, particularly the making of hollow blocks. 

She is a 37-year-old, single woman with two children, who tries her best to earn on her own. For years, she has managed this business and earns about PHP 10,500 per month. Aside from this, she also has a motor-rental service to earn an extra income. 

Recently, she borrowed a loan to acquire a motorcycle for the business. Carina wants to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to acquire a motorcycle for the business.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
You are most welcome to meet 29 year old Rachel from Liberia. Presently she lives and works in Buchanan, the capital city of Grand Bassa County, which is located by the sea.  It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish.  Many logging companies are also based in the city.  Residents of the city love eating fufu, cassava based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce.  Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. 
Her fiancee is a transports bike rider. Rachel completed grade 12 and has two children, aged 1 and 5, only the older one is in school and they live at home. For seven years now Rachel has been operating a cook shop (restaurant), she started her business with money from her fiancee, and she learned trading from her mother. She enjoys selling to her customers and spends 8 hours a day on her business from Monday to Saturday. Rachel is requesting a loan to purchase more pepper, bitter ball, oil, vita drink, etc. for her business, she hope to move from a table business to a shop.

loans.use: to purchase more pepper, bitter ball, oil, vita drink, etc. for her business

loans.name: Mealii

texts.en:
Mealii is married. For the past six years, she has operated a business selling clothing. Mealii sells to town dwellers, passersby, and her neighbors. Her major business challenges are inflation and the high cost of transportation. Mealii owns a house that has electricity but no running water and her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

Mealii is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to purchase bales of clothes to resell.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes to resell

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is a divorced mother of three school children. They live in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She has operated a khanga (a garment worn by women) selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital to expand her business and also competition from her fellow sellers.

With the loan, she wants to purchase three bales of khangas for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase three bales of garments for resale.

loans.name: Sidi

texts.en:
Sidi is divorced and has three children who are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family.

She has operated a fish-selling business at the market for the past ten years, selling to town dwellers and her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of fish, especially during cold currents in the deep sea. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase bundles of fish, cooking oil, and firewood. She decided to join Yehu to access loans at lower cost to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of fish, cooking oil, and firewood.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is married. She has three children who attend school and six adult children. For the past year, she has sold fruit and vegetables from her home to her neighbors. Rehema  lives in her own house without electricity or running water and her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

Rehema is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to purchase sacks of fruit and vegetables to resell. In the future, she dreams of establishing a mini-green grocery.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruit and vegetables to resell

loans.name: Tenneh

texts.en:
Tenneh is 43 years old and lives and works in Buchanan, the capital city of Grand Bassa County, which is located by the sea.  It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish.  Many logging companies are also based in the city.  Residents of the city love eating fufu, cassava based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce.  
Tenneh is divorced and has three children aged between 20 and 28. She completed 6th grade before starting her business 18 years ago. She describes herself as a hard working woman. 
Tenneh established her business with money from her susu (local daily savings), she enjoys her business because she makes more profit. Tenneh sells for ten hours, six days a week. She is requesting a loan to buy more red oil, rice, pepper, bitter ball, etc. for her business, her plan is to increase her business even more. Tenneh would like to says thanks to the supporters of BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to buy more red oil, rice, pepper, bitter ball, etc. for her business

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth lives in the Kongowea area. She has had a previous Kiva loan, which she repaid without challenges. She sells second-hand clothes at the local market, a business she has done for more than eight years. 

Ruth knew of Milango Financial Services through friends and now she seeks a loan to buy additional stocks of second-hand clothing, bed sheets, shoes, and other items. She hopes that she will be operating a boutique in the next five years. 

The challenges in the business are competition and a lack of funding. The income she will raise from the business will go towards paying school fees for her children and improving her living standards.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of second-hand clothing, bed sheets, shoes, and other items.

loans.name: José Heriberto

texts.en:
Jose Heriberto is a Tlaxcalan farmer who earns his living entirely from the production on his dairy. He and his family are looking to reduce input costs and are investing in a 10 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester to take advantage of the abundant cow manure generated daily on-site. 
They will use the digester to treat the waste to produce renewable biogas for use in cooking and heating bathwater, and will fertilize their maize and alfalfa with the potent biofertilizer produced. These outputs will allow them to displace non-renewable LP gas and agrochemical fertilizer use on their farm. This loan represents 51% of the total cost of his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.use: To purchase a 10 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: Etelvina

texts.es:
Doña Etelvina tiene 45 años de edad ella es comerciante y agricultora, casada y madre de 2 hijos los cuales están actualmente estudiando, con un grado de educación primaria completo gracias al apoyo brindado por sus padres en su juventud. Ella tiene un negocio de venta de dulces el cual está ubicado en su casa; pero también se dedica a la producción de café con una experiencia de 10 años en el comercio (dulces) y 20 en la producción de café. El terreno que ella en compañía de su familia cultiva lo compraron con su pareja el cual está ubicado a 20 minutos de camino de su casa de habitación.

Doña Etelvina ha solicitado un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para la compra de insumos como: nutrí café, abono, foliar, etc. para dar asistencia y una mayor protección a sus cultivos.

Sus metas son poder mejorar sus cultivos mediante esta compra y darles la asistencia necesaria para poder obtener una excelente cosecha al final de la temporada ya que esto vendrá a mejorar sus ingresos y poder seguir apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Etelvina is 45 years old and is a merchant and farmer. She is married and a mother of 2 children that are currently studying, with their primary education completed thanks to the support of their parents in their youth. She has a business selling sweets which is located in her home; but she also cultivates coffee for a living, with 10 years of experience in commerce (sweets) and 20 years in the production of coffee. The land where she cultivates coffee
along with her family, was purchased with her partner and is a 20 minute walk from her home.

Etelvina has requested financing from the cooperative COMIXMUL in order to purchase supplies such as: coffee nutrients, fertilizer, pesticide, etc to help and better protect her crops.

Her goals are to be able to improve her crops through this purchase and give them the necessary assistance to be able to obtain an excellent harvest at the end of the season, so that it will sell and improve her income and she will be able to continue supporting her children in their studies.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for coffee crops.

loans.name: Roberta

texts.en:
Roberta  is 57 years old and comes from the community of Jagna, Bohol. She is married with three grown children. For a year now, she has been operating a sari-sari (variety) store business for a profit. She sell snacks, canned goods, noodles and seasoning in her store. Her business allows her to generate an average income of 5,000 PHP per month.

She is asking for a loan to buy additional stock of candies, canned goods and detergent. 

In the future, she plans to buy more products and items that she did not previously carry to increase her overall income and profitability.

loans.use: to buy candies, canned goods and detergent

loans.name: Fedila

texts.en:
Fedila is 49 years old and comes from the community of Dimiao, Bohol. She is married with three adult children. For 10 years now, she has been engaged in a sari-sari (variety) store business. She sells items like canned goods, eggs, soft drinks, cigarettes, snacks and toiletries. 

Fedila is asking for a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy items like liquor, cigarettes, detergent, shampoo and soft drinks. The income will be used for family consumption and to pay for household bills.

In the future, she hopes to have a bigger store and make it more profitable so she can provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy items like liquor, cigarettes, detergent, shampoo and soft drinks

loans.name: Charlita

texts.en:
Charlita is 30 years old and married with a child. She lives in Butuay, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. Charlita's husband is a farmer and she helps him on their farm for it is their main source income. She has been a farmer for ten years and her dream of owning a farm came into reality through hard work and determination. Charlita joined Gata Daku MPC.

Charlita is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer. She hopes to use her loan to generate an abundant harvest this cropping season. Charlita hopes to have better living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Ardin

texts.en: Ardin lives in Sumasap Pana-on with his family. He is 25, married with an only child.  He has earned money from providing transportation services for more than two years to support the needs of his family. He gets an income of 3,000 PHP a month from this business. Without hesitation, Ardin borrowed an amount of 12,500 PHP from GDMPC to buy a new set of tires and accessories. Ardin joined Gata Daku MPC in 2012. His plan in the future is to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy a new set of tires and accessories

loans.name: Quilly

texts.en:
Quilly 28 years old and is a single entrepreneur who lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. For the past two years, he has provided motorcycle transportation and rentals to earn a living. In his free time, Quilly has a part-time job as a chainsaw operator. 

Quilly is requesting a loan from Gata Daku MPC to cover the cost of maintaining his motorcycle. He is determined to be successful in his business and he works hard to pursue his dreams. He hopes to have a better future with his own family.

loans.use: to cover the cost of maintaining his motorcycle

loans.name: Armando

texts.en:
Armando is a Tlaxcalan  farmer who earns his living entirely from selling milk. He and his family are looking to improve the economic viability of their farm and are investing in a 10 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester to better utilize the cow manure generated daily on-site. 
They will use the digester to treat the waste to produce renewable biogas for use in cooking and heating bathwater, and will fertilize their crops with the potent biofertilizer produced. This will allow him to displace non-renewable LP gas and agrochemical fertilizer use on the farm. This loan represents 51% of the total cost of his Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.use: To purchase a 10 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: Tete

texts.en:
Tete is 30 years old and lives and works in Buchanan, the capital city of Grand Bassa County, which is located by the sea. It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish. Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents of the city love eating fufu, cassava based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce.  
Tete is married and her husband is a contractor. Together they have three children aged between 3 and 8 years, only two are in school and live at home. Tete was fortunate  to finish grade 12. She is a hard working businesswoman, for the past fourteen years she been selling rice in the local market. She started this business by selling for her fiancee and she learned this business from her mother. Tete is requesting a loan to purchase more rice for her business, her dream is to educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more rice for her business,

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is married with three school-going children. For the past two years, she has operated a fruit and vegetable stall, selling produce from home to her neighbors. Mariam and her family live in their own house without electricity or running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. Mariam decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

Mariam  is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes to resell. In the future, she dreams of establishing a mini-green grocery.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes to resell

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 53 years old and comes from the municipality of Dimiao, Bohol. She is married with five children aged 16 to 27. For four years now, Betty has operated a sari-sari (variety) store where she sells snacks, candies, bread, detergent, canned goods and soft drinks. She also sells home-cooked snacks like siakoy (fried dough sprinkled with sugar) and kuchinta (steamed cake made of rice flour).

She barely earns an average income of 6,000 PHP, which helps provide for her family’s basic needs. She is asking for a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy merchandise such as detergent, shampoo and canned goods. 

She hopes that someday she can continue to improve and expand her business for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy detergent, shampoo and canned goods

loans.name: Rossel

texts.en:
Rossel is 32-year-old married woman and a mother of a nine-year-old daughter. She lives with her family in the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She runs a 'sari-sari' or variety store business selling various goods like soap and detergents.

Rossel is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, soap and detergents, sodas and beverages and others. With this, Rossel will be able to increase her stock and attract more buyers to her store, thus augmenting her sales and income. In the future, Rossel has hopes of expanding her store so that it will generate more revenue necessary for the needs of the family like food and to pay the school expenses of her daughter.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, soap and detergents, sodas and other beverages, etc.

loans.name: Kotognongontala  Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe KOTOGNONGONTALA  II sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à TOUROUMADIE, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution, le prêt passé à été bien remboursé.
La spéculation cultivée est  le riz avec MAFOUNE debout au milieu sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter le labour et les engrais  pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 80.000  francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Kotognongontala II Group are married women with an average age of 40 years and an average of four children. They are all living in polygamous families Touroumadie, a village in Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. They are working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their second loan with the institution, and their prior loan was repaid in full.

Mafoune, shown standing in the center of the photo, grows crops of rice. With her ​​loan, she intends to pay for the labor and purchase the fertilizers needed to maintain half a hectare of farmland. After the harvest, her produce is sold at the village in Sikasso to a clientele composed of men and women.

She hopes to earn an income of 80,000 Francs CFA per agricultural cycle. This income will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with their daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay for the labor and purchase the fertilizers needed to maintain half a hectare of farmland.

loans.name: Ciriaca

texts.en:
Ciriaca is a 41-year-old  married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has six children. She runs a retail store. She sells items like canned goods, soy sauce, sugar, shampoo and noodles. She has been operating her retail store for almost one year. Due to lack of capital to finance her store, Ciriaca requested a loan of 5000 PHP to buy soft drinks, various foods and other groceries to attract more customers.

In the future, Ciriaca would like to expand her retail store to provide her children with the best and  to improve their livelihood status.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, various foods and other groceries

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
Zosima is a married woman from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. She has been engaged in a food vending business for more than 20 years now, selling home cooked snack foods to the people in her place.  She cooks and sells rice cake or 'puto'.

Zosima is asking for a loan to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, milk, yeast and others. With this, she will be able to cook and sell more rice cakes thus allowing her to earn more. In the future, Zosima wants to expand her business so that she will be able to augment her income and savings.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, milk, yeast and others

loans.name: Maysha

texts.en:
Maysha is married with an only child and lives in San Isidro, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. Her husband worked as an Overseas Filipino Worker and to earn an income of her own, she runs a general store, selling goods in their community. With her husband, she is hopeful to pursue their ambition of having a business in town. 

Maysha joined Gata Daku MPC and borrowed a loan to buy rice and corn grits for sale. She plans to expand her business and hopes to have better living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to buy rice and corn grits for sale

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en:
Johnson lives in Kongowea area near Mombasa, Kenya. He buys and sells livestock. He has been in this business for the last eight years and the business is doing wonderfully. He has had a previous Kiva loan, which he paid back without challenges. He also practices poultry keeping and this also earns him some income. 

In the next five years, he wants to own a butchery. This is his long-term ambition. He knew of Milango through a friend and now seeks a loan to buy goats, sheep, chickens and cows to sell. His business is usually low when the season is low. With the income he raises from this loan, he will educate his children.

loans.use: To buy goats, sheep, chickens and cows to sell

loans.name: Gamthum Lom Group

texts.en:
Lhingneikim is pictured with her hand raised on the far left in the picture. She is the featured borrower member for Gamthum Group. At 30 years old, Lhingneikim is married with six kids and lives in a village with her husband. The rest of the group members also live in the same village close to one another. The village is about 40 km away from the city capital of Imphal, which is also one of the state capitals for the north-eastern states of India. Her husband and she work side by side to meet the needs of the family. Her husband rears cattle, feeds them, and does businesses to generate income. She grows vegetables on the hill-slopes in the village and sells them to women selling vegetables at the town market. 

Lhingneikim is a farmer who supplements the family income by selling vegetables, grown by her on the distant hill-slopes in the village. She grows beans, cabbage, cauliflower, ladyfingers, pumpkins, yams, chives, potatoes, and spring onions. She also grows local vegetables found only in the states and eaten only by the local people. Although her main business is growing vegetables and supplying vegetables to the women vendors, most of the time she is busy raising cows. She feeds them, cut their fodder, bathes them, vaccinates them, and milks them. The investment in raising cattle is more profitable than selling vegetables, shares Lhingneikim. Therefore, she decided to spend more time raising cattle in addition to growing vegetables. She will be engaged in both activities now.

She wants loan from Kiva to purchase a calf and raise it. Luck favors them both, Lhingneikim and her husband, when raising cattle. The cattle are taken to the nearby field to eat grass and, when they are fully grown, they are sold in the village as well as in the neighbouring villages. She also sells the milk and generates income. 

She thanked Kiva and WSDS for the support and will remain obliged for the kind gesture. She will also repay the loan on time and try hard to be financially independent. Last but not least, she says, “Thank you, Kiva”.

The rest of the group members are engaged in piggery, weaving, and selling vegetables.

loans.use: To purchase a calf, raise it, and use it for other purposes to generate income for the family.

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah lives in Nanyuki, Kenya. She is 37 years old, married, and has two children ages 11 and 5. Both children attend school. For six years she has been running a retail shop. She sells sugar, rice, flour and cooking oil. She also does farming in her farm and earns a living from the produce. She has an ambition of growing the business from retail to wholesale. 

She learned about Milango through friends and now she seeks a loan to buy sugar, rice, flour and cooking oil for sale in her retail shop. Funding for the business was the challenge that she had to deal with. The income she earns from the business will improve the standard of living of the family.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is a 31-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has four children. The oldest child is 11 while the youngest is 6 months old. She raises and sells hogs to earn a living. She has been raising hogs for almost one year.

To finance her hog raising business, Emelita requested a loan of 5000 PHP to buy pig feed in pellets, to make sure that all her pigs grow faster and could be sold on time. Emelita would like to improve her hog raising business to continue to send her children to school and provide them with good living conditions.

loans.use: to buy pig  feed  in pellets

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane resides in the Kitale area of the North Rift region. a very fertile area, especially for maize production. She is married and has 12 children, of whom one is still in school. She has practiced farming for 37 years. Her primary sources of income are maize, beans, poultry, eggs,and coffee.

She wants to grow her dairy production and thus has applied for a loan of KES. 41,600 from Juhudi Kilimo to finance her project. This dairy cow will help her increase her milk production and thus also her income will increase and she can improve her family's livelihood. The challenge she faces is diseases that attack crops and livestock.

In five years time, she wants to own more dairy cows and also venture into poultry keeping.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Kotognongontala  Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe KOTOGNONGONTALA  III sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à TOUROUMADIE, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution, le prêt passé à été bien remboursé.
La spéculation cultivée est  le riz avec FATOUMATA debout en deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter le labour et les engrais  pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 85.000  francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Kotognongontala III Group are married women with an average age of 41 years and an average of four children. They are all living in polygamous families in Touroumadie, a village in Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. They are working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their second loan with the institution, and their first loan was repaid in full.

Fatoumata, shown standing second from the right in the photo, grows crops of rice. With her ​​loan, she intends to pay for the labor and purchase the fertilizers needed to maintain half a hectare of farmland. After the harvest, her produce is sold at the village in Sikasso to a clientele composed of men and women.

She hopes to earn an income of 85,000 Francs CFA per agricultural cycle. This income will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with their daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay for the labor and purchase the fertilizers needed to maintain half a hectare of farmland.

loans.name: Iamze

texts.en:
Iamze is 68 years old, a pensioner from the village of Likhauri, West Georgia. She is single and lives alone. The only source of income for Iamze is her monthly retirement pension (approximately 75 USD). 

Iamze is very hard-working woman and wishes to be busy with a dairy farm but her income is not enough to put aside savings to purchase a cow. For this reason, Iamze decided to ask for this loan. Iamze's loan request was approved as part of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides loans with reasonable terms to start-up businesses. These loans are provided to the country's vulnerable poor, who do not have access to credit products because they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” due to their low incomes. 

The loan will be used to purchase a milk cow. Iamze will place the cow in the cattle shed located in her yard and with the milk she will produce cheese which will be sold at the local market. She estimates that her income will increase by 150 to 200 GEL, which is a great support for a solitary pensioner. 
Iamze awaits Kiva lenders' support.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow and start a dairy business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and run two Fresh Life toilets

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Tatu is a married woman with three children; two of her children are in school and one is still very young. She owns a house that has neither piped water nor electricity. 

Tatu operates a charcoal business, selling at the market to her local customers. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Colette

texts.fr: colette est une femme de 36 ans, célibataire et mère de 02 enfants. elle possède et gère un salon de coiffure depuis 3 ans dans un quartier de la ville. dynamique et chaleureuse, elle a vu sa clientèle grandir d'où la sollicitation pour un prêt. avec ce crédit, elle va renforcer son stock de marchandises en acheter les produits cosmétiques et les mèches afin d'accroître des profits et satisfaire sa clientèle. les bénéfices générés vont être réinvestis dans son capital d'une part et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille (éducation, nutrition, santé) d'autre part
texts.en: Colette is a 36-year-old single mother of two children. She owns and operates a beauty salon in a district of the city, where she has been for the past three years. Dynamic and warm, she has seen her clientele grow to the point that she is requesting a loan. With this loan, she will increase her stock of merchandise by purchasing cosmetics and hair extensions to increase her income and her customer satisfaction. Part of the income she earns will be reinvested into her business capital, and she will use the rest to provide for her family's education, nutrition, and health.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her salon (cosmetics and hair extensions).

loans.name: Jean Isaac

texts.fr: Jean est un homme de 38 ans, célibataire et père d'un enfant. il possède et gère un salon de coiffure dans un quartier de la ville depuis 15 ans. dynamique et expérimenté, il sollicite un crédit pour acheter un nouveau matériel électrique afin d’aménager ses locaux et augmenter la clientèle. les bénéfices générés vont être investis dans l'activité d'une part et subviendront aux besoins de sa famille d'autre part
texts.en: Jean is a man of 38, single and the father of one child. He has owned and operated a barber shop in a neighborhood of the town for 15 years. Dynamic and experienced, he is requesting a loan to buy new electrical material to fix up his salon so he can grow his clientele. The profit generated will be invested in the business on the one hand and will go toward supporting his family on the other.

loans.use: to buy electrical materials for his salon

loans.name: Rusina

texts.en:
Rusina is 33 years old and lives in the Nyanga District in Zimbabwe with her husband and three children. Rusina enjoys running her business selling clothing including jackets, panties, shirts and shoes.  She is actively involved in her community, and volunteers at local pre-schools. 

A loan will enable her to expand her business by increasing her stock of clothing and shoes to increase her sales volumes. With the additional income she will earn, she will improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to increase her stock of clothing and shoes

loans.name: Chrispin

texts.en:
Chrispin, 39, is a businessman with four children from Kabwe District, Zambia. While he is an experienced farmer, he also runs a grocery shop and has been looking for new business opportunities. He is asking for a Kiva loan to buy a maize milling machine so that he can provide a milling service to over 300 households in his community.

The maize milling machine takes raw maize (white corn) and creates a maize flour which is used to make the staple food in Zambia. Most families in Chrispin’s community grow maize on their small farm, drying and storing it to be used as their source of food throughout the year. After the maize kernels are removed from the cob, they have to be milled to create flour. The flour is then boiled in water to make what is locally called Nshima.

Rent-to-Own has worked with Chrispin to thoroughly understand the market potential for a maize milling service in his community. Chrispin’s proposed location for the maize mill is ideal, as the closest competitor is 14km away, and since most members of the community, and others that are nearby, walk or take their maize to the mill by bicycle, it is certain they will prefer to use Chrispin’s mill rather than traveling a longer distance.

Equipment such as a maize mill can be a major boost, not only for rural business owners such as Chrispin, but also for the community as a whole. Unfortunately, the upfront costs of such a maize mill can be very prohibitive. Once Chrispin secures a loan he will be able to get a maize mill from Rent-to-Own. Rent-to-Own will deliver the mill to his place of business, install it, and provide training on how to use and maintain it. With a maize mill, Chrispin will be able to diversify his business and better serve his community.

This loan will help Chrispin establish a profitable service in his community that will support his family and the members of his community throughout the year. It is for this reason Chrispin is asking Kiva lenders to help him with the loan so that he can secure a maize mill as soon as possible.

loans.use: to pay for a maize milling machine that will provide a food milling service to over 300 families in his community

loans.name: Noupagagnon I Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe   NOUPAGAGNON I sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, 7 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à TOUROUMADIE, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Ils sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution et le prêt passé à été bien remboursé.
La spéculation cultivée est  le maïs avec  NAFANGA  assise en première  position de la  droite vers la gauche, il compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 150.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the group called NOUPAGAGNON I are married men with an average age of 42, seven children, and all living in traditional families in Touroumadie, one of the villages of Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali. 

They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to succeed in their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their second loan with the institution, and the prior loan was correctly reimbursed. 

Nafanga, first person seated from right to left, grows maize. He intends to use his loan to buy farm inputs, seeds, and pay for plowing to maintain one hectare. His produce is sold right in the village and at the market of Sikasso, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women. He expects to make an average profit of 150,000 F CFA per season. This profit will allow him to repay the loan and also help to support the extended family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs, seeds, and pay for plowing.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
Delfina continúa con la venta de comida y con el puesto de venta por lo tanto le va excelente, ella agradece infinitamente a todos los inversionistas que le apoyaron con el préstamo anterior pues le ayudo con el capital del negocio entonces en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más insumos como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite y otras cosas. 

Delfina nació en la comunidad de Uscarmaca pero vive en el distrito Challabamba. (El distrito de Challabamba está ubicado en la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, Perú). Ella tiene 40 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta relación tiene seis hijos. (La comunidad de Uscamarca está ubicado en el distrito de Santo Tomas de la provincia de Chumbivilcas).
texts.en:
Delfina continues to sell meals and now with her sales stall, things are going excellently. She is infinitely grateful to all those investors who helped with the previous loan, which helped her expand her business capital. Now, on this opportunity she requires a new loan to purchase more inputs, such as, for example, rice, sugar, beans, cooking oil, and other items.

Delfina was born in the community of Uscarmaca but lives in the Challabamba district. (The District of Challabamba is located in Paucartambo province of the Department of Cusco, Peru.) She is 40 years old, married, and the fruit of this union is 6 children. (The community of Uscamarca is located in Santo Tomas district of Chumbivilcas province.)

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, noodles, oil, and other items, for preparing meals to sell.

loans.name: Jumwa

texts.en: Jumwa is married and has nine children, none of whom is in school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped-in water, and her greatest monthly expense is food. For the last eight years, she has earned a living by selling charcoal from her home to her neighbors. Her biggest challenge is the high cost of transportation, and she hopes someday soon to be able to sell firewood as well as charcoal. She is requesting this loan in order to buy 10 sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers. She decided to join Yehu to secure financial support for her business.

loans.use: to purchase 10 sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is married and has been blessed with seven children, all whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She cites food and school fees for her children to be her major challenge.  She has sold fried potatoes for four years to her neighbors and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation from the market to her place of operation. 

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase sacks of potatoes for preparation of the food for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of potatoes for preparation

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe is married and a mother of four children, all of whom attend school.  She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family.  For the past years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling household consumables for resale. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and high cost of transportation in the business.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, beans and paraffin for cooking. She joined Yehu because of favorable loaning policies

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, beans and paraffin for cooking.

loans.name: Drita

texts.en:
Drita is a villager and a married mother of four school-aged children, who has been selling baby calves and raw milk for the past seventeen years to locals.
Drita is requesting a loan to cover the newly-built barn. 

Here is what Drita said during her interview with the loan officer: “I have been enjoying so far the livestock and the daily routine of waking up at 5am to milk the animals, fill the bottles with milk for sale, take out the animals to graze, clean up the stable, eat a quick breakfast and walk up the road to reach the transportation van called “furgon” here in Albania, that goes to the city of my destination and go door-to-door to sell the orders of milk to my established clientele. During the cold winters is hard though, because we are located in the northern part of the country where the winter is extremely cold and snowy.”

loans.use: To cover the newly built barn

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with seven children, with three of her children in school and the rest finished. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past six years, she has operated a food kiosk business, selling wheat flour, maize flour, and cooking fat to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned high cost of seasonality as her major challenge. Fatuma dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 50,000, she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en: Jerry grows various varieties of rice in his field. He has been in this business for almost 10 years, and loves managing his business because it is his family's main source of income. He is married and has three children, all of whom are in school. His dream is to have a great harvest continuously so that he can continue send his children to school through college, but he struggles just to maintain his business and have good yield. Due to financial constraints, he is asking for a loan for PHP 50,000 to buy supplies for his farm. He believes that through this loan, he will able to attain his dream of having a successful farm and sending his children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicide for his rice farm.

loans.name: Rosabel

texts.en:
Rosabel is a new member of PMPC. She is 46 years old and lives in Aguada, Ozamiz City. She works as a teacher and also runs a sari-sari store located in Molave, for additional income. She has had this business for a year. She requested a loan to buy goods. She will purchase additional inventories of soft drinks, canned goods and soap for her sari-sari store. 
In the future Rosabel hopes to improve her living conditions to sustain the financial status of the family, and wants to have a good life when she retires.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventories of softdrinks, canned goods, soap, for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Gjergj

texts.en:
Gjergj, who is in his early sixties, lived up until the collapse of the communist regime in concentration camps and prisons, and those years were his worst, according to him. 
“I grew up in the concentration camps while I was a child, and once I grew up I was in and out of political prisons. Nothing good I can say about those years, but emotional struggle and being physically in pain every moment because of the severe beating up. That’s all. Looking around those walls and living in those cold and hot cells was a pain that I will take with me to grave.”
Gjergj is a married father of five young children, who lives in northern Albania. “I got married when I came out of the prison in 1991 and I was already a mature man according to the marriage age standards of our regioun,” said Gjergj laughing. “But anyhow, I have been blessed with five now and this is what is the most important,” he continued, saying he feels contented. 
Gjergj now wants to build a stable for his animals.

loans.use: to build a stable for the animals

loans.name: Malvis

texts.fr: malvis est une femme de 27 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. elle fait de la confection et habillement à domicile dans un quartier de la ville depuis 7 ans. dynamique et ambitieuse, elle sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son stock de matières premières en achetant les tissus pour faire un grand nombre de modèle afin d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaires. les bénéfices générés vont être injectés dans son activité et son capital d'une part et d'autre part pour subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants d'autre part
texts.en: Malvis is a 27 year old woman, married and mother to 2 children. She has been in the clothing business from home in a neighborhood of the town for 7 years. Dynamic and ambitious, she is requesting this loan to strengthen her stock of raw materials by buying fabric to make a large number of patterns in order to increase her sales. The profits generated will be partly reinvested in her business and her capital and partly used to meet the needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy raw materials (fabric).

loans.name: Celia Pastora

texts.es: Celia, es una madre de familia emprendedora. Habita en un barrio periférico de Managua, tiene una pulpería en su casa de habitación, con los ingresos de las ventas diarias reúne para los gastos de alimentos y estudios de su hijo quien es adolecente. Solicita un préstamo para la construcción de un cuarto para su hijito en su casa, que permitirá mejorar las condiciones de la vivienda para ellos.
texts.en:
Celia is an enterprising mother. She lives in a district on the outskirts of Managua and has a small grocery store in her home. With the income from her sales she has enough to cover the cost of food and her adolescent son's studies.

She is asking for a loan to build a room in her house for her young son, which will enable the family to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cement, iron, cinder blocks, sand and gravel.

loans.name: Manzura

texts.ru: Манзура трудолюбивая, честная и очень добрая женщина. У неё трое детей, которых она сама вырастила и воспитала.  Манзура более 25 лет занимается изготовлением лепёшек с последующей реализацией. После того как вышла замуж она была вынуждена помогать мужу зарабатывать деньги, всем известно, что 90-е годы были для всех очень сложными, на маленький доход мужа невозможно было прожить. Со слов Манзуры в те времена для неё началась чёрная полоса в ее жизни - муж тяжело заболел. Параллельно она работала в лепешечном цехе и ухаживала за мужем, растила детей.  После длительного срока болезни муж Манзуры скончался. Манзуре приходилось работать сутками недоедая и недосыпая у нее возникли долги перед поставщиками муки, острая нужда, материнская любовь к детям придавала ей дополнительные силы . Ее труды не пропали понапрасну она смогла собрать сбережения, расплатиться с долгами и выдать двоих дочерей замуж. Сейчас пришло время подумать о проведении свадебных мероприятий сына. Она планирует расширить свой бизнес и оборотный капитал, поэтому запрашивает займ в размере 12000 сомони для покупки муки для пополнения оборотного капитала. За займом обращается впервые, погашать займ планирует за счет доходов от лепешечного цеха.
texts.en:
Manzura is a hardworking, honest and very kind woman. She has three children, whom she raised and educated. For more than 25 years, Manzura has been engaged in producing flatbreads for subsequent sale. After she got married, she needed to help her husband to earn money. As we all know, the 90s were a very complex time and it was impossible to survive on her husband's small income. 

In Manzura's words, that time began a streak in her life -- her husband was seriously ill. In parallel, she was working in bakery shops while nursing her husband and raising the children. After a long period of illness, Manzura's husband passed away. Manzura had to work around the clock without food and without sleep because she had debts to suppliers for flour and pressing needs. But a mother's love for her children gave her extra strength. Her work has not gone in vain; she was able to collect savings, pay off debts, and offer her two daughters in marriage. 

Now the time has come to think about putting on a wedding for her son.

She is planning to expand her business and working capital, so she is requesting a loan of 12,000 somoni to buy flour for working capital. She is applying for a loan for the first time and plans to repay it with the proceeds from the bakery shop.

loans.use: to buy flour for increasing her working capital

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en: Raquel is married and has four children. She is 41 years old and lives in Bocator, Tangub City. Her husband is a farmer. Raquel runs a general store to earn a living. She's been in this business for more than three years. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP with this business. Raquel is thankful to Gata Daku MPC for giving them access to microfinance services that help to improve their living situation. Recently, she borrowed 12,000 PHP to purchase dairy products, canned goods, and bottled products to sell. In 2011, Raquel joined GDMPC. In the future, Raquel hopes to expand and improve the business.

loans.use: to purchase dairy products, canned goods and bottled products to sell

loans.name: Mbuja

texts.en: Mbuja is married and has three children; two are in school and one is still too young. He owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. For the past six years, he has operated a charcoal selling business and a food kiosk business from his home, selling to local neighbors. His major business challenge is transportation. He dreams of establishing a wholesale business store. With the KES100,000 loan he has requested, he would like to purchase charcoal, cooking oil, sugar, cereals, such as rice, beans and maize for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal, cooking oil, sugar, cereals, such as rice, beans and maize for resale.

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula is a divorced woman with five children.  Three are in school and the rest are adults.  She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past twenty years, she has operated a dumplings-making business and fish business, selling to market dwellers and passersby.  She cites seasonality to be her major challenge. She dreams of expanding and establishing a restaurant in the future.

With the Kshs 15,000, she wants to purchase fish, cooking oil, sugar and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish, cooking oil, sugar and wheat flour

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married mother of seven children, five of whom go to school. They live at their own house which has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other retail operators in her business. 

With Kshs 50,000, she wants to purchase cooking oil, maize flour, wheat flour and rice for resale. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, maize flour, wheat flour and rice for resale.

loans.name: Amma

texts.ru: Амма умная и мудрая женщина. Ей 65 лет. Она несколько лет назад похоронила своего мужа. Амма вдова. Она имеет 4 детей. Дети совершеннолетние и семейные. Несмотря на это она должна работать и зарабатывать деньги, так как семья большая и у нее много внуков. Она более 10 лет занимается купле продажей лекарств. Она продает лекарства в аптеке. Амма работает честно и борется за здоровый образ жизни. Амме помогает ее невестка по введению бизнеса. Она хочет развевать бизнес дальше и получать больше дохода. От полученного дохода она планирует улучшить условию проживания. Создать условию для образования внуков. Амма запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 долларов США для покупки лекарств. Она ждет вашу  доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Amma is a clever and wise woman. She is 65 years old. Amma is a widow; several years ago, she buried her husband. She has four children. Her children are grown and have their own families. Despite this, she needs to work and earn money, since the family is large and she has many grandchildren. 

For more than ten years, she has been involved in selling medicine. She sells medicine at a pharmacy. Amma is an honest worker and fights for a healthy lifestyle. Amma helps her daughter-in-law in running the business. She wants to develop the business further and to earn more revenue. From the earned revenue, she plans to improve her living conditions and to create conditions for the education of her grandchildren. 

Amma is requesting a loan of USD $3,000 to buy medicine.

loans.use: to buy medicine for increasing working capital

loans.name: Rano

texts.ru:
Рано трудолюбивая женщина с прекрасной душой. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Дети не совершеннолетние и не имею источника дохода. Рано и ее семья живут очень бедно. Ее муж получает маленькую зарплату. Рано более 5 лет занимается купле продажи старых одежд. Она покупает старые вещи со столицы и продает на рынке северного региона. Рано хочет развевать бизнес и получать больше дохода. Рано запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для покупки товара. 
Она кредитуется 3 цикл. Она имеет хорошую кредитную историю. Рано ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Rano is a hardworking woman with a lovely soul. She is married and is raising three children. The children are not yet grown and have no source of income. Rano and her family live very poorly. Her husband receives a small salary. 

For more than five years, Rano has been buying and selling used clothing. She buys used things from the capital and sells them in the markets around the northern region. 

Rano wants to develop her business and to receive more revenue. Rano is requesting a loan of 2,000 somoni to buy goods. 

She is on her third loan cycle. She has a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy clothes for increasing working capital

loans.name: Estellita

texts.en: Estellita is a 42 year-old married woman from Talibon,Bohol. She has four children, ages 16,13,11 and 9 years old, respectively. She engages in fishing. She sells fish to earn a living. She has been fishing for more than 10 years.  Due to lack of finances, Estellita requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy paint, plywood and epoxy (adhesive) for the renovation of the motorboat, to improve her fishing activity.  Estellita hopes that she can finance all her children's college education to become professionals someday.

loans.use: to buy paint, plywood and epoxy (adhesive)

loans.name: Beka

texts.en:
Beka, age 20, is single and lives in the small village of Gelati with his grandmother. Beka’s mother lives and works in the capital city and visits her family members rarely. Beka and his granny run a small scale agricultural business. In particular, they cultivate land where maize is grown. Beka also produces hay which is used for feeding his livestock: a cow and a pig.  Beka works hard all day long and wishes to get ahead.
Several times, he has requested loans from local financial institutions in order to start up trading business, but without any success. His loan requests were rejected because of lack of experience in the business, which is usually demanded by local financial institutions. His loan request has now been approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-start-up credit, with soft conditions to country's vulnerable poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as 'high-risk borrowers' because of low income. 
With the received credit, Beka plans to purchase clothing and household items from wholesalers in the capital city open market and then sell these items from his house. After investing the funds in his business, Beka hopes to generate additional revenue and invest the profits to further develop his business. Beka’s grandmother will assist him for running the business. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to start trading in clothing and household items

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario is a married man with a child. He owns a farm where he plants and harvests rice to sell. He has managed farming for over five years. Mario’s income for every crop depends on the weather conditions. Sometimes, it is also depends on the farm inputs applied, like fertilizers.

Mario has been a member of ASKI and KIVA loan program for over three years, and he is now asking for a loan of PHP39,000 to buy fertilizers and herbicides that he will apply in growing rice. He hopes to get an abundant harvest out from it in the near future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides for his growing rice.

loans.name: Firuza

texts.ru: Фируза добрая и трудолюбивая женщина. Ей 45 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Дети совершеннолетние. Фируза и ее муж занимаются переработкой абрикоса. Ее муж имеет 1 га абрикосового сада. В этом году они собрали 2.5 тонны урожая. Они реализуют товар на местном рынке. Фируза всегда мечтала, чтобы ее дети получили высшее образование. Ее сын учится в университете, и она должна оплатить за учебный договор своего сына, но не имеет достаточно денег. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора сына в университете. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Firuza is a kind and hardworking woman. She is 45 years old. She is married and has three children. The children are grown. Firuza and her husband are engaged in apricot production. Her husband has a one-hectare apricot orchard. This year, they have collected 2.5 tons of crop. They sell goods at the local market. 

Firuza always dreamed that her children would receive a higher education. Her son is a university student, and she needs to pay his tuition, but does not have enough money. 

She is requesting a loan to pay tuition for her son at the university.

loans.use: to pay for her son’s tuition at the university

loans.name: Farzona

texts.ru: Фарзоне 21 года. Она довольно милая, спокойная и доброжелательная девушка. Она не замужем и живет с мамой, сестрой и братом. Фарзона умная и образованная девушка. Она работает со студенческой скамьи. Данное время она работает в лаборатории лаборанткой. Полученную зарплату она использует для благосостояния семьи. Фарзона  и ее семья недавно сделали ремонт квартиры. Теперь она хочет купить кухонный гарнитур для кухни, так как они не имели кухонный гарнитур и раньше. Фарзона запрашивает займ на сумму 800 долларов США для покупки кухонного гарнитура. Это 2 цикл займа. Первый займ она погасила во время. Она очень честная девушка. Фарзона ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Farzona is 21 years old. She is a quite nice, quiet and friendly young woman. She is single and lives with her mother, sister and brother. Farzona is a clever and educated woman. She has been working since her student days. She is currently working as a lab assistant. She uses the resulting salary for the well-being of the family. 

Farzona and her family recently made repairs to their apartment. Now she wants to buy a kitchen set as they did not have one previously. Farzona is requesting a loan of US $800 to buy a kitchen set. 

This is her second loan cycle. She paid back her first loan on time. She is a very honest young woman.

loans.use: to buy a kitchen set for her household

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is a married woman who has four children. Jocelyn is 39 years old and resides at Garang, Tangub City.  Her husband is a carpenter, while Jocelyn runs a general store, selling a variety of products to earn a living. She has been in the business for four years. Each month, she earns 4,000 PHP doing this type of business. Recently, she requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional products like candies, biscuits, noodles and spices.  Jocelyn joined GDMPC in 2009. In the future, Jocelyn wants to build a house and to support her children in finishing their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, maize flour, salt, pens and books to sell.

loans.name: 03.02.08 Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Hồng is 42 years old and is married with two children. She lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. She works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. Hồng has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In 2012, Hồng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She is the group leader of the 03.02.08 Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of three members. Hồng has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. With her business profit, Hồng hopes her business will do well, her family will be healthy and happy, and her children will do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru:
Мавлуда 48-летняя замужняя женщина, имеет двух детей и проживает со своей семьей в городе Чкаловске в Согдийской области Таджикистана. Ее сыну 21 год, а дочери 19 лет. Муж Мавлуды является представителем Ассоциации предпринимателей Согдийской области. 
Мавлуда профессиональная швея. Ее стаж работы составляет 15 лет. Она работала швеей на швейной фабрике. У нее накопился огромный опыт и теперь она хотела бы начать собственное швейное дело. Мавлуда арендовала на бессрочный срок помещение, расположенное на рынке города. Она собирается использовать помещение в качестве ателье. Мавлуда просит кредит, чтобы купить две швейные машинки, столы и стулья. Она будет вышивать по три платья в день, а также будет брать заказы на шитье костюмов и брюк. Ее ателье будет предоставлять услуги с 8:00 утра до 18:00 вечера. Мавлуда надеется на вашу поддержку в открытии ее швейного дела. В будущем Мавлуда планирует расширить новую деятельность и заняться одновременно вышиванием тамбурным швом.
texts.en:
Mavluda is a 48-year-old, married woman, has two children and resides with her family in the town of Chkalovsk in the Sughd region of Tajikistan. Her son is 21 and her daughter is 19. Mavluda's husband is a representative of the Association of Entrepreneurs of the Sughd region. 

Mavluda is a professional seamstress. She has 15 years of work experience. She works as a seamstress in a clothing factory. She has accumulated a wealth of experience and now would like to start her own sewing business. Mavluda rented a premises for an indefinite period, which is located in the town market. She will use the premises as an atelier. 

Mavluda is requesting a loan to buy two sewing machines, tables and chairs. She will embroider three dresses per day, and will also be taking orders for sewing suits and trousers. Her atelier will provide services from 8:00 in the morning until 18:00 at night. 

In the future, Mavluda plans to expand her new activities and to get involved at the same time in stitch embroidery.

loans.use: to buy two sewing machines, tables and chairs to open an atelier

loans.name: Maria Paulina

texts.es:
La señora  María  de 57 años de edad, vive con su hija  en su casa de habitación, ubicada en una comunidad de Nacaome al sur de Honduras, se dedica a la venta de cuajada, mantequilla y queso desde hace 20 años.
Doña María es una persona muy trabajadora, sus clientes son las personas que ella visita en diferentes partes de Nacaome, Esta muy contenta de poder comenzar a trabajar con Prima.
Doña María Solicita está solicitando el préstamo para compra de leche para elaborar el queso, mantequilla y la cuajada, tiene productos encargados por sus clientes y desea tener el capital para invertirlo en su negocio y poder generarse ingresos  que le permitan mejorar un poco su economía familiar. 
Doña María su sueño es poder aumentar más su clientela y mejorar su calidad de vida.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Julio del 2013
texts.en:
María, 57, lives with her daughter in her house in a community in Nacaome, in the south of Honduras.  She has earned a living for 20 years selling curd, butter, and cheese.

María's a very hardworking person.  Her customers are people she visits in different parts of Nacaome.  She's very happy to be able to start working with Prisma.

María's requesting this loan to buy milk to make cheese, butter, and curd.  She has products ordered by her customers and she wants to have the capital to invest in the business and be able to generate income to improve her family finances.

María's dream is to be able to increase her clientele and improve her quality of life.

San Lorenzo, Honduras, July 2013

loans.use: to buy milk

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica lives in Pangabuan, Tangub City with her family. She is married and a 31-year-old mother of two children. Her husband works as a seaman while she runs a general store to earn an income of her own to make a living. 

In 2012, she joined Gata Daku MPC and recently, she borrowed a loan from Gata Daku MPC to buy feed, bottled products and canned goods for sale. She hopes to expand her business and to be able to renovate their house to have better living conditions in the near future.

loans.use: to buy feed, bottled products and canned goods for sale

loans.name: Nyakaina Women Group

texts.en:
Joseph is a 38-year-old married man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the retail business for 14 years, alongside earning a salary and farming to boost his income. Joseph started his business to sustain himself and hopes to build a commercial house. However, debtors and price fluctuations are his challenges. 

Joseph is requesting a loan to buy soap and sugar to sell. He is a member of the above-mentioned group, where each member guarantees the others in accessing a loan.

loans.use: to buy soap and sugar  to sell.

loans.name: Leguarda

texts.en:
Leguarda peacefully lives in her village of San Bonifacio. She has managed her rice farm for many years. Aside from this, she also engages in a hog-raising business to earn more income. Through farming and hog-raising, Leguarda has given her family a better way of living.

She would like to borrow 28,000 PHP to buy fertilizers such as manure and to cover the costs of farm maintenance. She hopes to generate a good harvest this coming cropping season. She will use the profit to further expand her farming, and some will be utilized for savings and other necessities.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Paso Del Guerrero Group

texts.es: Patricio, (quien aparece en la fotografía de sweater café claro y justo debajo del cartel que dice ARTEMAPUCHE), vive en Villarrica, IX Región de la Araucanía, en donde forma parte del Banco Comunal Paso del Guerrero. Los socios de este Banco son todos comerciantes pero de distintos rubros como lo son la venta de lana, leña, comida, empanadas, calzones rotos y artesanías varias. Patricio tiene una tienda, en la que vende artesanía mapuche, frazadas y lanas, comenzó su negocio hace 10 años con mucho sacrificio y vendiendo telares que es lo que más le gusta. Desafíos siempre ha tenido, pero lo que más quiere y anhela es poder tener la opción de tener un lugar propio, ser dueño de un terreno para poder tener su negocio y no tener que arrendar. Con el crédito que está solicitando debe comprar lana para poder hacer sus telares y frazadas, canastos de mimbre y de boqui. Espera que en este ciclo le vaya muy bien, ya que ha tenido bastantes pedidos y eso lo mantiene muy contento. Lo que más le gusta de trabajar con Fondo Esperanza ha sido la confianza que se tiene con la gente.
texts.en:
Patricio (who appears in the photo in a pale brown jumper just below the 'ARTEMAPUCHE' sign) lives in Villarica, IX region of Araucanía, where he is a member of the Paso de Guerrero communal bank. The members of the bank are all in business but sell different things such as wool, firewood, food, empanadas [typical pastry snack], doughnuts and various types of crafts. 

Patricio has a shop where he sells Mapuche crafts, blankets and wools. He started his business 10 years ago with a lot of personal sacrifice, selling woven goods which is what he likes best. He has always had challenges but what he really wants and longs for is to have the option of having a place of his own, to be the owner of a piece of land where he can have his business and not have to rent.
