With the loan he is asking for he needs to buy wool to make his weavings and blankets and baskets made from wicker and 'boqui' [a type of creeping plant whose stems are woven into baskets]. He hopes everything will go well for him with this loan, as he has had a lot of orders and that makes him very happy. What he likes most about working with Fondo Esperanza is the trust they place in people.

loans.use: to buy wool and baskets made from wicker and 'boqui'.

loans.name: Mimoza

texts.en:
Mimoza is seeking your help again to stock up on second-hand inventory items to resell.

At the same time she would like to thank you all for the generosity you have showed previously.

loans.use: To buy used clothing and shoes to resell

loans.name: Shayimkan

texts.ru: Шайымкан 55 лет,  замужем, имеет 3 детей. Дети взрослые, проживают отдельно, только самый младший проживает с родителями и помогает по хозяйству. Супруг работает водителем, получает зарплату. Сама Шайымкан работает в швейном цеху. Дополнительным источником дохода является-овцеводство, Шайымкан более 5 лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с 8,000 сом KGS. Шайымкан трудолюбивая, благодаря ее трудолюбию, ее ежемесячная прибыль составляет 5000 сом KGS. Благодаря ее упорству она достигла хороших результатов и на сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве имеется: 1 дойная корова, 2 теленка, 1 кобыла и 10 овец. В целях увеличения поголовья скота Шайымкан обратилась в микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом, в сумме 60 000 сом(KGS)  на покупку овец для дальнейшего откорма и перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Шайымкан планирует направить на ремонт своего дома.
texts.en:
Shayimkan is 55 years old, married, and has three children. The children are gown and live separately; only the youngest lives with his parents and helps around the house. Her husband works as a driver and receives a salary. For her part, Shayimkan works in a sewing shop. Raising sheep is a source of additional income. Shayimkan has been engaged in raising livestock for more than five years, started with 8,000 som KGS. Shayimkan is hardworking and thanks to her hard work, her monthly income is 5,000 som KGS. 

Thanks to her perseverance, she has achieved good results and today has on her farm: one dairy cow, two calves, one mare, and ten sheep. In order to increase the number of her livestock, Shayimkan turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 60,000 som (KGS) to purchase sheep for further fattening and resale. 

With income from the loan, Shayimkan plans do repairs on her home.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Francisca's Group

texts.en:
Francisca's group is starting their 3rd loan cycle with ID-Ghana. The group is made up of two members and it is led by Francisca A. The businesses that the members have are varied and include slippers and electrical appliances.

The loan they are requesting will benefit small business owners like Francisca A. She joined ID-Ghana three years ago at the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. Currently she has a business selling slippers. 

She is requesting for a loan amount of GHS 1000 to increase her merchandise and purchase more slippers. She will acquire them from wholesale vendors at the central market and later sell them at her sales space. This type of work allows her to generate income to support her family since she is married and has two children. She is standing on the left of the photograph.

loans.use: purchase more slippers from wholesale vendors at the central market and later sell them at her sales space.

loans.name: Filomena Gladys

texts.es: La Sra. Filomena  sigue con la misma actividad de la confección de ropa  cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de variedad de telas por mayor, como también tiene una tienda de barrio que atiende a la par de confeccionar sus prendas  en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de una maquina over  ya que tiene mucha demanda y tiene pedidos que entregar como también para la compra de mercadería para surtir su tienda de barrio se siente feliz y agradecida con los prestamistas de Kiva ya que le permiten crecer en su actividad.
texts.en: Filomena continues with the same activity sewing clothes.  She relates that she did well with her previous loan since she used it to buy a variety of fabrics at wholesale.  Since she also has a neighborhood store she runs alongside her clothing business on this occasion she’s asking for the loan to buy an overlock sewing machine because demand is high and she has orders to fill and also to buy merchandise to stock her neighborhood store.  She feels happy and grateful to Kiva lenders because they make it possible for her to grow in her activity.

video.title: Kiva Borrower FILOMENA GLADYS  from Bolivia

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and merchandise.

loans.name: Dominga Melania

texts.es:
La señora Dominga  es  Casada, comerciante, con 4 hijos  unos en edad escolar y otros que laboran con ella, a los que tiene el deber de mantener sus estudios, ella con una hija se dedica a su propio negocio como es la pulpería y la venta de cuajadas y sus derivados en chichigalpa por la mañana, combinando las labores familiares de esa manera ejerciéndolas por espacio de 25 años la venta de cuajadas y 14 la pulpería,
Desde que inicio su negocio la señora Dominga en las calles se esforzó por mejorar y hoy poder mantener su núcleo familiar, una de las necesidades es de comprar productos para la pulpería como: Arroz, Azúcar, maíz, aceite, frijol y semolina, por eso visito ceprodel para ser beneficiada con financiamiento, para seguir comercializando y satisfacer la demanda y obtener más ingresos.
texts.en:
Dominga is married with 4 children, one of whom is of school age and the others, who need to keep up with their studies, work with her. Dominga is a businesswoman and with one of her daughters she runs her own grocery business and sells curd cheese and its derivatives in Chichigalpa in the mornings. The family have been working together in this way for 25 years selling curd cheese and 14 years in the grocery store. Since starting her business Dominga has worked hard in the streets to make things better and now to maintain her immediate family.

One of the things she needs is to buy products for the grocery store such as rice, sugar, corn, oil, beans and semolina. For this reason she visited Ceprodel to ask for a loan so she can carry on trading, meet the demand for her products and generate more income.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, sugar, corn and semolina.

loans.name: Bakhtygul

texts.ru: Бактыгул 51 год, замужем и имеет 3 детей (2 сына и 1 дочь). Бактыгул имеет среднее образование, работала в районной почте-почтальоном. В данное время на пенсии. Супруг работает в средней школе- учителем музыки, Бактыгул водит на работу мужа и приводит с работы, так как он инвалид, не видит с рождения. Двое старших детей проживают отдельно, самый младший живет с родителями и помогает по хозяйству. С 1996 года Бактыгул начала свой бизнес в откорме скота. Стартовав с 4,000 сом (KGS), на сегодняшний день её хозяйство приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 2,000 сом (KGS). В хозяйстве у Бактыгул имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 2 бычка, 15 овец, 10 коз.  Доходы от бизнеса Бактыгул вложила в оплату за образование своих детей. Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Бактыгул обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на закупку скота. Доходы от кредита Бактыгул планирует использовать для увеличения поголовья скота и намерена в будущем построить дом для сына.
texts.en:
Bakhtygul is 51 years old, married and has three children (two sons and a daughter). Bakhtygul has a high school education and worked as district post delivery worker. At this time, she is retired. 

Her husband works in a high school as a music teacher. Bakhtygul takes her husband to work and leads him home from work since he is disabled and has been unable to see since birth. The two older children live separately and the youngest lives with his parents and helps around the farm. 

In 1996, Bakhtygul started her own business fattening livestock. Starting with 4,000 som (KGS), today her farm brings in a monthly income of 2,000 som (KGS). On her farm, Bakhtygul has: two dairy cows, two bulls, 15 sheep, and ten goats. Bakhtygul invest income from the business to pay for the education of her children.

To further develop her farm, Bakhtygul turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 80,000 som (KGS) to buy livestock. Bakhtygul plans to use income from the loan to increase the number of livestock and intends in the future to build a home for her son.

loans.use: to buy gobies

loans.name: Jyparkul

texts.ru: Жыпаркул 35 лет, замужем, многодетная мать имеет 4 детей (1 дочь и 3 сына). Образование-среднее. После окончания средней школы Жыпаркул вышла замуж совсем в юном возрасте. С 1997 года занимается сельским хозяйством- животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы 15,000 сом KGS. Супруг Жыпаркул помогает ей по хозяйству. Благодаря упорному труду и терпеливому характеру Жыпаркул, на сегодняшний день она имеет хорошее  хозяйство: 3 дойные коровы и 10 овец. Также в наличии имеет 3,0 ГА поливной земли, на которой ежегодно выращивает фасоль. Прибыль позволила Жыпаркул размножить скот в домашнем хозяйстве и тем самым улучшить семейное благосостояние. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жыпаркул обратилась в Микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы. Доходы от кредита Жыпаркул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества скота, а также намерена отремонтировать дом, в котором она проживает вместе со своей семьей.
texts.en:
Jyparkul is 35 years old, married, and the mother of many children. She has four children (one daughter and three sons). She has a high school education. After graduating from high school, Jyparkul got married at quite a young age. Since 1997, she has been involved in agriculture - raising animals and crops - starting with a sum of 15,000 som KGS. Jyparkul's husband helps her around the farm. 

Thanks to the hard work and patient nature of Jyparkul, she today has a good farm: three dairy cows and ten sheep. She also has available 3.0 hectares of irrigated land, on which she grows beans annually. Profits allowed Jyparkul to propagate livestock on her homestead and thus to improve the family's well-being. In order to further develop her homestead, Jyparkul turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 40,000 som (KGS) to buy a cow. 

Jyparkul plans to invest income from the loan to further increase the number of livestock, and also intends to do repairs on the home in which she lives with her family.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Alymkan

texts.ru: Алымкан 60 лет, замужем, многодетная мать, имеет 5 детей (2 сына и 3 дочери). Дети взрослые, проживают отдельно, только самый младший проживает с родителями и помогает по хозяйству. Супруг помогает по хозяйству.  Алымкан с 1990 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с 6,000 сом KGS. Алымкан трудолюбивая, ответственная, благодаря ее трудолюбию, ее ежемесячная прибыль составляет 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря ее упорству она достигла хороших результатов и на сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 3 теленка, 20 овец, 10 коз. В целях увеличения поголовья скота Алымкан обратилась в микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом, в сумме 100 000 сом(KGS) на покупку овец и коров для дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Алымкан планирует в будущем направить на покупку дома для дочери.
texts.en:
Alymkan is 60 years old, married, and the mother of many children. She has five children (two sons and three daughters). The children are grown and live separately. Only the youngest lives with the parents and helps around the farm. Her husband helps around the farm. 

Since 1990, Alymkan has been involved in raising animals, starting with 6,000 сом KGS. Alymkan is hardworking and responsible, and because of her hard work, her monthly income consists of 10,000 som KGS. Thanks to her effort, she achieved good results and on her farm today has: three dairy cows, three calves, 20 sheep, and ten goats. 

In order to expand the count of livestock, Alymkan turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep and cows to further increase the count of livestock. 

With income from the loan, Alymkan plans in the future to make a purchase of a new home for her daughter.

loans.use: to buy cows and sheep

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn lives in Bocator, Tangub City with her family. She is 45 years old and married with four children. Her husband works as a security guard in a private company to help earn an income for the family, Evelyn runs a general store selling goods in the local community. She has been in this business for more than two years to make a living.

 In 2009, she joined Gata Daku MPC and recently, she borrowed a loan to buy additional grocery items, dried fish and rice. She plans to expand her business and save a portion of her generated income for the education of her children. She hopes to have better living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items, dried fish and rice

loans.name: 3.04.328.16.thiệu Phúc Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hoa works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby livestock cattle to raise and sell in the future.

Hoa is 34 years old and she is married, with two children. She is the group leader of the 3.04.328.16.Thiệu Phúc solidarity group, which consists of five members. Hoa lives with two dependents and works in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2011, Hoa joined the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid two loans from the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women. Hoa has been involved in this business for more than ten years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hoa hopes for her children to find good jobs, to maintain successful businesses, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock cattle to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La cliente es de la ciudad de Machala.  Empezó con esta actividad tiempo atrás cuando un familiar la alentó a que se involucre regalándole la inscripción para que pueda laborar con la línea Yanbal.  Trabaja sola desde la mañana hasta las 3 pm, ya que tiene también la responsabilidad de cuidar a su hijo.  Al momento está separada de su cónyuge, ya que recibía mucho maltrato de parte de él.  Han pasado 7 años desde su separación.  Tiene una niña de 4 años que asiste al jardín fiscal de su barrio.  Ahora necesita invertir el crédito en la compra de productos de belleza para su comercialización.
texts.en: The client is from the city of Machala.  She started this activity some time ago when a relative encouraged her to get involved in it and gave her the enrollment so that she could work with the Yanbal brand.  She works alone from the morning until 3pm because she’s also responsible for her son’s care.  She’s separated from her spouse at the moment because he mistreated her very much.  She’s been separated for 7 years.  She has a 4-year-old daughter attending the local neighborhood Kindergarten.  She now needs to use the loan to buy beauty products to sell.

loans.use: to buy beauty products and cosmetics.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente reside en la ciudad de Machala.  Empezó tiempo atrás con la venta de billeteras y correas, lo cual le gustó mucho y le ha resultado positivo hasta ahora.  Trabaja solo todo el día.  No es casado ni tiene hijos.  En el futuro le gustaría ampliar y crecer con este negocio, para poder llegar a tener su casa propia.  Al momento necesita el dinero del préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de camisas, blusas y toallas para su comercialización.
texts.en:
The client lives in the city of Machala.  He started some time ago selling belts and wallets which he liked very much and which has been positive to date.  He works alone all day; he’s not married and has no children.

In future, he’d like to expand and grow with this business in order to own a house.  At the moment he needs the loan money to buy shirts, blouses and towels to sell.

loans.use: to buy towels, shirts and blouses.

loans.name: Dúo Solidario Luz De La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
DUO SOLIDARIO LUZ DE LA ESPERANZA
Doña Fidelina es originaria de Tecpan, tiene 36 años de edad, tiene bajo su responsabilidad a sus tres hijos (1 mujer y 2 varones), ella se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos típicos a mano y a la crianza de animales.
El esposo de ella trabaja como chofer de un bus  que transporta pasajeros de tecpan a otra colonia y con el sueldo que gana ayuda a mantener a su familia
El sueño de doña Fidelina es ampliar su negocio, así podrá obtener mejores ganancias y mandar a sus hijos a la escuela para un futuro mejor.  
Ha tenido tres créditos KIVA y con la puntualidad que ella tiene en sus pagos  no ha caído en mora, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboracion y venta de tejidos tipicos.
texts.en:
Light of Hope Duo

Fidelina is from Tecpan.  She’s 36-years-old and has three children she’s responsible for (one girl and two boys).  She works manufacturing traditional fabric by hand and raising animals.  Her husband works driving a bus that transports passengers from Tecpan to another neighborhood and helps support the family with the salary he earns.

Fidelina’s dream is to enlarge her business so she can earn higher profits and send her children to school for a better future.  She’s had three Kiva loans and thanks to her punctual payments has never been delinquent.  She’s asking for this loan to buy raw materials used to manufacture and sell traditional fabrics.

loans.use: to buy raw materials.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente vive en la zona de la Isla Trinitaria en Guayaquil.  Tiene una profesión de profesional independiente de construcción desde hace 15 años, la cual la aprendió de sus amigos del barrio.  Trabaja solo desde las 8 am hasta las 6 pm todos los días.  El cliente es soltero, no tiene hijos y lamentablemente tiene a su madre ciega.  Desea en un futuro poder construír la casa para ella, para darle una mejor forma de vida.  Desea invertir el dinero del crédito en la compra de herramientas y artículos de construcción para su labor diaria.
texts.en:
The client lives in Guayaquil’s Isla Trinitaria zone.  He’s been an independent construction professional for 15 years having learned from his neighborhood friends.  He works alone from 8am until 6pm every day.  He’s single, has no children and sadly his mother is blind.  

He’d like in future to build a house for her to give her a better way of living.  He wants to use the loan money to buy tools and building supplies for his daily work.

loans.use: to buy construction tools.

loans.name: Nemesia Isabel

texts.es: La señora Nemesia es acompañada, maestra de educación primaria, la cual imparte clases en la comunidad  donde habita enseñándole el pan del saber a muchos niños de su comunidad por generaciones, su núcleo familia está compuesto por 3 hijos a los que tiene el deber de mantenerlos, la necesidad principal que la señora nemesia tiene  es la de mejorar su vivienda la que amerita tal inversión,  por tal razón visito a ceprodel para solicitar un financiamiento y de esa manera logar el objetivo, este  será utilizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como: Zinc, arena, cemento, bloques decorados, acarreo y pago de mano de obra. La que le brindara mejores condiciones y nivel de vida, una vez efectuada la obra.
texts.en:
Nemesia is married.  She's an elementary school teacher in the community where she lives, giving the gift of knowledge to a lot of children over the generations.

Her nuclear family is made up of three children, whom she supports.  Nemesia's main need is to improve her home, so she went to CEPRODEL to request a loan to achieve her goal.

She'll use the loan to buy construction supplies such as sheets of metal, sand, cement, and decorated cinderblocks, and to pay for hauling and labor.  Once the work is done she'll have better living conditions and a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies and to pay for hauling and labor

loans.name: Pailino

texts.es:
El socio continúa con el negocio de cortar árboles, con la construcción de casas y con la agricultura, él tiene un pequeño terrero agrícola donde siembra papa, olluco, maíz, haba y otras cosas más. Desde muy joven aprendió sobre  la agricultura pues sus padres le enseñaron, el socio agradece infinitamente a todos los inversionistas que le apoyaron con el préstamo anterior pues le ayudo con el capital del negocio entonces en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

El socio nació en la comunidad de Uscarmaca pero vive en el distrito Challabamba. (El distrito de Challabamba está ubicado en la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, Perú). Él tiene 42 años de edad y es casado y fruto de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos.  (La comunidad de Uscamarca está ubicado en el distrito de Santo Tomas de la provincia de Chumbivilcas, Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
This borrower continues to have his own business felling trees, building houses and farming. He has a small plot of land on which he grows potatoes, ulluco, corn, beans and other crops. He learnt how to farm at an early age from his parents. He is very grateful to all the investors who supported him with the last loan as it helps him with his business capital so this time he needs the loan to buy seeds and fertilizers. 

The member was born in the community of Uscarmaca but he lives in the Challabamba district (the Challabamba district is in the Paucartambo province in the Cusco region of Peru). He is 42 years old and is married with four children. (The community of Uscamarca is in the Santo Tomas district in the province of Chumbivilcas, Cusco, Peru).

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Levie

texts.en:
Levie is married and lives happily with her family in their place. She owns and operates a rice farm and there she plants and harvests rice for sale. With her husband, their rice field is being managed well. Income from it goes towards their children's needs in school. 

Levie wishes for a loan of PHP 25,000 to pay for labor costs in land preparation and buy fertilizers for her crop. She hopes to grow a plentiful harvest and get a better yield in order to prosper in their living situation.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs in land preparation and buy fertilizers for her crops

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a 35-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol, a mother of two children ages 10 and 3. She engages in fishing. She sells fish as a source of livelihood. Aside from fishing she also engages in seaweed farming to gain more income. 

To continue her daily livelihood activity, Evelyn has requested a loan of 7000 PHP to buy paint (for the motorboat), fishing net and  more seaweed seedlings.  In the future, Evelyn hopes that she will be able to manage both her businesses well so as to continue to send her children to school, especially  for a college education.

loans.use: to buy paint (for the motorboat),  fishing net and  more seaweed seedlings

loans.name: Specioza

texts.en: Specioza used the previous loan to buy beer to sell. She is a 38-year-old married woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She has been running a pub for three years. She started with 300,000 UGX in capital; now her working capital is more than two million. Her main hardship is high taxes. She is working hard to ensure good profits so she can attain her goals of buying land to grow crops and educating her children. Specioza intends to use the loan to buy beer and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy beer and soap to sell.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick has been buying and selling old motor vehicles for more than ten years. He is based in the Kongowea area near Mombasa, Kenya where he also resides. He is a married man, blessed with three children aged 10, 5 and 2. Two of his children attend school. 

Patrick wants to venture into the motorcycle transport business. He learned about Milango through friends and he now seeks a loan to buy a motorbike to accomplish the goal. The challenge that he faces is raising funds to start this business from his current earnings. The earnings from the business will allow him to improve his standard of living and take care of his family.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Nhanh

texts.en:
Nhanh is 30 years old and a mother of one little child, residing in Sampov Meas district of Pursat Province. Her main source of income is from growing rice. She also owns a small-scale grocery selling business while her husband works for others for a fee as supplementary income. These are the businesses that she has been in for 10 years. 

Nhanh is not a first time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). After the successful loan which she has repaid completely, she can sustain her business seasonally. Now, she feels confident in taking a new loan to keep improving her business via potash and rice seed purchasing plus paying labor costs. She hopes to make more income and expand both her businesses to a bigger scale so that she can buy a decent motorbike to  support her business as well as for commuting.

loans.use: To buy potash, rice seed, and  pay for labor

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is a business man in the busy Muthurwa market in Nairobi, Kenya.  He also is a youth leader and a husband. Victor grew up in Muthurwa, which has a very high population and very few sanitation facilities. Due to this, he developed a desire to provide a solution for the sanitation issues in his community. His research into   possible solutions led him to Fresh Life toilets, which have brought a hygienic solution to the informal settlements around Muthurwa.

Victor seeks funding to purchase and run two Fresh Life toilets to help his neighbors have access to affordable hygienic sanitation. As Muthurwa market has large amounts of foot traffic, Victor's most immediate goal is to purchase two more Fresh Life toilets. He aspires to keep growing his venture and eventually provide sanitation solutions to a wider population.

loans.use: To purchase and run two Fresh Life toilets

loans.name: Huon

texts.en:
From Baray district of Kompong Tom, Huon is a 32-year-old woman who has been dedicated to the farming business alongside her husband. She also earns additional income by sourcing and purchasing hair for local hairdressers. Together, she and her spouse work hard to satisfy their needs and keep their children in school.

This marks Huon’s eighth time borrowing from HKL, this time to purchase wood for home construction. Her house is made of thatch and has decayed because of weather conditions; therefore, she needs to renovate it in order to provide a suitable shelter to her family members. She hopes the loan will be granted to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase wood for home construction.

loans.name: Teodosia

texts.es:
Teodosia continúa con la venta de pollipapas y salchipapas, ella tiene  un carrito salchipapero donde prepara sus ricos potajes y la podemos encontrar en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de Challabamba, ella sale a vender desde las 2pm hasta las 9pm de lunes a domingos entonces ella agradece infinitamente a todos los inversionistas que le apoyaron con el préstamo anterior pues le ayudo con el capital del negocio entonces en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo pollos, salchicha, papas y otros insumos.

Teodosia nació en el comunidad de Taquile (Puno, Cusco) pero vive en la ciudad de Challabamba. (El distrito de Challabamba está ubicado en la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, Perú). Ella tiene 29 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijas.
texts.en:
Teodosia continue selling chicken and potatoes and sausage and potatoes.  She has a sausage cart where she prepares her delicious dishes.  We can find her at one of the markets in the city of Challabamba.  She goes to sell from 2 p.m. until 9 p.m. from Mondays through Sundays.

She is infinitely grateful to all of the lenders who supported her with the previous loan.  It helped her with capital for her business.  She now needs a loan to buy supplies like chicken, sausages, potatoes, and other supplies.

Teodosia was born in the town of Taquile in Puno, Cusco, but she now lives in the city of Challabamba.  Challabamba is located in the Paucartambo province, Cusco department, Peru. Teodosia is 29 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has two daughters.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as chicken, sausages, potatoes and other items.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Farming has been Veronica's family's main source of income for many years. By mere planting and harvesting rice and vegetables, she has met their daily necessities though at times they were lacking. She is married and has grown children. 

With her husband, they are able to manage their farming business well. They both work hard towards improvement of their crop production. At present, Veronica is asking for a loan of PHP 24,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides to sustain  a greater crop production. She hopes to maintain her business and increase their earnings to secure them from emergencies in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides needed for a greater crop production.

loans.name: Duncan

texts.en:
Duncan is 26 years old. He is single and lives in the Kongowea area. He owns a pub that sells wines and spirits. He is employed and earns a salary so he has someone running the business for him. 

In the next five years, he wants the business to be stable. He learnt of Milango through friends and now seeks a loan to buy additional stock of wines and spirits. The challenge in the business is funding. The income raised from the business will improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of wines and spirits.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is married with one child who is an adult. She owns a house that has neither piped water nor electricity. 

Asha  operates a charcoal business, selling at the market to her local customers. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 25,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Mauricio

texts.es: Mauricio, a sus 28 años de edad, es casado y padre de un hijo de 4 años. Viene de una familia campesina que por tradición se han dedicado a las labores agrícolas y, gracias a ello, hoy en día posee cultivos de papa criolla, aguacate injerto y arveja, cuyas cosechas son vendidas en la plaza de mercado del municipio donde reside. Mauricio es un hombre responsable, pujante, trabajador y dedicado a su familia y a su labor, diariamente lucha contra las adversidades y obstáculos que se le presentan como los altos costos de los insumos agrícolas y el clima cambiante que daña los cultivos, por lo que siempre está en busca de nuevas opciones que le permitan sacar adelante a su familia. Actualmente solicita el crédito como apoyo, para invertirlo en la compra de los insumos agrícolas necesarios (abonos, fungicidas, larvicidas y fertilizantes) con los cuales cuida sus cultivos para poder cosechar productos de buena calidad y poderlos vender a mejor precio en el mercado, lo que incrementará sus ingresos y podrá invertir más para cumplir el sueño de ampliar el cultivo de aguacate y así seguir solventando las necesidades y gastos básicos de su hogar, mejorar las condiciones de vida y brindar una excelente educación a su hijo.
texts.en:
Mauricio is 28 years old. He is married and has a 4 year old son. He comes from a country family who have traditionally been farmers and, thanks to them, today he has potato, avocado and pea crops, which he sells in the market square of the town where he lives. 

Mauricio is responsible, strong, hard-working and dedicated to his family and his work. Every day he fights against the problems and obstacles he meets such as the high cost of farming supplies and the changing climate which damages his crops, so he is always looking for new options which let him support his family. 

He is currently asking for a loan as support, to invest in buying the farming supplies he needs (manure, fungicides, insecticides and fertilizers) which he uses to protect his crops so he can harvest high-quality products and sell them for better prices in the market. This will increase his income and he will be able to invest more to fulfil his dream of increasing his avocado crop and thereby keep paying for the needs and basic upkeep of his home, improve his standard of living and give his son an excellent education.

loans.use: to buy the farming supplies he needs (manure, fungicides, insecticides and fertilizer)

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita runs a service-based business providing boarding house rentals in the community of Poblacion, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is 53 years old,  a widow with three children. She has been doing this for more than two years to earn an income of her own in order to support her needs and her children's education. 

Nenita joined Gata Daku MPC recently and borrowed a loan to  repaint her boarding house. In that way, she can provide better services to her customers to gain clients and be able to generate income from the services they've been provided. She hopes to build another unit to  be used for business expansion.

loans.use: to repaint her boarding house

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi, composé de femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 48 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Fala Bougoula, commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréales, des produits agricoles tels le dah et des condiments alimentaires. Les femmes du groupe Benkadi sont à leurs vingt troisième prêts solidaires qui seront utilisé pour acheter des céréales et des condiments.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
 La deuxième personne à partir de la droite dans le rang des debout  s’appelle Konimba elle compte acheter avec cet argent 10 kg de haricot et 15kg de grains de dah. Ces marchandises seront vendues à ses clientes au marché et à domicile.  
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen par semaine de 3000FCFA ce qui fait 12 000FCFA par mois. Ce bénéfice sera utilisé dans l’achat des frais de condiments et l’habillement des enfants.
texts.en:
The group Benkadi is composed of four  married women, who average 48 years of age and five children each, all living in traditional families in the village of Fala Bougoula, Commune de Massigui, Préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of kinship, community, friendship. And they do commerce in grains, farm products such as 'dah' (dried hibiscus flowers), and condiments. The women of the group Benkadi are on their 23rd solidarity loan, which will be used to purchase grains and condiments. 

The second person standing from the right in the photo is called Konimba. She intends to use this money to purchase 10 kg of beans and 15 kg of 'dah'. These goods will be sold to customer at the market and at home. 

She envisions making an average weekly profit of 3,000 francs CFA which makes 12,000 francs per month. This profit will be used to purchase fresh condiments and some clothing for the children.

loans.use: to purchase farm products

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert works hard to support his family. Robert is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Robert requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell. He has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Robert would like to save enough money so he can afford to send his children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Yusufu

texts.en:
Yusuf appreciates his previous loan that enabled him buy more goats and sell them, thus generating more profit to take care of his family.

He is requesting a loan of Ksh 50,000 to purchase goats for his business. He joined Yehu to access the loan funds that will boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase goats for his business

loans.name: Gocha

texts.en:
Gocha is 46 years old and lives in the Ozurgeti district with his spouse and two grown sons. His elder son works an artisan locally and the younger is a student. Gocha’s wife stays home, taking care of her family.

Gocha has a fruit and vegetable business. He owns a van which he uses to make deliveries to the nearest villages. Gocha renews his assortment every day, buying the freshest and healthiest vegetables at the town's market. He says that he has many regular customers, which gives him a good income. He is a very hardworking man, with a great desire to ensure his family members have better living conditions. 

He has requested this loan to invest in the purchase of fruit and vegetables, in order to continue his business and generate revenue. 

Gocha awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables in bulk

loans.name: Khloeng

texts.en:
Khloeng is 30 years old, a villager from Thmor Koul district of Battambang province where she plants her crops. She has three dependent children who are studying in a local state school. For her family, rice and vegetable growing are the main sources of income, with which she has been engaged for 5 years. 

This is not the first microloan for Kloeng with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Now, she is seeking a new loan of 3,000,000 KHR in order to buy a water pumping machine for her rice paddy. She hopes that she can get a higher yield from her crops and make a good income.

loans.use: To buy a water pump to support her rice paddy

loans.name: Noupagagnon Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les 4 membres du groupe   NOUPAGAGNON III sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, 7 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à TOUROUMADIE, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Ils sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution et le prêt passé à été bien remboursé.
La spéculation cultivée est  le maïs avec KLESSIKE en première  position de la gauche vers la droite, il compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. II compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 160.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The four member of the group "NOUPAGAGNON III" are married men, who average 42 years of age and seven children each, all living in traditional families in TOUROUMADIE, a village in SIKASSO (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The men are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their second loan with the institution. The past loan was indeed paid back. 

The crop grown is corn, as is the case with KLESSIKE, who is first from the left in the photo. He intends to use his loan to purchase farm inputs and seeds and to pay for plowing to maintain 1 hectare.

After the harvest, the produce is sold to men and women customers in the village, at the SIKASSO market. He plans on making an average profit of 160,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable him to pay back his loan and also to help his big family to cover day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and seeds and to pay for plowing.

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Djekafo, composé de femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 37 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Fana, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce d’habillement, des jus de gingembre, de la glace et du savon.                                                               
Les femmes du groupe Djekafo sont à leur douzième prêt solidaire et 
Ami  la personne assise à droite compte acheter 4 gros et 2 petits cartons de savon avec son argent à Bamako. Son cycle d’achat est chaque semaine. Le savon est vendu à Fana pour réaliser un bénéfice de 45000 FCFA par mois. Le bénéfice mensuel est divisé est deux ; une partie est utilisée pour les dépenses de la famille et l’autre est réinjectée dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The group Djekafo is composed of married women, who average 37 years of age and five children each, all living in traditional extended families in Fana City, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of kinship, community, friendship. And they do commerce in clothing, ginger drink, ice, and soap. The women of the group Djekafo are on their 12th solidarity loan.

Ami, who is sitting at the right in the photo, intends to use her money to purchase 4 big and 2 small boxes of soap in Bamako. Her purchasing cycle is once a week. The soap is sold in Fana to make a profit of 45,000 francs CFA per month. The monthly profit is divided in two parts; one is for family expenses, and the other is for reinvesting in her business.

loans.use: to purchase soaps

loans.name: Monica Tomas

texts.pt:
A SRA MONICA É RESIDENTE DE BOANE, VIVE MARITALMENTE HÀ 3 ANOS. TEM 2 FILHOS MENORES E A SUA BASE DE SUSTENTO É O NEGOCIO. CONTA TAMBÉM COM AJUDA DO ESPOSO QUE TRABALHA COMO MOTORISTA.
ELA PRECISA DO EMPRÉSTIMO PARA COMPRAR PRODUTOS ALIMENTARES E BEBIDAS PARA REVENDER NA SUA LOJA EM SUA CASA. 
O SEU SONHO É TERMINAR A SUA CASA E SE CASAR OFICIALMENTE COM SEU ESPOSO.
TEM COMO DESAFIO CONQUISTAR MAIS CLIENTES PARA A SUA LOJA DE FORMA A AUMENTAR AS SUAS RECEITAS.
texts.en:
Monica lives in Boane and has been in a common law marriage for three years. She has two underage children and her means of livelihood is her business. She also gets help from her husband who works as a driver.
She needs the loan in order to purchase foodstuffs and beverages for re-selling in the store she runs in her house.
Her dream is to finish her house and to make her marriage to her husband official. Her challenge is getting more customers for her store so that she can increase her profits.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs and beverages for re-selling in the store she runs in her house.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman and has been in farming for more than 12 years now with her husband.  Aurelia helps her husband in tilling their field.

Aurelia is asking for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides for the farm. With this, she and her husband will be able to improve the productivity of the farm thus increasing their yield and income. In the future, Aurelia hopes of expanding their farming venture in the future so that it will generate more revenue necessary for their needs like food and to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita is a 59 year old resident of Lilo-an, Bonifacio. She provides for her children's needs from the little amount of 8,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) she gains monthly from her own five year piggery business as an aid to the income gained from her husband.

 Aside from her piggery, she runs a general store selling grocery items in the local community to make a living. 

In 2009 she became a member of GDMPC. Recently, she applied for a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy feeds, noodles, canned goods, coffee and milk for sale. Florita wants to make an expansion to her business and use her generated revenue for the family expenses and children's education.

loans.use: to buy feeds, noodles, canned goods, coffee and milk for sale.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila works hard to support her family. Mila is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Mila requested a 18,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of household goods to sell, like soap, spices, soft drinks, eggs, bread, etc.

Mila has been in this business for six years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her business. 

In the future, Mila would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of household goods to sell, like soap, spices, soft drinks, eggs, bread, etc.

loans.name: Chamroeun's Group

texts.en:
A resident from Kampong Cham province where she does rice farming, Chamroeun is 46 years old and a married mother of six children; only one daughter still relies on her as she is in school. To support her family appropriately, Chamroeun grows rice and raises ducks with the support from her husband. With 26 years' involvement in her current businesses, she is able to earn up to 32,000 KHR per day. 

Chamroeun is the first microloan client with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has formed a group of two to apply for a new loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. Chamroeun, the group leader, will spend her loan portion to buy potash and a good rice seed for her agricultural business. She hopes to boost her crops in a timely manner and make a good yield.

loans.use: To buy potash and a good rice seed for her agricultural business

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James lives in the Ndaragwa area, which has one of the cooler climates in Kenya. He has four children and has been doing his farming work for 15 years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops, transportation services, and personal business.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Selling farm produce.' His biggest challenge is 'Preparing land for planting.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of Thabu, Kameni, Asha, Muiru and Kimori--all cows.

James was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: 'They offer a grace period to farmers.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'One is able to save and borrow loans to buy assets.'

His highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family?', James replied 'Will be able to take children to school from my income.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. James owns the following: 'cow, poultry, pump, motorcycle' but does not own 'pig, bicycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'solar power, TV, DVD' but does not have 'mosquito net, electricity, running water, sewing machine'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank.

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en: Yusuf is a 50-year-old farmer from Pampaida Dutse Village, Kaduna State.  As a member of Babban Gona, Yusuf has the opportunity to earn $1,350/ha this season; which is double the average Nigerian farmer’s yearly income.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with high quality fertilizer needed to optimize his yield, and Aflasafe to remove toxins from his maize which will improve the quality of his maize so he can sell it at a premium price.  With his increased earnings, he hopes to build a bigger house that can accommodate his 6 children, and provide them with quality food so that they do not suffer from malnutrition.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Edwin Francisco

texts.es: El Sr. Edwin tiene dos hijos que dependen de él económicamente al igual que su esposa, a los que mantiene gracias a su empleo como taxista, actualmente habita en casa de un familiar de su esposa, tiene un terreno en el departamento de Chontales, en el cual está construyendo su casa de habitación progresivamente. Don Edwin quiere brindar a su familia una casa segura, por lo que solicita su primer crédito para comprar materiales de construcción para terminar las paredes, puertas y ventanas de la vivienda para poder habitarla y trasladar a su familia a su nuevo hogar.
texts.en: Edwin has a wife and two children who depend on him economically and whom he supports thanks to his job as a taxi driver. They are currently living in his wife's relative's house, but they have land in the Chontales department where they are progressively building their home. Edwin wants to provide his family with a secure home and that's why he is requesting a loan. He'd like to use the loan to finish the walls, doors and windows in order to make it livable and move his family into their new home.

loans.use: buy cement, sand, iron, blocks, doors and windows.

loans.name: Joaquim

texts.pt:
Joaquim nasceu na Província de Maputo e tem 49 anos. É pai de 3 filhos que vão à escola e responsabiliza-se também pelos seus 2 netos que também vivem com ele em sua casa.
É segurança há mais de 10 anos e aplica o seu salário nas despesas da casa e na construção da sua nova casa. Com o valor do empréstimo pretende dar continuidade à sua obra adquirindo materiais de construção como cimento, ferros, blocos para fazer a viga geral da sua obra. Este é seu 2º empréstimo na Hluvuku e o anterior foi usado para a criação de pintos.
Está confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um novo para iniciar com a construção do muro de vedação na sua casa.
texts.en:
Joaquim is 49 years old and comes from the province of Maputo. He has three children who attend school and he's also responsible for his two grandchildren who live with him as well.
He has been a security guard for over 10 years and he uses his salary to pay for his household expenses and to build his new house. With the amount of the loan he intends to keep the construction work going by purchasing construction supplies such as cement, iron and bricks, so he can build the girder for his house. This is his second loan with Hluvuku and the previous one was used for raising chicks.
He's confident that he'll repay the loan ahead of schedule and request a new one so he can start building a surrounding wall around his house.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies such as cement, iron and bricks, so he can build the girder for his house.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon lives in the Ndaragwa area of Kenya, which has one of the cooler climates in Kenya. He has one child, and has been doing this work for six years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops and transportation services.

He stated that marketing is the most enjoyable thing about farming.   His biggest challenge is transporting produce to the market.  Animals on the farm have been given the names of  "Tony" and "Gatune," both dairy cows.

Simon was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied, "low credit cost."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session.  He replied, "Saving is important."

His highest monthly expense is transportation costs. When asked how will this loan will benefit his family, Simon replied, "More income will improve our livelihood."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Simon owns a cow, poultry and a motorcycle, but does not own a pig, pump, bicycle or automobile.  Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net and solar power, but does not have electricity, running water, a sewing machine, TV or  DVD.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Adamu

texts.en: Adamu is a 54-year-old farmer who diligently cultivates his maize farm in Saulawa Village, Kaduna.  He envisions a future where hunger is a thing of the past for himself and his family.  By joining Babban Gona, he believes he is on the right step to achieving a hunger free future for himself and his family.  Like all Babban Gona members, he can expect the yield from his maize farm this planting season to be twice that of his harvests prior to becoming a Babban Gona member.  Adamu can expect to earn up to $1,350/ha this season; double the annual income of an average Nigerian farmer.  A recent loan by Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to enhance the yield from his farm and access to a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize, enabling his family to eat healthier maize and for him to get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Shu'aibu

texts.en: Shu'aibu is a 60 year old Babban Gona member and a maize farmer.  As a Babban Gona member, he is excited about the advanced agronomic practices he has been able to learn from experienced agronomists.  Like other members of Babban Gona, he can expect to earn up to $1,350/ha this season, twice the average Nigerian farmer’s income per year.  A recent loan by Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to enhance the yield from his farm and access to a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize, enabling his family to eat healthier maize and for him to get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Maje

texts.en: Maje is a maize farmer and Babban Gona from Chino Village, Kaduna.  He is excited about the access to premium market, quality farm inputs and expert agronomy consultation that is now being provided him as a Babban Gona member.  Prior to joining Babban Gona, the yield per hectare on Maje’s farm was minimal as he had very limited access to quality farm inputs.  A recent loan by Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to boost the yield from his maize farm and a product called Aflasafe to remove toxins from his maize.  This season, he can earn up to $1,350/ha, or twice the average Nigerian farmer’s income.  With the opportunities provided by Babban Gona, Maje plans to expand his farming business in order to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Amadu

texts.en: Amadu is a 38 year old farmer with a plan to change his family’s standard of living, using the profits earned from his maize farm in Chino Village.  He is excited about the opportunity to turn his small farm into a thriving business.  Like all Babban Gona members, Amadu has the opportunity to double his income and yield this season; he can expect to earn $1,350/ha, twice the average Nigerian farmer’s yearly income.  Amadu looks forward to giving his children the very best things in life while investing in his farm to ensure it is a profitable business.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer for his farm and a product to remove toxins from his maize, increasing its quality and making it healthier for consumption.  Amadu believes becoming a Babban Gona member is helping him to achieve his aim more speedily.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients such as flour, sugar, lard, and butter.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith lives in Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental with her family. She is 52 years old, married and a mother of three children. 

Her husband is a farmer, and she has helped him in operating their own farm to make a living. She has raised and harvested corn for years together with her husband. Manure fertilizer is recommended by the local government to improve and restore the nutrients needed in the farm. Without hesitation, she requests a loan to to buy fertilizer such as manure. 

She will reinvest her earnings in her business to generate double income in return.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is a 58 year old married woman from Talibon, Bohol.  She has five children.  The youngest child is 20.

She engages in tailoring services. She has been operating a tailoring services business for almost 10 years. She accepts dressmaking, dress alterations and other tailoring services.  

Felicidad is in need of  financial assistance to be able to continue her daily activity.  So, she requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy cloth and other sewing materials. 

In the future, Felicidad hopes that she can provide her customers with quality services that can uplift her livelihood status.

loans.use: to buy cloth and other sewing materials.

loans.name: Maianguwa

texts.en: Maianguwa is a maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona.  As a hardworking and prudent farmer, he hopes for a better life ahead which allows him to improve his standard of living.  He is excited about the opportunities Babban Gona provides him to increase his yields and has noticed a great change in his farm in comparison to the past.  Like all Babban Gona members, he has the opportunity to double his income and yield this season; he can expect to earn $1,350/ha, twice the average Nigerian farmer’s yearly income.  With this increase in earnings, he hopes to expand and subsequently produce at a commercial level.  With his loan, he is on his way to achieving his dreams.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to optimize his yields and access to a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize, enabling his family to eat healthier maize and for him to get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Jaji

texts.en: Jaji is an industrious maize farmer in Mahauta Village, Kaduna State.  He is happy to see the impact of Babban Gona in his community and he believes the fate of Babban Gona members will change for the better.  As a member, he can expect to make up to $1,350/ha this season; double the average annual income of most Nigerian farmers.  He looks forward to these increased earnings, and plans to expand his farming business and give his children a good life.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to optimize his yields and access a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize, enabling his family to eat healthier maize and for him to get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is a 28-year-old maize farmer, Babban Gona member and father of 2 - Mika and Salama.  Like all Babban Gona members, he has the opportunity to double his income and yield this season and can expect to earn up to $1,350/hectare.  He is excited to be a Babban Gona member and hopes to expand his farm at least tenfold as his income improves.  He looks forward to achieving his dreams of increasing his farm size and diversifying his farm product.  With this loan, he is on his way to achieving these dreams.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to optimize his yields and access a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize, enabling his family to eat healthier maize and for him to get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Isiyaka

texts.en: Isiyaka is a dedicated  father, farmer and member of Babban Gona.  He is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist.  As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to earn $1350/ha from his maize farm; this is twice the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  He looks forward to providing his 5 children the best education possible.  With this loan, he is on his way to achieving these dreams.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to optimize his yields and access a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize, enabling his family to eat healthier maize and for him to get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en: Haruna is a maize farmer from Burus village in Kaduna with 2 children.  He in a hardworking farmer who believes he needs to keep progressing in his farming business.  Haruna is excited to be a Babban Gona member as this gives the boost he needs.  Like all Babban Gona members, he can expect to earn up to $1350/ha.  A recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with high quality fertilizer to improve his yield, Aflasafe to eliminate toxins from his maize and access to premium markets.  With an increase in earnings, Haruna plans to increase his farm to at least 10 times its current size in the near future, as well as invest in his children by giving them good and quality formal education.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Luke

texts.en:
Luke is photographed here with her three adorable grandkids. As soon as they heard the loan officer asking their grandmother for a picture, they quickly positioned themselves next to her inside the stable.  Very cute :)

Luke, a villager who lives in rural Northern Albania, is a 55-year-old mother of six children, with some of them being married and parents and some still remaining single. She has been running a livestock activity for almost three years now.  She claims she has been able to make a good income by selling the raw milk to a nearby dairy farm.

Luke loves what she does, and the stable she has built houses approximately 100 animals inside. She is planning soon to add some more animals to the existing ones, and in five years time, she wants to reach to her desired number of animals.

Luke wants to add two cows with this loan.

loans.use: to add two cows to the existing herd.

loans.name: Mustapha

texts.en: Mustapha is a hardworking father, farmer and a member of Babban Gona.  Like all Babban Gona members, he has the opportunity to double his income and yield.  Through the quality inputs and expert advice from agronomists which is made available to him by Babban Gona, he can expect to make up to twice the average annual income of the Nigerian, meaning he can make up to $1350/ha from his maize farm.  Due to Mustapha’s belief in education, he plans to use his increased income to re-enroll in school to complete his schooling and also give his daughter a good and proper education.  With this loan, he is on his way to achieving his dreams.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to optimize his yields and access a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize, enabling his family to eat healthier maize and for him to get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Ado

texts.en: Ado is a dedicated farmer who is eager to learn new farming techniques in order to increase the yield and quality of produce from his maize farm.  As a Babban Gona member he is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist.  He looks forward to improving his standard of living, and is on his way to achieving his dreams with this loan.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to optimize his yields and access a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize, enabling his family to eat healthier maize and for him to get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Nasiru

texts.en: Nasiru is a devoted farmer and Babban Gona member.  Like all Babban Gona members, he has the opportunity to make up to $1,350/ha from his farm this season, which is double the average Nigerian farmer’s yearly income.  He looks forward to using his increased earning to expand his farming operations, and is on his way to achieving his dreams with this loan.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to optimize his yields and access a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize, enabling his family to eat healthier maize and for him to get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Shafiu

texts.en: Shafiu is a 54 year old farmer and a Babban Gona member from Danlawal village in Kaduna.  Like other Babban Gona members, he was able to get the amount of fertilizer needed to boost his yield.  From the services he receives from Babban Gona, he can expect to earn up to $1,350/ha this season; twice the income of an average Nigerian farmer.  He looks forward to improving his standard of living and providing for his family.  With this loan, he can achieve his dreams.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to optimize his yields and access to a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize, enabling his family to eat healthier maize and for him to get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Heidy Damissela

texts.es:
La Joven Heidy de 26 años de edad, vive con su esposo y un hijo, en su casa de habitación ubicada en una comunidad de San Lorenzo en la zona sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 04  años a la venta de golosinas como ser tacos, enchiladas, yuca frita, hamburguesas, chilaquiles, etc.
Heidy sus clientes son personas que transitan por donde ella vive y vende sus alimentos  de lunes a domingo,  su negocio está ubicado en su casa.
Heidy  está solicitando  el préstamo para compra de productos como yuca, tortillas, queso, carne, repollo, lechuga, plátanos, cebollas, chiles, etc. para elaborar sus diferentes tipos de golosinas, con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende incrementar más  sus  ventas y espera que le deje ganancias para ayudar en la economía de su hogar.
Heidy su sueño es poder mejorar su casa de habitación.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – Julio 2013
texts.en:
Heidy, 26, lives with her husband and a son in her house in a community of San Lorenzo, in the south of Honduras.

Heidy has earned a living for four years selling snacks: tacos, enchiladas, fried yuca, hamburgers, chilaquiles, etc.  Her customers are people who pass by her house, where her business is located.  She sells her food from Monday through Sunday.

Heidy's requesting the loan to buy yuca, tortillas, cheese, meat, cabbage, plantains, onions, chili peppers, and other products to make different types of snacks.  She plans to increase her sales with the support of this loan, and she hopes it leaves her profits to help with the household expenses.

Heidy's dream is to be able to improve her house.

San Lorenzo, Honduras, July 2013

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make snacks

loans.name: G.s Las Brisas Group

texts.es:
La señora Juana  de 57 años de edad, vive con su esposo en su casa de habitación ubicada en un barrio de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras, se dedica a la venta de productos de la canasta básica, como ser arroz, frijoles, manteca, huevos, refrescos etc.
Doña Juana se dedica a esta actividad desde hace ya varios años, vende sus desde su casa y sus clientes son todos sus vecinos y amigos de su comunidad, ella es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable.
Doña Juana al igual que sus compañeras de grupo está muy contenta de trabajar con Prisma y están solicitando un nuevo préstamo para invertir en sus negocios y comprar más productos como azúcar, frijoles, café, pan, arroz, etc. 
Doña Juana al igual que sus compañeras de grupo quiere llenar un poco más su negocio y tener de los productos para la venta, tiene deseos de salir adelante y con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
Doña María y Doña Delmys se dedican a la venta de ropa nueva y americana.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Julio del 2013
texts.en:
Juana, 57, lives with her husband in her home located in a neighborhood of San Lorenzo, in the south of Honduras. She makes her living selling basic products, like rice, beans, shortening, eggs, sodas, etc.

Juana has been doing this activity for many years already, she sells from her come and her customers are all of her neighbors and friends of her community. She is a very hardworking and responsible person. 

Juana, like the other women in her group, is very content to work with Prisma. They are asking for a new loan to invest in their businesses and buy more products like rice, beans, coffee, bread, sugar, etc. 

Juana, like the other women in her group, wants to stock her business a bit more and have more products for sale. She desires to get ahead and with the help of this loan, she can try to improve the life of her and her family a little more.

María and Delmys make their living selling new and American clothing.

loans.use: for the purchase of sugar, beans, coffee, bread, rice, etc.

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.es: En la cosecha pasada Bernardo resembró gran parte de su finca con la finalidad de aumentar su producción de café y esto fue posible gracias a un crédito otorgado por Kiva. Para esta cosecha Bernardo solicita nuevamente un financiamiento para comprar fertilizante y realizar labores de limpieza en su terreno, así como también para pagar a los trabajadores que lo ayudarán durante la época de corte de café.
texts.en: During the last harvest season Bernardo reseeded a large part of his farm in order to increase his coffee production. He was able to do this thanks to a loan from KIVA. For this harvest, he is seeking a new loan in order to buy fertilizer and to hire laborers to clear his land. He would also use the loan money to hire workers to help him during the coffee harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, clear his land and pay laborers to harvest his coffee.

loans.name: Sunay

texts.en:
Sunay is an IDP (internally displaced person) from Fizuli city. Now he lives in the Absheron region with his family. Sunay is 23 years old and a single person. He started his business one year ago, to sell phones and phone accessories. Now he needs a loan of 1,000 AZN, which he will use to buy more phones and phone accessories.

In the future, Sunay wants to get married and have a big family, with three children. But he thinks that, first, he must improve his business. This will be better for his future. Sunay is thankful to Komak and Kiva, for supporting him.

loans.use: to buy phones and phone accessories, to sell at his shop

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
Doña Clara tiene 52 años de edad y una familia muy numerosa compuesta por 5 hijos de los cuales 3 viven en casa y le ayudan con las diferentes actividades del campo. Con ella también vive un nieto el cual está en la primaria estudiando. En compañía de su esposo se dedican a la agricultura y ella independiente del cultivo tiene un pequeño negocio de pulpería siendo sus clientes los vecinos de su comunidad ya que por medio de esta actividad ella contribuye aún más con los ingresos en el hogar. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria no completado cursado hasta el 3 grado pero gracias a sus padres la tierra que trabajan en familia es propia una herencia por parte de ellos las cuales están ubicadas a 25 minutos de su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan diariamente a pie en compañía de sus hijos y su esposo para dar mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café.

Ella solicita un financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas necesario para su cafetal ya que por medio 
de esto ellos esperan mejorar y al final obtener una excelente cosecha obteniendo resultados positivos y esperados.  

Ella planea ampliar más sus cultivos de café sembrar una mayor y mejor variedad de plantilla ya que de esa manera ella podrá fortalecer el patrimonio para sus hijos y sus nietos dejando una tierra propia, digna y fértil en la que ellos puedan trabajar y generar sus ingresos para sus familias.
texts.en:
Clara, 52, has a very large family made up of 5 children, 3 of whom live at home and help her with different activities on the farm. With her also lives a grandson who is studying in elementary school. Accompanied by her husband, they work in agriculture. She has a small store independent of the coffee. Her customers are neighbors from the community. Through this business, she is able to contribute even more to the income of her home.

Clara has an uncompleted primary school education up to third grade. She has inherited the land where her family works thanks to her parents, who are located 25 minutes from her house. She walks by foot daily accompanied by her children and her husband to maintain the coffee plants. She is applying for a loan for the purchase of agricultural supplies necessary for her coffee farm.

With these supplies, they hope to improve and ultimately obtain an excellent harvest obtaining positive and planned results. She plans to grow more coffee plants and sow a wider variety of plants. In this way she will be able to strengthen the inheritance for her children and grandchildren, leaving them their own, dignified and fertile land where they can work and generate income for their families.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies for her coffee plants.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purcahse a motorcycle for community health work

loans.name: Ahliddin

texts.ru: Ахлиддин житель района А.Джоми. Ему 29 лет. У него жена и трое детей. Ахлидин по профессии юрист. У него высшее образование. Однако он занимается другим делом, а именно растениеводством. У него имеется о,26 га приусадебного и президентского участка земли, на котором он выращивает кукурузу и огородные культуры. Он занимается земледельческой деятельностью в течение 8 лет. Кроме этого он занимается животноводством. В данное время Ахлиддин просит кредит для повторного посева. На сумму кредита он хочет купить семена кукурузы, помидора, огурцов, лука, моркови, а также минеральные удобрения и топливо. Мечта Ахлиддина - построить дом с хорошими условиями проживания. Получаемую прибыль с деятельности он откладывает на реализацию своей мечты.
texts.en: Ahliddin lives in the A. Jomi region of Tajikistan.  He is 29 years old, he has a wife and three children.  He is an attorney by profession, and has a higher degree.  He also works in agriculture.  He has .26 hectares of homestead land on which he grows corn and other vegetables.  He has farmed for the last eight years.  Additionally, he works with livestock.  At the moment, Ahliddin is asking for a loan to plant a second harvest.  With the funds from the loan, he wants to buy corn, tomato, cucumber, onion and carrot seeds, as well as mineral fertilizer and fuel.  Ahliddin has a dream of building his own, comfortable home.  The profits made possible by the loan will be put towards making this dream come true.

loans.use: to buy corn, tomato, cucumber, onion, and carrot seeds, as wells as fertilizer and fuel

loans.name: Sandra Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Sandra, se Desempeña como maestro de primaria, en un pequeño colegio del municipio, dedicándose a esa labor desde hace 29 años, es Soltera con 2 hijo a los que tiene que proporcionarle las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo.
Una de las necesidades que la  señora  Sandra  atraviesa,  es de mejorar su vivienda, por lo que ha tomado la decisión de acudir a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra materiales de construcción tales como: cemento, arena, hierro, aserraduras para puertas, verjas y mano de obra y ser beneficiada con dicho crédito y mejorar las condiciones y nivel de vida.
La señora Sandra agradece a ceprodel por el crédito oportuno y la oportunidad misma de favorecer atravez del mismo a los sectores más vulnerables.
texts.en:
Sandra is a primary school teacher at a small school in her town. She has been a teacher for the past 29 years. She is single, with two children for whom she would like to provide the necessities needed for a successful life. One of these necessities is the improvement of their home. This is why she has come to Ceprodel. She is asking for a loan to buy construction materials such as cement, sand, iron, saws for cutting the doors, iron gates and workers. This loan would provide these items and help her to improve her conditions and lifestyle. 
Ms Sandra is thankful to Ceprodel for the opportunity to have this loan. It gives the most vulnerable sector of the population the opportunity to succeed.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as cement, sand, iron, saws for cutting the doors, iron gates and workers.

loans.name: Vuthy

texts.en:
Vuthy is a villager from Kandal Stoeng district, in Kandal province. He is a 33-year-old, married father of two schoolchildren.  He makes a living by selling sweets in a school, and his wife is working at a factory to supplement their family's income. She has six years' experience in her work.

Vuthy is a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). With this loan, he is seeking 4,000,000 KHR. He will use part of this amount to buy more sweets for resale, and another part to build a decent latrine for his family. He hopes that he can make more income from his business and own a proper latrine, to promote good hygiene for his family.
