loans.use: To build a decent latrine for his family, and to buy more sweets to sell at his business

loans.name: Benancio Esteban

texts.es:
El señor Benancio  de 51 años de edad, vive con su hijo en su casa de habitación ubicada en una comunidad de Nacaome, al sur de Honduras, se dedica a la venta de productos de la canasta básica como ser arroz, frijoles, manteca, huevos, refrescos etc.
Don Benancio se dedica a esta actividad desde hace varios años, tiene su vivienda propia en donde ahí mismo tiene ubicado su negocio, sus clientes son todas las personas que le visitan, es un hombre trabajador y respetuoso.
Don Benancio Solicita el préstamo de 8,000.00 para comprar más productos de abarrotería como azúcar, frijoles, queso, café, pan, mantequilla y arroz quiere llenar un poco mas su negocio para tener productos a la venta.  Su deseo de salir adelante y apoyar a su hijo en los estudios.
Don Benancio su sueño es ampliar su pulpería y instalar un depósito de frescos.
 
San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Julio del 2013
texts.en:
Benancio, 51, lives with his son in the community of Nacaome, in south of Honduras. He sells basic grocery items, like rice, beans, lard, eggs, refreshments, etc. Benancio's been running this business for many years now. He owns his house and his store is located in it. His clients are all the people who come to visit him. He's a respectful, hard-working man. Benancio is requesting a loan of 8,000.00 to buy more grocery items, like sugar, beans, cheese, coffee, bread, butter and rice. He'd like to stock up to have more products for sale in his store. His desire is to get ahead and support his son's studies. Benancio's dream is to expand his grocery store and start selling soft drinks. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - July 2013

loans.use: buy sugar, beans, cheese, coffee, bread, lard and rice for his business.

loans.name: Sani

texts.en: Sani is a dedicated farmer and member of Babban Gona.  He is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist.  As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to earn $1350/ha from his maize farm; this is twice the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  He looks forward to improving the lives of his family, and is on his way to achieving his dreams with this loan.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to optimize his yields and access a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize, enabling his family to eat healthier maize and for him to get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Yahaya

texts.en: Yahaya is a devoted farmer from Danlawal village, Kaduna.  Like all Babban Gona members, he has the opportunity to double his income and yield this season; he can expect to earn $1,350/ha, twice the average Nigerian farmer’s yearly income.  He looks forward to adequately taking care of his family, improving their standard of living and being economically prosperous.  With this loan, he is on his way to achieving his dreams.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to optimize his yields and access a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize, enabling his family to eat healthier maize and for him to get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Musa

texts.en: Musa is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member from Burus Village, Kaduna State.  He is excited with the level of services and support he receives as a member of Babban Gona.  Services include the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist.  Like all Babban Gona members, he has the opportunity to make up to $1,350/ha from his farm this season, which is double the average Nigerian farmer’s yearly income.  He looks forward to investing in his farm and improving his life and that of his family.  With this loan, he is on his way to achieving his dreams.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to optimize his yields and access a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize, enabling his family to eat healthier maize and for him to get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Gambo

texts.en: Gambo is a 30-year-old hardworking farmer from the Burus village of Kaduna.  As a Babban Gona member, he is excited about the opportunities provided to him to improve his yields.  Like all Babban Gona members, he has the opportunity to double his income and yield this season and can expect to earn $1,350/ha, twice the average Nigerian farmer’s yearly income.  He hopes he can continue to farm and grow his farming operations in order to adequately provide for his family’s needs.  With this loan, he is on his way to achieving these dreams.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to optimize his yields and access to a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize, enabling his family to eat healthier maize and allowing him to get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Bello

texts.en: Bello is a devoted farmer and member of Babban Gona.  Like all Babban Gona members, he has the opportunity to double his income and yield this season; he can expect to earn $1,350/ha, twice the average Nigerian farmer’s yearly income.  He looks forward to improving the lives of his family members.  With this loan, he is on his way to achieving his dreams.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to optimize his yields and access a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize, enabling his family to eat healthier maize and for him to get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy products to sell in his shop, including maize flour, tea leaves and wheat flour

loans.name: Julia Verónica

texts.es: La señora Julia es habitante de una comunidad de la localidad, su profesión es maestra de primaria de un colegio de la localidad con 23 años de impartir clases a los niños que tiene a su cargo, ya que con los años de laborar a penetrado en varias generaciones donde sembró la semilla del saber, es casada con 3 hijos los que tiene que brindarle las condiciones para su desarrollo, actualmente presenta una necesidad de mejorar su vivienda  la que está en mal estado, por tal necesidad se decidió de visitar a ceprodel y solicitar un financiamiento para lograr el objetivo percibido,  ya que el financiamiento lo utilizara para  la compra de materiales como bloques, zinc y cemento. Ya esta manera lograra su sueño, agradeciéndole mucho a ceprodel.
texts.en: Julia is a member of the local community. She is a teacher with 23 years of experience teaching classes to her students. After all these years of teaching she has influenced generations with the seeds of knowledge. She is married with three children for whom she would like to see succeed. Actually, she needs to improve her house, which is in a bad state. This is why she decided to visit Ceprodel and ask for a loan in order to achieve this objective. This loan will be utilized to buy construction materials such as cement blocks, zinc and cement. In this manner she will reach her dreams, with much thanks to Ceprodel.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as cement blocks, zinc and cement.

loans.name: Samaila

texts.en: Samaila is a devoted farmer and a member of Babban Gona.  He is excited with the noticeable difference he has seen on his farmland since joining Babban Gona.  As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist.  Like other Babban Gona members, he can earn up to $1,350/ha this season, which is double the average annual income of most Nigerian farmers.  With this increase in earnings, he looks forward to a better life for himself and his family.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer for his maize farm and a product to remove toxins from his maize, making it healthier for consumption and improving its market value.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Bala

texts.en: Bala is a 45-year-old farmer from Gabas Dorayi Village in Kaduna.  Bala plants maize on his farmland of about one hectare.  Like all members of Babban Gona, Bala can now get high quality unadulterated farm inputs more easily, as well as sell his maize product at a premium price.  Bala looks forward to increasing his yields, income and standard of living.  He is on his way to achieving his dreams.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to optimize his yields and access a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize, enabling his family to eat healthier maize and for him to get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Elma

texts.en: Elma is a 41-year-old mother, who has three school-aged children. They are currently residing in a rural community and make their living by farming. Elma started a small variety store in their village, to generate additional income. To improve the business, she is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000. She will increase her capital, by buying more stock to sell at her store, including candies, beverages, seasonings, soaps, canned goods, noodles, fruits and vegetables. She believes that the loan will enable her to improve the business, and she hopes that she will be successful with it.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell at her store, including candies, soaps, fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Her general store is the primary source of income for Estrella. She has been in this business for five years. She usually gets a net income of around PHP300 a day in retailing. She is 37 years old and is married to Johnny. They are blessed with three children. Her husband manages their farm. 

Right now, Estrella needs additional capital to buy stocks of merchandise. In this regard, she is asking for a loan amounting to PHP10,000 to buy canned goods, beverages, condiments and assorted breads to sell. She hopes to improve her business as well as her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages, condiments and assorted breads to sell.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is 52 years old, and she lives with her daughter and two grandchildren in the city of Vanadzor, in the Lori region. Anahit’s husband died several years ago, and her daughter, after an unsuccessful marriage, was divorced and came back to live with her mother. So Anahit has become responsible to take care of, not only her daughter, but her grandchildren as well.

It has been already ten years that she has been engaged in public catering services, in a rented stall in Vanadzor central food market. Her customers are mainly market salesmen. She manages to prepare kebabs, cutlets, hot-dogs, juices and other dishes. Anahit needs a loan of 400,000 Armenian drams, which she will use to buy soft drinks and some new tableware, for her business.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and some new tableware, for her business

loans.name: Nazmi

texts.en:
Nazmi is being photographed here in the midst of his corn field in this beautiful rural mountain village where he resides. He is requesting a loan for the second time from VisionFund Albania. The loan of 50,000 Albanian Lek that he is requesting this time from Kiva’s lenders is to help him buy pesticides for his corn maize. 

Nazmi is in his 60-s, married, and a father of four grownup children. Up until fifteen years ago, he worked as a carpenter and then switched to agriculture since he already owned some land. Not only has he been selling grains and veggies, but also dairy products to the local market. He has been doing good so far, according to him.

loans.use: to buy pesticides for his maize plants.

loans.name: Burulkan

texts.ru: Бурулкан 43 года, замужем, детей 3 (2 дочери,1 сын). Бурулкан имеет высшее образование, работает в телекоме бухгалтером. Бурулкан по характеру: спокойная, уравновешенная и трудолюбивая. Супруг и дети помогают по бизнесу. В качестве дополнительного  дохода для своей семьи, уже много лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с 15,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Бурулкан в хозяйстве имеется: 1 дойная корова и 15 овец, а также имеет земельный надел, на которой выращивает клевер, фасоль, кукурузу. Ее деятельность приносит около 9,000 сом (KGS) в месяц, от продажи молока, молочной продукции, а также овощей, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. Доходы от хозяйства позволили Бурулкан дать хорошее образование своим детям. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Бурулкан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков и овец. Доходы от кредита Бурулкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства, а также, в будущем хочет женить сына.
texts.en: Burulkan is 43 years old, married and has three children (two daughters and one son).  She has a college degree and works as an accountant in telecommunications.  By character, Burulkan is calm, balanced, and hard-working.  Her spouse and children help her with her business.  As a source of extra income for the family, for many years Burulkan has worked with livestock.  She started the business with 15,000 KGS.  Thanks to her hard work and care, today she has one dairy cow and 15 sheep.  She also has a plot of land where she grows clover, beans and corn.  This business brings in around 9,000 KGS a month from the sale of milk and dairy products, as well as vegetables which cover most of the family's food costs.  This income allowed Burulkan to give her children a good education.  With the goal of further developing her business, Burulkan turned to the microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 70,000 KGS to buy bulls and sheep.  She plans to use the income from the loan to further invest in her farm and also, in the future, to marry her son.

loans.use: to buy bulls and sheep

loans.name: Lucrecia Del Socorro

texts.es: . La señora  Lucrecia es soltera con 1 hija  a su cargo, actualmente se desempeña como maestra  de primaria de un colegio de la localidad con 5 años de ejercer tan noble labor es una más,  de las beneficiadas  con dicho crédito el cual le permite efectuar  el mejoramiento de su vivienda, por eso visito las oficinas de ceprodel para plantear su necesidad, ya que dicho crédito sería utilizado en el mejoramiento de su vivienda en la compra de materiales de construcción tales como: arena cemento, ladrillo, hierro, y gastos personales( comedor con sus sillas),  la señora Lucrecia le agradece a ceprodel   por el apoyo que tanto lo necesitaba y la oportunidad misma de poder realizar su sueño, y mejor su nivel de vida.
texts.en: Lucrecia is a single mother with one daughter. She currently works as a 1st grade teacher of a school in the area and has had this noble job for 5 years. She wanted to make improvements to her home and knew she could greatly benefit from a loan, so she visited the offices of Ceprodel. She is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, brick, iron and personal expenses (dining room table and chairs). Lucrecia is grateful to Ceprodel for the support she needs and the opportunity to realize her dreams and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: buy construction materials like, sand, cement, brick, iron and personal expenses.

loans.name: Heang

texts.en:
Heang, 29, is married and a mother of two children. She lives with her family in Baray district, Kompong Tom province. She learned to work in the fields when she was living with her parents. Thanks to them, she learned. After she and her husband were married, they inherited a few plots of farmland. She and her husband work hard to provide for their family's needs. Aside from their perseverance and effort in farming, they are also employed as paid workers on a local rubber plantation, to earn additional income.

Heang doesn't own a motorcycle to serve her family and help them commute to work. She and her spouse have to walk, and they go very early, to reach their workplace every day. To solve the challenge she is facing, she is requesting the loan to buy a motorcycle. It will help her get to work on time and facilitate the family's transportation needs. In this way, she hopes to continue forward and to be able to reach her dream, of providing the best well-being for her family and an excellent education for her children.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for driving to work

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.en: Alejandro is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. He is a married man and a father of three children. Alejandro has been in the farming business for several years now. This is the source of his income. Alejandro is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, he will be able to improve the productivity of the farm, thus augmenting his yield and income. In the future, Alejandro wants to expand his farm in order to generate more revenue.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Boneta

texts.en:
Boneta is a married woman and a mother of six children, from San Miguel, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari or variety store business, selling various goods and items to the people in her place. Boneta has been in the business for more than five years now. Her husband works as a farmer.

Boneta needs a loan for the expansion of her store. She is asking for a loan to buy more stocks to sell, like canned goods, rice, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, and cooking ingredients. With this loan, she will be able to increase the variety of her stocks, thus allowing her to attract and cater to more buyers. 

Boneta believes that she can improve her store through hard work and perseverance. Furthermore, she wants to continually send her children to school for better education and learning.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell, like canned goods, rice, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, and cooking ingredients.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is married with four children and three of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (her sister).  She has a tailoring business and has been in this business for 6.5 years. She has applied for a loan of 1,300,000 Uganda shilling from MCDT SACCO to buy more rolls of clothing materials, thread, and sewing machines.  She generates additional income through a restaurant. She works at the market six days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality, thieves, and transportation.  She is aspiring to own 6 sewing machines and also to build commercial houses.  She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more rolls of clothing materials, thread, and sewing machines.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is married with 4 children. She is 54 years old and lives in Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. Her husband worked as an on-call carpenter but most of his time was focused on their farm as the main source of income, while Beatriz operates a plot of farm land, planting bananas and coconuts to earn a living. She has been in this business for years. 

Recently, she requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase farm fertilizer such as manure. Beatriz has been a member of  GDMPC since 2010. In the future, her plan is to save her returns in order to buy an additional piece of farmland.

loans.use: to purchase farm fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives in the Ndaragwa area of Kenya, which has one of the cooler climates in Kenya. She has 5 children and has been doing this work for 16 years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs and crops.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Selling milk.' Her biggest challenge is 'Feeding the animals.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Nguno the cow.'

Rose was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'They deliver their services to farmers' doorsteps.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'Group guarantee enables one to get a loan with less security.'

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked 'How will this loan benefit her family', Rose replied 'More income from milk.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Rose owns the following: 'cow, poultry' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'solar power, running water, TV, DVD' but does not have 'mosquito net, electricity, sewing machine'.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Sreyhun's Group

texts.en:
Sreyhun, a local farmer who does cassava farming on three hectares as the main source of income, is 20 years old and single. She has been involved in this business for two years, earning about 37,500 KHR per day. 

She has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before. She is now leading a group of three to apply for a new loan. Her loan portion is 1,000,000 KHR while her fellow group members are seeking 500,000 KHR each.  

Sreyhun, the leader, will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer, herbicide, and to pay a weeding fee and a reaping fee. She hopes to collect a good yield so she can sell it at a good price to double her income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and herbicide, and to pay a weeding fee and a reaping fee.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Gung

texts.en:
Balinese artisan Gung specializes in painting sculptures and masks by hand. He would like to invest in the purchase of wood and paints for the production of his new designs.

Gung has been selling through NOVICA since 2003. This is his story:

"I was born in Ubud, and grew up among artisans. Most of my family members are carvers - carving is our family heritage. Other than carving, I also love to paint, so after trying different procedures I finally found a way to combine wood carving with painting.  My parents taught me that work is a must, but with good education people will respect you even more."

"Thank you for your support and for appreciating my work. This microcredit will let me be more creative and work on new designs."

Use the link below to view Gung's handpainted wood sculptures and masks on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/3888

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of wood and paints for the production of his new designs

loans.name: Shaibu

texts.en: Shaibu is a 37-year-old farmer and a Babban Gona member.  He is excited with the level of services and support he receives as a member of Babban Gona.  He finally has access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist.  Like all members, he has the opportunity to double his income and yield this season and can expect to earn up to $1,350/ha.  He looks forward to improving his farming operations and making a positive change in his life.  With this loan, he is on his way to achieving his dreams.  A recent loan by Babban Gona provided him with sufficient amount of fertilizer to ensure maximum productivity of his maize farm along with a product to detoxify his maize and make it healthier for consumption.  He was also taught how to apply them correctly.  This season, he is very happy with the results he is seeing.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Usman

texts.en: Usman is a loving father, a maize farmer and a Babban Gona member in Gabas Dorayi Village,Kaduna State.  Usman is excited with the level of services and support he receives as a member of Babban Gona, which include the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist.  Like all members, he has the opportunity to make up to $1,350/ha from his farm this season, which is double the average Nigerian farmer’s yearly income.  His most recent loan by Babban Gona provided him with enough high quality fertilizer to optimize his farm yield.  With the increase in income, Usman looks forward to increasing his farm size and giving his children a better future by sending them to good schools.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Adamu

texts.en: Adamu is dedicated farmer and member of Babban Gona.  As a Babban Gona member he is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist.  He also plans to become a great commercial farmer.  Like all Babban Gona members, Adamu now has access to high quality farm inputs and access to premium markets for his maize product.  He looks forward to improving his farm operations and standard of living.  With this loan, he is on his way to achieving his dreams.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to optimize his yields and access a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize, enabling his family to eat healthier maize and for him to get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru: Гулнора добросовестная и трудолюбивая женщина. Ей 31 года. Она вдова и имеет 2 детей. Гулнора образованная женщина. Она более 2 года работает в средней школе. Она преподает русский язык и русскую литературу. Гулнора любит свою работу и выполняет честно. Ее ученики любят ее. Гулнора планирует отремонтировать ее дом, так как ее дом имеет плохое состояние. Гулнора планирует отремонтировать все комнаты. Гулнора запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Gulnora is a conscientious and hardworking woman.  She is 31 years old, a widow and has two children.  Gulnora is an educated woman.  She has been worked at a high school for more than two years.  She teaches Russian and Russian literature.  Gulnora loves her jobs and works diligently.  Her students love her.  She is planning to make repairs to her home since it is in a poor condition. She must renovate all rooms.  Gulnora is asking for a loan of 5,000 KGS to buy building materials.  She awaits your kindness and relies on your mercy.

loans.use: To buy building materials to make home repairs

loans.name: Sayramby

texts.ru: Дом, где живет Сайрамби, не отвечает стандартам жилья и она срочно должна отремонтировать свой дом. Ей 28 лет, она замужем и на воспитании имеет  2детей. Дети еще не совершеннолетние. Они учатся в средней школе и всегда просят родителей отремонтировать их дом, но их доход не достаточно для этого. Сайрамби работает в фермерском хозяйстве. Ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации. Она должна отремонтировать все комнаты. Сайрамби запрашивает займ на сумму  3000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов, краски, шпаклевки для ремонта дома. Сайрамби ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: The house where Sayramby lives is not up to housing standards and she urgently needs to make some repairs.  She is 28 years old, married and is raising two children.  Her kids are still minors, students in school.  They are constantly asking their parents to repair their home, but their income is not enough to do so.  Sayramby works on a farm and her husband is a migrant worker in Russia.  She needs to repair all rooms in the home.  Sayramby is asking for a loan of 3,000 KGS to buy constructional materials like paint and putty.  She awaits your kindness and relies on your mercy.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as paint and putty to make house repairs

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette is a married woman from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. She has been engaged in a fishing business together with her husband for more than 20 years now. This has been their source of income.

Bernadette is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and buckets. With this, her husband will be able to catch more fish, thus allowing them to sell more fish in the market. In the future, Bernadette hopes of improving their fishing venture and of making it a stable source of income. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children and to repay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and buckets.

loans.name: Abdu

texts.en: Abdu is a devoted farmer and Babban Gona member.  Like all Babban Gona members, he has the opportunity to make up to $1,350/ha from his farm this season, which is double the average Nigerian farmer’s yearly income.  Abdu looks forward to using his increased earnings to expand his farming business.  His goal is to become a successful commercial farmer while using the proceeds from his farm to give his family a better life and fulfill his religious obligations.  Abdu is on his way to achieving his dreams.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to optimize his yields and access a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize, enabling his family to eat healthier maize and for him to get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Aliyu

texts.en: Aliyu is a father, maize farmer and a Babban Gona member.  Like all Babban Gona members, he can expect to earn up $1350/ha this season, which is double the average Nigerian farmer’s yearly income.  He is excited about the opportunities Babban Gona provides him to grow his farm and looks forward to transitioning from life as a subsistence farmer to a real commercial farmer.  With this increase in earnings he plans to send his children to good schools, and is on his way to achieving these dreams with this loan.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to optimize his yields and access a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize, enabling his family to eat healthier maize and for him to get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Bello

texts.en: Bello is a 50-year-old Babban Gona farmer.  He is excited to be a Babban Gona member and believes he will become one of the best farmers in his community in the near future.  He is also excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist through membership.  This season, like all Babban Gona members, he has the opportunity to earn double the average Nigerian farmer’s income.  He can expect to earn up to $1350/ha from his maize farm.  With the increased earnings he plans to develop his farm from subsistence to commercial scale, send his children to a good school and build a new house.  With this loan, he is on his way to achieving his dreams.  A recent loan by Babban Gona provided him with sufficient amount of fertilizer to ensure maximum productivity of his maize farm as well as a product to detoxify his maize and make it healthier for consumption.  He was also taught how to apply them correctly.  This season, he is very happy with the results he is seeing.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Lawal

texts.en: Lawal is a 40-year-old hardworking farmer, a caring father of 6 and a Babban Gona member from Pampaida Dutse in Kaduna State.  He is excited with the level of services and support he receives as a member of Babban Gona.  He finally has access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist.  Like all Babban Gona members, he has the opportunity to double his income and yield this season, expecting to earn up to $1,350/hectare.  Lawal has big plans for himself, his family and his farm.  He looks forward to improving and expanding his farming operations to a commercial scale.  In addition, he hopes to educate all six of his children.  With this loan, he is on his way to achieving all of these dreams.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to optimize his yields and access to a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize, enabling his family to eat healthier maize and for him to get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Daria

texts.en:
Daria is from Bien Unido, Bohola, and is a 60-year-old married woman and a mother of six grown-up children. She earns a living through her sari-sari or variety store business, selling various goods and items to the people in her place.

Daria needs a loan for her store. She is requesting a loan to buy more stock, like canned goods, rice, soda, noodles, biscuits and snack foods. Through this, Daria will be able to improve her store and cater to more buyers, thus augmenting her sales and profit.

loans.use: to buy more stock, like canned goods, rice, soda, noodles, biscuits and snack foods.

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.ru: Несколько лет назад муж Ханифы умер, и ей было очень трудно справляться с семейными расходами, так как от мужа ей не досталось ничего. Она основная кормилица своей семьи. Ханифа имеет 3 детей. Она свет в жизни детей и единственная надежда для них. 20 лет назад она начала свой бизнес купле продажей женской и мужской обуви на местном рынке. Она имеет свою торговую точку на местном рынке. Она в основном продает женскую одежду, так как спрос на обувь больше чем на мужские или детские одежды на местном рынке. Она должна обновить товар на новый сезон и привлечь больше клиентов, так как ей необходимо зарабатывать больше денег для обеспечения своих сирот. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для покупки обуви для нового сезона. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: A few years ago, Hanifa's husband died.  It became very difficult for her to cope with her family's expenses as her husband left them nothing.  She is the main breadwinner for her family which includes her three children.  She is the light in the lives of her kids and their only hope.  Twenty years ago, she started her own business selling women's and men's footwear at a local market.  She has her own space where she sells her goods.  She mostly sells to women since the demand is higher than it is for men's and children's shoes. She needs to update her selection for the new season to attract more clients since she needs to earn more money for her orphaned children.  She's asking for a loan of 2,000 KGS to buy the new season's styles.  She awaits your kindness and relies on your mercy.

loans.use: To buy shoes for the new season

loans.name: Ramona Celina

texts.es: La señora Ramona es  soltera , Maestra de Educación Primaria,  una más,  de las beneficiadas  con dicho crédito el cual le permite efectuar la actividad planteada, por eso visito las oficinas de ceprodel para explicar su necesidad, ya que dicho crédito sería utilizado en la compra de Pacas de Ropa Usada, Actividad Anexa   a su profesión, dicha actividad comercial  la ejerce con el objetivo de mejorar sus condiciones y nivel de vida, ya que el salario no le cubre el total de las necesidades del hogar, entonces buscan estas alternativas de financiamientos y de esa manera el  bajo salario lo vuelven productivo ya que las obligaciones financiera las paga con su salario y le da la oportunidad de Revolvencia del inventario de su negocio y crecer a un mas, ella ya no tiene hijos  su cargo, la señora Ramona le agradece a ceprodel   por el apoyo que tanto lo necesitaba y la oportunidad misma de poder realizar lo que tanto deseaba como es de incrementar su inventario y poder  lograr lo deseado, como son los niveles de venta. ya  que  Ceprodel se caracteriza por Resolver las necesidades Familiares atreves del financiamiento oportuno
texts.en:
Señora Ramona is single, a primary school teacher, and a beneficiary of microcredit. This loan allows her to pursue the proposed activity. For this reason, she visited Ceprodel's offices to explain her needs. This loan will be used to purchase bundles of second-hand clothing, a side business additional to her regular job. 

She runs this business with the goal of improving her living conditions and quality of life, as her salary does not cover all of her household needs; as a result, she looked for alternative sources of income. This way, her small salary becomes productive, as her financial obligations are covered by her salary and it gives her the chance to rotate her inventory and expand it. She does not have any dependent children. 

Señora Ramona thanks Ceprodel for the support that she needed and the chance to accomplish what she wanted: to expand her inventory and achieve her goal, such as her level of sales. Ceprodel is characterized by resolving family needs through timely financing.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of mixed second-hand clothing

loans.name: Lule

texts.en:
Lule, whose name in English means flower, is applying for a loan for the first time to buy an electric stove. She is a mother of four children. Two of her daughters have been suffering with disabilities since birth. 

Here it is what Lule said, wiping her tears away during her interview with the loan officer: “I can say that God blessed me with two daughters and two sons, and it has been a real blessing having them in my life despite the challenges I have had for a very long time now in looking after them. Not easy at all. I have been committed to them 24-7 ever since they were born. I try to do my best, though I don’t know how best to serve them. One thing is for certain, that I love them tremendously, with no doubt. I might never be able to learn from my daughters what my love means to them, and this is a painful thought that comes to my mind constantly.”

loans.use: To best serve her disabled daughters by buying an electric stove.

loans.name: Eak

texts.en: Eak, aged 48 and a mother of five children, is a farmer who grows rice on a two-hectare area as her single source of income. She has operated her business for ages. Eak is new to VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her loan of 1,700,000 KHR to buy potash and good rice seed for her farmland. She hopes to gain a good yield, better than before, with a good profit in return.

loans.use: To buy potash and good rice seed for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Suyunduk

texts.ru: Суйундук 37 лет, замужем, имеет 4 детей (2 дочери и 2 сына). Супруг занимается услугами предоставления такси по селу. Сама Суйундук -домохозяйка. Основным источником дохода является-животноводство. С 2002 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с 10,000 сом KGS. Суйундук трудолюбивая, дружелюбная. На сегодняшний день у нее в хозяйстве имеется: 1 дойная корова, 2 бычка, 1 лошадь. Ее деятельность приносит около 12,000 сом (KGS) в месяц, от продажи молока, и от доходов супруга, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Суйундук обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычка. Доходы от кредита Суйундук планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства, а также, в будущем намерена дать достойное образование своим детям.
texts.en: Suyunduk is 37 years old, married and has four children (two daughters and two sons).  Her spouse works as a taxi driver in their village.  She herself is a homemaker.  However, lifestock is their main source of income.  Since 2002, they have worked with animals, having started the business with 10,000 KGS.  Suyunduk is hardworking and friendly.  Today she has one dairy cow, two bulls and one horse.  Her business brings in around 12,000 KGS a month from the sale of milk and, with the income from her husband, it covers most of the family's food costs.  With the goal of further expanding their farming efforts, Suyunduk turned to the microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 30,000 KGS to buy a bull.  She plans to us the income from the loan to further invest in the farm and also, in the future, to provide her children with a worthy education.

loans.use: to buy a bull

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a 25-year-old maize farmer and a Babban Gona member.  He is excited about the opportunity Babban Gona provides him to improve his farming venture.  Like all Babban Gona members, he has the opportunity to double his income and yield this season and can expect to earn $1,350/ha, twice the average Nigerian farmer’s yearly income.  With this increase in earnings, he intends to renovate his house and start a new business.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to optimize his yields and access a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize, enabling his family to eat healthier maize and for him to get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Dahiru

texts.en: Dahiru is a 42-year-old maize farmer from Pampaida Dutse and a Babban Gona member.  As a member of Babban Gona, he has the opportunity to earn up to $1,350/ha this season, which is double the average Nigerian farmer’s income.  He expects very good yields from his farm this season and hopes to use his increased earnings to further expand his 1.5-hectare maize farm and send his 5 children to school.  With this loan, Dahiru is on his way to achieving these dreams.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to optimize his yields and access to a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize, enabling his family to eat healthier maize and for him to get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: to purchase high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 28 years old and from Naivasha. She is married with one child who is 6 years old.

Caroline has a telephone business that she has been running for the past seven months. She applied for her first loan from KADET Ltd to enable her to buy airtime and float to add to her stock.

She hopes to open another mobile retail shop in the near future.

loans.use: to buy phone airtime and float.

loans.name: Yuliya

texts.ru: Юлия добрая и целеустремленная женщина. Ей 39 лет. Она замужем и имеет одну дочь. Юлия имеет высшее образование. Она работает кассиром в ИМОН ИНТЕРНЕШНЛ. Она работает более 6 лет и показала себя с позитивной стороны. В этом году ее единственная дочь Яна окончила среднюю школу и поступила в университет. Она поступила в Таджикский Государственный Университет Политики и Бизнеса. Она поступила в факультет Финансы и кредит. Яна училась в средней школе отлично. Ее любимым предметом являются английский язык, математика, литература и т.п. В свободное время она занимается хореографическим танцем и рисованием. Яна имеет большое желание работать в банке и поэтому она выбрала эту специальность. Юлия запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора своей дочери. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Iulia is a kind and purposeful woman. She is 39, married, and has one daughter. She has a college degree, and works as a cashier at IMON International. She has been working more than six years and has shown how capable she is. This year her only daughter Yana graduated from high school and entered the Tajikistan State University of Politics and Business. She is studying in the Department of Finance and Credit. Yana was an excellent student in high school. Her favorite subjects are english, math, literature, etc. In her spare time she does choreographic dance and painting. She really wants to work at a bank and therefore she chose to major in finance and credit. Iulia is requesting a loan to pay for her daughter's college tuition. She awaits your kind assistance.

loans.use: To pay for her daughter’s education at the university

loans.name: Concepción

texts.es:
Concepción tiene 49 años de edad y vive con su compañero de vida, dos hijos y dos nietos,los cuales estudian. Hace 2 años inicio con la administración de su propia tienda; ella solo logro estudiar hasta el segundo grado en la escuela y siempre se dedico a vender verduras de forma ambulante. Su compañero de vida se dedica a la pesca artesanal, ya que viven a pocos metros de la costa. Al identificar, que el trabajo de vender ambulantemente le demandaba mucho tiempo fuera de la casa y dejar solos a sus hijos, pensó en tener una tienda en su casa y así podía tener siempre sus ingresos y permanecería siempre en casa pendiente de sus pequeños. La tienda inicio muy pequeña, pero al detectar que los clientes demandan de mas productos esta se va incrementando poco a poco para mantener la clientela siempre satisfecha.  

 Para comprar los productos para su tienda tiene que viajar en autobús durante unos 40 minutos, hasta llegar a la ciudad, ahí compra en una tienda de mayoreo, luego tiene que viajar de regreso a casa ya con sus compras realizadas.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 2 sacos de frijol, un quintal de arroz, un quintal de azúcar y otros productos de la canasta básica familiar, para surtir bien su negocio.

Así, comprara por mayor y obtendrá precios mas bajos, ademas se evitara perdidas de tiempo en ir a comprar por poquitos ya que ademas le sale mas caro. Al tener bien surtido su negocio atendera mejor a sus clientes y satisfacer sus necesidades. 

Ella,  planea dar estudio a sus hijos hasta que sean profesionales
texts.en:
Concepción is 49 years old and lives with her partner, two children, and two grandchildren, who are in school. Two years ago she began running her own store; she managed to study only until the second grade, and has always sold vegetables as a street vendor. Her partner is a traditional fisherman, as they live just a few meters from the coast. Recognizing that selling on the street required a lot of time away from home, leaving her children alone, she thought about having a shop in her house, thus being able to maintain her income and still stay home with her little ones. The shop started out very small, but realizing that her customers wanted more products, it grew little by little to keep the customers satisfied.

To buy the products for her store, she must travel by bus for 40 minutes until she reaches the city, where she makes her purchases in a wholesale store. She then has to travel home with her purchases.

The loan she is requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy 2 sacks of beans, a quintal of rice, a quintal of sugar, and other household staples to ensure that her shop is well-supplied. 

This way, she will be able to buy in bulk and receive lower prices. As well, she will avoid wasting time going to purchase little by little, which also ends up being more expensive. With a well-stocked shop, she will be able to better serve her customers and satisfy their needs.

She plans for her children to study until they are professionals.

loans.use: to purchase 2 sacks of beans, a quintal of rice, a quintal of sugar, and other household staples to stock her shop.

loans.name: Bala

texts.en: Bala is a 41-year-old father of five, maize farmer and a Babban Gona member.  Thanks to his membership with Babban Gona, he finally has access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist.  Like all Babban Gona members, he has the opportunity to double his income and yield this season and can expect to earn up to $1,350/ha.  With the increased income, he plans to educate all of his children and improve their standard of living.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to optimize his yields and access a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize, enabling his family to eat healthier maize and for him to get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Ayuba

texts.en: Ayuba is a diligent maize farmer and a member of Babban Gona.  As a member of Babban Gona, he has the opportunity to double his income and yield this season and can expect to earn $1,350/ha, twice the average Nigerian farmer’s yearly income.  Ayuba is excited about the opportunity to get quality inputs which he can use on his farm to increase his yields and earnings.  With this increase in earnings, he hopes to expand his farming operation and educate his children.  With his loan, he is on his way to achieving these dreams.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to optimize his yields and access a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize, enabling his family to eat healthier maize and for him to get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Usamatu

texts.en: Usamatu is a 38-year-old hardworking farmer from Kurmi Kogi.  He is excited about the opportunity Babban Gona provides him to improve his farming operations, yields and access to good markets.  Like other Babban Gona members, he can expect to earn up to $1,350/ha, which is double the average Nigerian farmer’s income.  With the increase in income, he looks forward to providing for his children and investing in their future.  With this loan, he is on his way to achieving these dreams.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to optimize his yields and access a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize, enabling his family to eat healthier maize and for him to get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Ghali

texts.en: Ghali is a young devoted farmer and a member of Babban Gona.  Like all Babban Gona members, he has the opportunity to double his income and yield this season.  He can expect to earn $1,350/ha, which is twice the average Nigerian farmer's yearly income.  With this increase in earnings, he looks forward to investing in his future.  With this loan, he is on his way to achieving his dreams.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to optimize his yields and access to a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize, enabling his family to eat healthier maize and for him to get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Saidu

texts.en: Saidu is a 47-year-old farmer who dreams of a better life for his family.  He is excited about the opportunities Babban Gona provides him, such as access to premium markets for his maize.  Like all members of Babban Gona, Saidu has the opportunity to earn up to $1,350/ha this season, which is double the average Nigerian farmer’s income.  With his increased earnings, he plans to invest in the future of his children by providing them with a quality education.  He hopes to expand his farming business to ten times its current size and ensure the food security of his family.  With this loan, he is on his way to achieving these dreams.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizers to improve his yields and access to a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize, enabling his family to eat healthier maize and for him to get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Jose Baciliso

texts.es: José,  habita en el departemento de Chontales. Actualmente trabaja como operario de limpieza en una institución del estado. Tiene dos hijos a su cargo menores de 10 años, quienes duermen asignados en una misma habitacion de la casa. Con mucho sacrificio ha podido iniciar la construccion de dos habitaciones por lo que solicita credito para comprar cemento, piedrin, arena, bloques y hierro para poder terminar la obra y brindar a su esposa e hijos mejores condiciones, seguridad y confort.
texts.en: José lives in the Chontales department. He currently works as a cleaner in a State institution. He has two dependent children under age 10, who sleep in the same room of the house. With much sacrifice, he was able to begin the construction of two rooms for which he is requesting a loan to purchase cement, gravel, sand, blocks, and iron to be able to finish the job and provide his wife and children with better living conditions, security, and comfort.

loans.use: to purchase cement, gravel, sand, blocks, and iron

loans.name: Nou's Group

texts.en:
Nou, aged 37 and married, is a mother of three dependent children. She resides in Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. Her main source of income is from a duck raising business, in which she has been involved for just one year. The business has returned her about 19,600 KHR per day. 

Nou has been with VisionFund for the past five cycles and has fully repaid her past loan already. The prior loan has helped her to feed her family and run her business in a timely manner. Now in a group of four, she is a leader. The total loan amount of her entire group is 2,150,000 KHR, of which 350,000 KHR is Nou’s loan portion. 

As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy duck feed and more ducks to expand her business. She hopes to raise her ducks healthily so that she can make income greater than before from this business.

loans.use: to buy duck feed and more ducks to expand her business.

loans.name: Maryamu

texts.en: Maryamu is an industrious and hardworking farmer from Chiroma.  As a devoted mother, she tends to her a farm diligently.  She is excited about the opportunities Babban Gona provides her to increase her yields, through both improved inputs and advice on agricultural best practices.  Like all Babban Gona members, she has the opportunity to double her income and yield this season; she can expect to earn $1,350/ha, which is twice the average Nigerian farmers’ yearly income.  She looks forward to an improved standard of living.  With this loan, she is on her way to achieving her dreams.  Her most recent loan from Babban Gona provided her with enough fertilizer to optimize her yields and access to a product that eliminates a food toxin in her maize, enabling her family to eat healthier maize and for her to get a premium price for the maize she sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double her yields and income

loans.name: Rifkatu

texts.en: Rifkatu is a devoted mother of three, farmer and Babban Gona member.  She is from Chiroma Village in Kaduna State.  Like other members of Babban Gona, she can expect to earn up to $1,350/ha from her maize farm this season, which is double the average Nigerian farmer’s yearly income.  She looks forward to expanding her farm operations to at least 20 hectares.  With this loan, she is on her way to achieving that dream.  Her most recent loan from Babban Gona provided her with enough fertilizer to optimize her yields and access to a product that eliminates a food toxin in her maize, enabling her family to eat healthier maize and for her to get a premium price for the maize her sells.  She intends to use her expected profit to provide her children with a good formal education and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double her yields and income

loans.name: Bitrus

texts.en: Bitrus is a devoted father of 3, farmer and Babban Gona member from Chiroma village in Kaduna.  He is excited about the progress his farm is making due to the services he receives from Babban Gona.  Like all Babban Gona members, he now has access to high quality inputs and expert advice from agronomists and can expect to make up to $1,350/ha this season, which is double the average annual income of most Nigerian farmers.  He looks forward to improving his farming operations and making a positive change in his life.  With this loan, he is on his way to achieving his dreams.  A recent loan by Babban Gona provided him with sufficient fertilizer to ensure maximum productivity of his maize farm as well as a product to detoxify his maize and make it healthier for consumption.  He was also taught how to apply them correctly.  This season, he is very happy with the results he is seeing.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yields and income

loans.name: Aminu

texts.en: Aminu is a 31 year old father, farmer and member of Babban Gona.  He is excited about the agronomy training he receives as a Babban Gona member in addition to access to premium markets.  Like other Babban Gona members, he has the opportunity to make up to $1,350/ha from his farm this season, double the average Nigerian farmer’s yearly income.  With the increase in earnings he hopes to invest in his daughter's future and eventually send her to the best university.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to optimize his yields and access a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize, enabling his family to eat healthier maize and for him to get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Edgar Alexander

texts.es:
Edgar tiene 42 años de edad, es casado y tiene un hijo. Aprendió el oficio de albañil desde que tenia 20 años, junto con su suegro ya que lo andaba como ayudante en todos los trabajos que hacia. Edgar estudio hasta noveno grado, y al ver que no podía conseguir un mejor empleo que el de ayudante de albañil, donde ganaba muy poco y viendo la necesidad de mantener a su familia; se decidió por aprender a trabajar como albañil, ya que así ganaría un poco mas, en la actualidad cada vez que le sale un trabajo, le da empleo a otras personas como ayudantes y también los transporta en su pick up, ya que a veces le salen trabajos bien retirados de casa.  

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 50 yardas de maya ciclón, 150 tubos y para compra de otros materiales de construcción para construir un muro perímetral en su casa ( ya tiene empezada una parte ), esto le dará mas seguridad a él y a su familia dentro de su casa; debido a que sale a trabajar y su familia queda sola y al construir su muro estará mas tranquilo de que a su familia no le pasara nada. 

Planea ahorrar para construir otra casa, para que mas adelante que su familia incremente, puedan vivir muy cómodos y con suficiente espacio.
texts.en:
Edgar is 42 years old, married with one child. He learned the construction trade when he was 20 years old, with his father-in-law when he was his assistant in all of his work. Edgar studied until the ninth grade, and seeing that he could not get a better job than as a construction assistant, where he earned very little, and recognizing the need to support his family, he decided to learn to work as a construction worker himself and earn a little more. Now, each time that he gets a job, he employs others as assistants and transports them in his pick-up truck, as sometimes the jobs are very far from home.

The loan that he is requesting from Fundación Campo is to purchase 50 yards of mesh fencing, 150 tubes, and other construction materials to build a wall around his home (he has already started building it). This will provide him and his family with more security inside their home. Because he leaves for work and his family stays home alone, building this wall will leave him feeling more comfortable that nothing will happen to his family.

He is planning to save up to build another house, so that his family can expand in the future and can live very comfortably with enough space.

loans.use: to purchase 50 yards of mesh fencing, 150 tubes, and other construction materials to build a wall around his house

loans.name: Nara's Group

texts.en: Nara, a mother of two schoolchildren and one other child, is an inhabitant of Battambang province. Her two hectares of paddy rice farmland, with the support of her husband, is her single business in which she has engaged for ages. It has earned her about 24,000 KHR per day. Nara has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before. She formed a group of two to apply for a new loan of 400,000 KHR each. As the leader, Nara will spend her loan portion to buy rice seed and herbicide for her paddy field. She hopes this purchase will triple her yield and make her a good profit.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and herbicide for her paddy field

loans.name: Nuhu

texts.en: Nuhu is a dedicated farmer and member of Babban Gona from Chino village in Kaduna.  Like all Babban Gona members, he can expect to earn up to $1,350/ha from his maize farm this season, double the average Nigerian farmer’s yearly income.  He looks forward to improving his family’s standard of living.  With this loan, he is on his way to achieving his dreams.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to optimize his yields and access to a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize, enabling his family to eat healthier maize and for him to get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a maize farmer, a loving father and a Babban Gona member.  Ibrahim, like other members of Babban Gona, can now access high quality farm inputs like fertilizers and improved seeds, and can learn improved farming techniques from experienced agronomists.  Like all Babban Gona memebers, Ibrahim can expect to earn up to $1,350/ha from his maize farm this season, double the average annual income of most Nigerian farmers.  He looks forward to expanding his farming business and sending his children to good schools.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to optimize his yields and access to a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize, enabling his family to eat healthier maize and for him to get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Danzaria

texts.en: Danzaria is a dedicated maize farmer and member of Babban Gona.  Before joining Babban Gona, his yields were minimal as he did not have access to high quality inputs like improved seeds.  He often purchased seeds with low viability from the open market and low quality fertilizers.  Like all Babban Gona members, he now has access to high quality farm inputs like improved seeds and fertilizer, and also premium markets for his maize product.  He can expect to earn $1,350/ha this season, double the income of an average Nigerian farmer.  With his increased earnings, he hopes to improve the lives of his family.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to optimize his yields and access a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize, enabling his family to eat healthier maize and for him to get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yield and income

loans.name: Yahuza

texts.en: Yahuza is a 25-year-old farmer from Pampaida Dutse.  As a Babban Gona member, he is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist.  Like all Babban Gona members, he can earn up to $1,350/ha this season from his maize farm, double the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  He plans to expand his farming business speedily with his increased earnings.  With this loan, Yahuza is on his way to achieving these dreams.  His most recent loan from Babban Gona provided him with enough fertilizer to optimize his yields and access a product that eliminates a food toxin in his maize, enabling his family to eat healthier maize and for him to get a premium price for the maize he sells.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and improved seed that will double his yields and income

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a 64-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has two grown children. She does farming, and grows and sells rice to earn a living. She has been growing rice for more than ten years.

To sustain her farming activity back to a normal operation, Imelda requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy fertilizers, pesticides and more rice seedlings. 

In the future, Imelda hopes to have a bountiful harvest and be able to set aside some of the profits to save for the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides and more rice seedlings.

loans.name: Marte

texts.en:
Marte is seeking lenders’ financial help to build some pillars for her vineyard; the amount she needs is 200,000 Albanian Lek. This will be her first loan.

Marte is a 57-year-old villager, and together with her four children and husband, lives in rural northeastern Albania. She has been practicing her agricultural skills to earn an income for almost the past nine years. She sells fresh produce in the nearby market and she considers herself lucky to have her children help her out as well. 

“It’s so much easier having your family members help you out. Agriculture requires hard and physical labour, so help from others is mandatory and much appreciated, also,” she said, smiling at her children.

loans.use: to build some pillars for her vineyards.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao, a villager from Sa Ang district of Kandal province, is 34 years old and a mother of four children in school. For her family’s sake, she sells grocery items at home, while her husband grows mangos and beans. This is the business that she has had for ages.

Mao is a fourth-time borrower with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. Her previous loans have helped her to sustain her living and enabled her to buy a decent motorbike to support her farmland. Now, she is requesting a new loan to buy more grocery items for resale including soap, canned food, instant noodles, etc. Additionally, she will spend another portion of her loan to buy potash and insecticide for her crops.

Mao hopes to make a good income so as she can educate her children beyond high school.

loans.use: To buy potash and insecticide for her crops

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph lives in the Ndaragwa area of Kenya, which has one of the cooler climates in Kenya. He has no children and has been farming for 10 years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops, and transportation services.
Joseph stated what is most enjoyable about farming: “Selling the produce.” His biggest challenge is “Watering crops.” Animals on the farm have been given no names.
Joseph was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: “Their good services.” Joseph was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: “They give small loans to farmers to acquire assets.”
Joseph’s highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked how this loan will benefit his family, Joseph replied, “More income will improve the livelihood.”
As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower’s assets are evaluated. Joseph owns the following: a cow, poultry, and motorcycle, but does not own a pig, pump, bicycle, or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. Joseph’s household has electricity, running water, TV, and DVD, but does not have a mosquito net, solar power, or sewing machine.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank.

loans.name: Jesson

texts.en:
Jesson is a 29-year-old married man from Talibon, Bohol. He has 2 children ages 3 and 11 months old respectively.

He operates a motorcycle transport service. He transports passengers from one place to another with a corresponding fee. To have a hassle-free ride, Jesson requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy fuel and for other maintenance to serve his passengers with the best ride. In the future, Jesson would like to invest in other businesses to augment his income and support his growing children.

loans.use: to buy fuel and for other maintenance

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a 33-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She is a mother of four. The oldest child is eight years old, while the youngest is seven months old. 

Teresita raises and sells hogs as her main livelihood. She has been raising hogs for almost one year. Her husband works at a gasoline station. To help sustain her business, Teresita requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy feed like pellets. This will help the pigs grow fast and healthy so she can sell them on time. 

In the future, Teresita would like to invest in other ventures to help meet the family's daily expenses and also send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed like pellets

loans.name: Verónica  Petrona

texts.es: La señora Verónica es originaria de una comarca del poblado , de profesión maestra de primaria y está ubicada  en un colegio de la comunidad, tiene 13 años de impartir clases, su núcleo familiar  consta de 2 personas que son su hijo,  y su esposo, esta señora solicito financiamiento para terminar el pago de un lote de terreno, por tal razón visito las oficinas de ceprodel para ser beneficiada y de esa manera mejorar sus condiciones y nivel de vida, lo que le dara satisfacción de brindarle a su familia principalmente a sus  hijos , que es por quien    se esfuerza cada día para darle lo  mejor.
texts.en: Verónica is originally from a region in town. She's a primary school teacher and works in a school in the community. She has been a teacher for 13 years. Her nuclear family comprises 2 people: her son and her husband. She is requesting a loan to finish payment on a parcel of land. She visited the Ceprodel office in order to request this loan as a way to improve her family's conditions and quality of life, especially her children, which would bring her great satisfaction, as they are the reason she makes an effort every day.

loans.use: finish payment on a parcel of land.

loans.name: Yashar

texts.en:
Yashar, a 47-year-old married father of a 25-year-old son, has 20 years of experience as a master of auto repair. He also sells auto spare parts and is engaged in welding operations. He has earned the respect of the village thanks to the quality and integrity of his work. Previous loans from VFAC helped him develop his business, and in the future he plans to expand the service.

Yashar's son is getting married, and according to tradition the groom's family gives gold items to the bride as weddings gifts. For this purpose Yashar has requested a loan of 1000 AZN manats. He thanks all and wishes you health and the desire and ability to perform noble deeds

loans.use: To buy gold items for his son's wedding.

loans.name: Tom

texts.en:
Tom is 40 years old. He lives in the Kongowea area near Mombasa, Kenya. He is married and blessed with five children aged between 2 and 17 years.

He has a medical clinic in Kongowea that has been in operation for five years now. The business has been doing great and he has two employees who help run the clinic. He also owns a motorbike transport business as well as an M-Pesa outlet (a mobile phone based money transfer service).

He has ambitions that the clinic business will grow into a reputable hospital in the next five years. The challenge in the business is finding customers for now. He knew Milango through a friends and he seeks a loan to buy medical supplies for the clinic. The extra income that he will raise will pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: to buy medical supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy products to stock her grocery store business.

loans.name: Enhsaihan

texts.en:
Ms. Enhsaihan is 25 years old and lives with her brother and parents in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar. Currently she is studying for a masters degree at the National University of Mongolia. She is so passionate about different and old languages and this has driven her to choose linguistics as her major.

After she graduates from her university, she will be able to get a job which pays a salary of around a million MNT, thus she will provide financial support for her family.

She is now requesting a loan of 1,112,500 MNT to pay her tuition fee to obtain good knowledge to invest in her future as well as her family.

loans.use: to pay tuition fee

loans.name: Lilivit

texts.en:
Lilivit is a 48-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has 9 children: the oldest is 17 while the youngest is 3.

She raises hogs. She raises and sells hogs as a source of her livelihood.  She has been raising hogs for almost 10 years. Her husband works as an electrical technician.

Due to lack of capital, she requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy additional pigs and feeds to increase the number of pigs and also increase sales. In the future, Lilivit would like to expand her business to provide her children with the best.

loans.use: to buy additional pigs and feeds

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a hardworking woman who operates a vegetable stall. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a grocery store in the future.

With the KES 10,000 she wants to purchase stock of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 24-year-old single man living in the capital city of Tbilisi with his parents. George is unemployed at the moment and the only source for the family is the small income earned by George’s father working as a furniture manufacturer.

George owns a car and plans to use it as a taxi and start a business, but it is out of order and now he is requesting credit to fix the car. His request was approved in the framework of the Start Up program, which is a joint initiative of Kiva and MFO, permitting the vulnerable poor to start or re-start businesses.

A loan of $1,000 will help George to pay for the repair of his car and change his car's fuel system from benzene to gas, which is cheaper than benzene and will reduce the cost of transportation by 40 to 45 per cent. It will allow George to offer cheap service to his customers. With this Startup loan, George will start a taxi business and help the family in covering food and everyday expenses. The increased income will be used for his family's well being.

loans.use: to repair his car and change the fuel system

loans.name: Sabir

texts.en:
Sabir has been breeding bees for honey, beeswax and other products, as well as for the pollination of crops in order to increase their productivity. He has been in this business for more 16 years. He needs to buy crates for bees, so he applied for a loan of 1,200 AZN.

Sabir is married and has three children ages 19, 17 and 15. He works as a teacher of mathematics and private tutor by profession.

loans.use: To buy crates for bees.

loans.name: Robin Yobani

texts.es:
Robin tiene 33 años de edad,tiene estudio hasta bachillerato, su compañera de vida se dedica a hacer arreglos de sastrería (confección), tiene un hijo de 7 años, que se encuentra estudiando actualmente. 
Cuando Robin,  logro terminar su bachillerato técnico en mecanica automotriz, luego ya no pudo seguir preparandose por falta de recursos económicos. Por la situición que hay en el país de desempleo; no ha podido ejercer sus conocimientos en mécanica. Pero gracias a su tío, que le enseño  el oficio de albañileria , hoy trabaja como ayudante en trabajos que consigue su tío. Trabajan donde haya la oportunidad sea cerca o lejos de su casa. Su horario es de 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde.  Robin gana  $6 dólares el día de trabajo. 

El prestamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 400 ladrillos, 3 bolsas de cemento, 2 quintales de hierro y 2 metros cúbicos de arena.  Lo requiere para la mejora de su  vivienda que esta construyendo poco a poco por no poseer los recursos  suficientes. Al terminarla, podrá tener  en mejores condiciones  su vivienda y su familia tendrá tranquilidad y seguridad ante las lluvias y la inseguridad del país. 
Don Robin, desea ejercer su profesión de mecánico automotriz , estableciendo su propio negocio , pudiendo así tener mejores ingresos para su familia y darle los estudios a su hijo.
texts.en:
Robin is 33 years old. He studied until receiving his college diploma. His life partner makes a living through tailoring repairs (dressmaking). He has one child who is 7 years old, who currently is studying.

When Robin was able to finish his technical degree in automotive mechanics, he was not able to continue preparing himself at that time because of a lack of economic resources. Because of the unemployment situation of the country, he has not been able to practice his mechanical knowledge. However, thanks to his uncle who taught him the construction trade, he now works as an assistant on jobs that his uncle obtains. They work where there is an opportunity, whether it is close or far from his home. His schedule is from 8 in the morning until 5 in the evening. Robin makes 6 dollars per day of work.

The loan that he is requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy 400 bricks, 3 bags of cement, 2 hundredweights of iron, and 2 cubic meters of sand. He wants it to improve his home that he is building little by little since he does not possess sufficient resources. When finished, he will be able to have his home in better condition and his family will have tranquility and security from the rains and the country’s insecurity.

Robin wishes to practice his profession of automotive mechanics, establishing his own business and therefore being able to have a better income for his family and to pay for his child’s studies.
