Le groupe Benkadi composé de femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 42 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Fala Sidibela, commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioîla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréale, et de condiments. Les femmes du groupe Benkadi sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter des céréales et des condiments.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
 La personne au milieu  s’appelle Maramou Seydou, elle compte acheter avec son prêt 5 sacs de riz non décortiqué. Il faut noter que ces sacs pèses chacun 45kg. Ces sacs de riz seront décortiqués et mis au marché à Massigui.  
Elle envisage réaliser mensuellement un bénéfice moyen de 36 000FCFA. Ce bénéfice sera utilisé pour  agrandir son activité.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group is made up of married women who are, on average, 42 years old and who also have an average of four children each.  They all live in extended traditional families in the village of Fala Sidibela, in the commune of Massigui, Cercle of Dioîla, in the Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They know one another through kinship, neighborhood and friendship ties.  They grow grains and condiments.  The women who compose the Benkadi group are on their sixth solidarity loan and will use this new loan to buy grains and condiments.

The woman standing in the middle of the group is named Maramou Seydou.  She is planning to use her loan to buy five bags of unhulled rice, each bag weighing 45 kg.  This rice will be hulled and then sold at the Massigui market.

Maramou Seydou is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 36,000 CFA francs, which will be used to increase her activity.

loans.use: to buy grains.

loans.name: Tinigay

texts.ru:
Тинигай 48-летняя женщина, мать четырех детей.  Она занимается животноводством более 25 лет, бизнес у них семейный.  Муж Тинигай и сыновья непосредственно участвуют в этом бизнесе, они выводят на продажу в скотные рынки откормленных скотов, продают и вместо них покупают молодых коз и баранов.  Также дополнительно подрабатывают на стройке. А Тинигай и её невестки дома занимаются домашними делами, но когда мужчины уходят на заработки они ухаживают за скотом.   Семья у них очень дружная и трудолюбивая.  
Тинигай хочет получить кредит,чтобы увеличить поголовье скота.  Она очень надеется на поддержку со стороны организации Арванд и заранее благодарит.
texts.en:
Tinigay is 48 years old and the mother of four children.  She has been involved in her family's business, animal husbandry, for more than 25 years.  Her husband and sons are directly involved in this activity.  They take their fattened livestock to the cattle markets to be sold, and then buy young goats and sheep.  

In addition to animal husbandry, the family is also involved in construction.  Tinigay and her daughters-in-law are responsible for the household chores, but when the men go to work, the women are the ones taking care of the cattle.  Tinigay's family is very united and hardworking.

Tinigay has requested a loan in order to increase her cattle headcount.  She hopes to receive some support from the organization MDO Arvand, and thanks her lenders in advance.

loans.use: to buy some cattle.

loans.name: Las Aguilas Group

texts.es:
El grupo las Águilas está conformado por 06 socias. Hilaría es una de ellas, dentro del grupo tiene el cargo de tesorera. Hilaria  es casada y tiene 03 hijos mayores de edad. Hace 15 años trabaja en su bodega, su negocio está ubicado en su misma casa  sus clientes más frecuentes son sus  vecinos y personas que transitan por el lugar, ellos acuden a su bodega en busca de diversos productos en su mayoría comestibles. Hilaria siempre se preocupa por ofrecer calidad y buenos precios, gracias a su trabajo ha logrado que sus hijos sean profesionales, en la actualidad tiene una bodega grande y surtida con toda clase de productos, con el préstamo solicitado comprara más productos para su bodega y así mantener contenta a su clientela, en el futuro le gustaría ampliar su casa para poner una bodega más grande y con toda clase de productos.
Hilaria agradece el apoyo que le brindan al darle este crédito tanto a ella como a su grupo comunal, en la foto lleva puesto un saco color negro. 
*En la parte superior aparece la foto de una de las socias que no pudo asistir al desembolso, la Srta.Gina.
texts.en:
The las Águilas group is made up of 6 female members. Hilaria, who is one of them, is the group's treasurer and is married with 3 adult children. She has been working in her grocery store, which is in her own house, for 15 years. Her most frequent clients are her neighbours and people passing through the area. They come to her shop for a variety of products, mainly food items. Hilaria always makes sure she offers quality and good prices. Thanks to her work she has had the success of her children becoming professionals. 

Currently Hilaria has a large grocery store stocked with all kinds of products. She will use the loan she has asked for to buy more products for the store and so keep her customers happy. In the future she would like to extend her house to have a bigger grocery store with all kinds of products. Hilaria is grateful for the help you give to her and the rest of her group by providing this loan. 

In the photo Hilaria is wearing a black jacket. At the top of the photo there is a photo of one of the members, Gina, who could not be present for the payment.

loans.use: to buy products for her grocery store.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth tiene sesenta (60) años de edad, reside en el municipio de Puerto Colombia, departamento del Atlántico, a 13 km de la Ciudad de Barranquilla, y forma parte del área metropolitana de esta ciudad. Colinda al norte con las costas del mar caribe. Por lo que su actividad económica más importante es el turismo. La señora Elizabeth tiene 3 hijos, de treinta y dos (32), treinta y seis (36), y cuarenta (40) años de edad, su estado civil es separada. Sus actividades de negocio son: Miscelanea, venta de colonias, perfumes, cremas, y cosméticos por catálogos, y confección de prendas de vestir femeninas y masculinas. Desde hace treinta (30) años ejerce el oficio de confecciones que lo aprendió de su mamá, desde muy joven. La venta de mercancía la inició hace menos tiempo, atendiendo una sugerencia de una amiga, que la motivó a vincularse a esta actividad, para buscar mayores ingresos para su familia. Compra los materiales, insumos, mercancías en almacenes de la ciudad de Barranquilla, a crédito y contado. Y vende a amigos, vecinos y familiares también en estas dos modalidades. Su jornadas de trabajo son todos los días de ocho (8) de la mañana a ocho (8) de la noche. Este es su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, el cual lo aplicará en la compra de telas, hilos, encajes, perfumes, colonias, cremas, cosméticos y accesorios. Con esta inversión espera aumentar las ventas, las utilidades, y generar ahorros. Su meta a largo o mediano plazo, es la de terminar de remodelar su casa, y ampliar el negocio de la miscelánea.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 60 years old and lives in the town of Puerto Colombia, department of Atlántico, 13 km from the city of Barranquilla and part of the metropolitan area of the city. The Caribbean coast is nearby to the north, so her most important business is tourism. Elizabeth is separated and has 3 children aged 32, 36 and 40. Her businesses are: general store, selling colognes, perfumes, creams and cosmetics through catalogues, and sewing men's and women's clothing. She learnt how to sew from her mother when she was very young and has been making clothes for 30 years. She started selling merchandise more recently on the suggestion of a friend who encouraged her to start this business to generate more income for her family. She buys materials, supplies and merchandise at stores in the city of Barranquilla, by cash or credit. She sells to friends, neighbours and family members by the same payment methods. Her working day is from 8 in the morning until 8 at night. 

This is her first Kiva loan with the Fundación Santo Domingo and she will use it to buy fabric, thread, lace, perfumes, colognes, creams, cosmetics and accessories. With this investment she hopes to be able to increase her sales and her profits, and put some money into savings. Her medium to long term goal is to finish refurbishing her home and to increase the general store business.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, lace, perfumes, colognes, creams, cosmetics and accessories.

loans.name: Azaroius

texts.en:
Azaroius is a sixty-year old married man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. He deals in agriculture and with the proceeds he has been able to buy more land and expand his farm. Like most farmers he is challenged by unpredictable weather changes, while his dream is to become a model farmer in the area. 

Azaroius intends to use the money to buy pesticides and seeds for his farm.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and seeds for his farm.

loans.name: Sainbayar

texts.en:
Mr. Sainbayar, 38 years old, lives with his wife and children in Kherlen, the easternmost town of Mongolia. He and his wife have been making and selling cookies to the local people since 2007 and managed to secure lot of customers. His cookie factory has been damaged due to old age and harsh climate. So he is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials in order to repair the factory roof and walls. The materials he needs are bricks, shingles, cement and fiberglass. After repairing and insulating the cookie factory, he won't have to worry about storage. Also, the renovated factory has a positive impact on the environment because the amount of coal needed for heating will be decreased and less pollutants will be released into the air. 

The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to renovate his cookie factory.

loans.name: Enidia

texts.es: Enidia es una mujer de sesenta y un (61) años de edad, reside en el municipio de Puerto Colombia, departamento del Atlántico, a 13 km de la Ciudad de Barranquilla, y forma parte del área metropolitana de esta ciudad. Colinda al norte con las costas del mar caribe. Por lo que su actividad económica más importante es el turismo. Vive con su conyugue, con el cual tiene tres hijos en edades de Treinta (30), treinta y dos (32) y treinta y cinco (35) años de edad. Su actividad de negocio es una miscelánea, donde vende artículos de papelería, cosméticos, cremas para manos y cuerpo, pérfumes, colonias y lencerías. Desde hace dos (2) años inició esta actividad, atendiendo una sugerencia de los vecinos, quienes la motivaron a emprender este negocio desde su casa. Compra de contado todos los artículos en almacenes mayoristas de la ciudad de Barranquilla. Vende de contado a vecinos y referidos. Su negocio lo abre todos los días de siete (7) de la mañana a siete (7) de la noche. Este es su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, el cual lo aplicará en la compra de cremas, colonias, cosméticos, y artículos de papelería. Con esta inversión espera aumentar las ventas, las utilidades, y generar ahorros. Su meta a  mediano plazo, es la de seguir ampliando su inventario, y remodelar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Enidia is 61 years old and  and lives in the town of Puerto Colombia, department of Atlántico, 13 km from the city of Barranquilla and part of the metropolitan area of the city. The Caribbean coast is nearby to the north, so her most important business is tourism. She lives with her husband and they have three children aged 30,32 and 35. 

Enidia runs a general store where she sells items of stationery, cosmetics, hand and body lotions, perfumes, colognes and lingerie. She has been doing this for 2 years following a suggestion from her neighbours who encouraged her to start this business up in her home. She buys her supplies in cash from wholesale stores in the city of Baranquilla. She sells on a cash basis to neighbours and people referred by them. She opens her shop every day from 7 in the morning until 7 at night. 

This is Enidia's first Kiva loan with the Fundación Santo Domingo and she will use it to buy creams, colognes, cosmetics and items of stationery. With this investment she hopes to be able to increase her sales and her profits, and put some money into savings. Her medium term goal is to continue to increase her range and to refurbish her house.

loans.use: to buy creams, colognes, cosmetics and items of stationery.

loans.name: Tsogzolmaa

texts.en: Mrs Tsogzolmaa, 58 years old, lives alone in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her elder daughter studies in the USA. Her second daughter got married and lives separately. Tsogzolmaa's youngest daughter works in Korea on an employment contract. Tsogzolmaa herself has been running a grocery store for twelve years. The house she lives in has deteriorated and it needs some serious repair. So Tsogzolmaa is requesting a loan of 4000000 MNT to purchase building materials such as bricks, cements, planks, vacuum insulated windows, and fibreglass. By doing so, she can live in a warm and comfortable place; in winter time, storm and wind were getting through the windows and walls. The renovated house will enable Tsogzolmaa to burn less coal for heating, thus releasing less pollutants into the air, which will contribute to the efforts against air pollution.

loans.use: To purchase building and insulation materials

loans.name: Sok Heng

texts.en:
Sok Heng (in the photo) is a chef and he also does construction work when he is free. His wife is a silk weaver. He lives on an island of the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. He has three daughters who are in school.  
Sok Heng is asking for a loan to assist in his wife’s weaving business by buying purchase silk materials.

loans.use: To assist in his wife’s silk weaving by buying silk materials.

loans.name: Bayarsuren

texts.en: Mr Bayarsuren, 34 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Using his previous loan, he has fenced his land. His family income consists of his taxi service income and his wife's salary in teaching. Bayarsuren is now requesting a loan of 2100000 MNT to purchase building materials such as planks, cements and stones. Using those materials, he wants to build a house foundation on his land. He says it is his big step toward building his dream house. Building a high quality house will enable his family to burn less coal for heating and reduce their coal consumption. Coal is considered to be the main source of air pollution.

loans.use: to build a house foundation

loans.name: Sokhim's Group

texts.en:
Sokhim is a 32-year-old mother of two children living in a rural village of the Ponhea Krek district, Cambodia. She has been growing pepper to make a living for almost three years. The current business earns her about 27,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 
Sokhim has just joined with VisionFund this cycle. Now she is leading her group of two to apply for a loan to buy coconut leaf to help the pepper in growing well. She hopes this loan will enable her to harvest more crops from her pepper plantation so as to sell them for a good price.

loans.use: To buy coconut leaf to help the pepper plantation in growing well

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Chanthou's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village of the Dambae district where crop farming is a common way to make a living, Chanthou is a 24-year-old and she is married. Rice farming and cassava planting are the main sources of the family’s income. The current business earns her about 30,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s need. 
This is the second microloan for Chanthou with Kiva’s partner, and she has completely paid back the first loan. Now leading her group of three to apply for a loan, Chanthou will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and also use a portion of it to plough the field. She hopes this loan will enable her to have another source of family’s income so as to increase her income and make for a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es: Marta mujer emprendedora de 31 años de edad soltera, su negocio es la elaboración y venta de artesanía de bambú desde hace 8 años. El crédito lo solicita para la compra al por mayor de varas de bambú para elaborar sus productos de bambú.
texts.en: Marta is a resourceful woman; she is 31 years old, she is single and she has been engaging in bamboo handicrafts for 8 years The loan she is requesting will be used to buy bamboo sticks at wholesale price to make her bamboo products.

loans.use: To buy bamboo sticks.

loans.name: Thy's Group

texts.en:
Thy is from a rural area located in the Prey Chhor district where rice farming is a common way to earn a living. She is aged 52 years and married. She and her husband have struggled to feed their seven children by farming rice on one-hectare area of farmland. Having been in this business for 34 years, the current business earns her approximately 25,000KHR per day.
 
Thy is a first cycle client with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farmland. She hopes to make more income so as to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Carlos Albeiro

texts.es: Carlos es un señor de 52 años de edad que vive en unión libre con su pareja. Nació en una familia humilde y le ha tocado trabajar desde muy joven para generar ingresos y sustentar sus necesidades básicas. Durante toda su vida productiva se ha desempeñado como obrero de construcción y contratista de obras. Actualmente desempeña esta actividad de manera independiente con la cual ha podido generar ingresos para solventar las necesidades de su familia. Cuenta con la ventaja de ser muy reconocido por la calidad del servicio que presta y la mayoría de los contratos que obtiene es por referencias de trabajos realizados anteriormente y de clientes que se encuentran a gusto con su servicio, esto le ha permitido ampliar poco a poco su clientela. Carlos es un hombre pujante, trabajador y responsable. En el momento solicita el apoyo del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de herramientas de trabajo (pala, palustres, plomada,  almádanas, taladro), esto le dará la posibilidad de ampliar sus contratos con nuevos clientes y podrá contratar el apoyo de otras personas, así incrementará sus ingresos para continuar avanzando hacia el cumplimiento de su principal sueño que es tener un lote grande con todas las herramientas necesarias para poder trabajar sin restricciones y poder atender oportunamente a sus clientes, además abrirá la posibilidad de tener una estabilidad económica favorable para brindar mejor calidad de vida a su esposa.
texts.en:
Carlos is 52 years old and lives with his partner. He was born into a humble family and has had to work from a very young age to make money to cover the basic needs. All of his working life he has worked as a construction worker and works contractor. Now he is working independently and has been able to earn enough to cover the family's needs. He has the advantage of being well recognised for the quality of service he provides and most of the jobs he gets are through references from work he has previously carried out and customers who are satisfied with his service. This has allowed him to gradually increase his clientele. Carlos is a hard-working, determined and responsible man.

He is now asking for this loan to buy work tools (shovel, trowels, plumb line, sledgehammers, drill). This will enable him to increase his contracts with new customers and he will be able to take on other people to help him. By doing this he will be able to increase his income and work towards fulfilling his main dream, which is to have a large plot of land where he can keep all the tools he needs to be able to work without any restrictions and to be able to attend properly to his customers. This will also open up the possibility of having a better economic stability, to give his wife a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy work tools (shovel, trowels, plumb line, sledgehammers, drill).

loans.name: Houy's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Dambae district, Houy is 26 years old and married with one daughter. The main source of the family’s income is from cassava growing. Having been in this business for eight years, she is able to earn about 23,000KHR per day but she can save about 10,000KHR each day after daily expenses.
 
Houy has been with VisionFund for two cycles while the other member has been with VisionFund for one cycle. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Houy, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farmland and also use a portion of it to pay for labor fee. She hopes to make more income so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farmland

loans.name: Yut's Group

texts.en:
Aged 36 years old, Yut is the mother of three children living in a rural village of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. Cassava planting is the main source of family’s income. She has been in this business for 18 years. She can earn about 33,000KHR per day to meet her family’s needs.
 
Yut has been with VisionFund for two cycles. Now she is leading her group of three to apply for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy pesticide and fertilizer for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to grow her cassava well and sell it for a good price to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy pesticide and fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Erdenebayar

texts.en: Mr. Erdenebayar, 40 years old, lives with his wife and two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His family has been living in a house on his friend's plot of land for about eight years. His two daughters go to high school. He has been making and selling putty to the local people for a living. His wife works as a water distributor. He purchases all of his raw materials from a China border city and usually brings materials in large quantities. During this time of year, demand increases drastically so he is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase putty ingredients. As a result, he can continue to make and sell his putty without worrying about inventory shortage.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials needed for making putty.

loans.name: Baatardorj

texts.en: Mr. Baatardorj, 36 years old, lives with his wife and children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their house on a plot of land. Baatardorj has been working at a police department for 18 years and is considered among the best staff by his superiors. He is requesting a loan of 1,800,000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and fiber. Using those materials, he will repair and insulate his own house, thus creating a more comfortable and warmer environment for his family. Also, the renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal for heating, thus releasing fewer pollutants into the air and contributing to the effort to fight air pollution.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials.

loans.name: Naieng's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager from the Tbaung Khum district, Naieng is 60 years old and married. She has seven children, one of whom is still in school. She is a farmer who has been planting rice and cassava for 42 years. Naieng currently earns about 28,000 KHR per day.

Naieng is requesting a micro-loan from VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to request this loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice healthfully so as to sell it for a good price.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
Residing in the Santok district of the Kampong Thom province, Phally is 65 years old and married with two children, one of whom is still in school. She and her husband earn a living by working as teachers. Having been engaged in this job for 27 years, they are able to earn about $18 per day and they manage to save about $5 each day after daily expenses. 

Phally has never been with Kiva's partner, VisionFund, before. Now, she is applying as a first-time borrower with VisionFund to cover the entire tuition fees for her son to study banking at a local institute. She hopes to keep her son studying until he graduates in order for him to get a good job so he can support the family and help them improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To cover the entire tuition fees for her son to study banking at a local institute.

loans.name: Charles

texts.es:
Charles, de 36 años es un hombre optimista y muy trabajador, está casado y tiene 2 hijos de 9 y 13 años de edad respectivamente con quienes vive en su casa propia. Charles se dedica a realizar todo tipo de trabajos de torno y soldadura en motores, vehículos u otros, su público es muy variado y cuenta con una amplia cartera de clientes. El taller se encuentra en su casa. Trabaja con ayuda de tres personas y lleva en este negocio cerca de 14 años, la exigencia de su clientela lo ha incentivado siempre a hacer un buen trabajo y continuar mejorando en las obras que realiza. Atiende desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche.
Le gusta mucho lo que hace porque le permite trabajar en lo que es su pasión desde muy niño, las oportunidades que éste trabajo le brinda y las satisfacciones que le otorga todos los días ha hecho que se sienta cada vez más seguro y contento por haber puesto su esfuerzo en ésta actividad. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500, por tanto se siente agradecido con todas las personas que le brindan el préstamo que necesita para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con el monto solicitado comprará latas de soldadura cuyo precio es muy elevado.
texts.en:
Charles is 36 years old and is optimistic and hard-working. He is married with 2 children aged 9 and 13 who live with him in his own house. Charles does all kinds of work involving lathes and soldering in engines, vehicles and other things. He has a diverse clientele and a large portfolio of customers. His workshop is at his home and he has 3 people who help him with the work. He has been in business for around 14 years and the demands of his customers have always motivated him to do a good job and keep improving in the work he does. He works from 8 in the morning until 8 at night. 

Charles really enjoys his job as he is able to work in something which has been a passion of his since he was very young. He feels increasingly secure and happy that he has put so much effort into his work because of the opportunities it gives him and the satisfaction he gets from it every day. 

At present he is asking for a loan of 1500 soles and is therefore grateful to all the people who provide the loan he needs in order to meet his objectives. At the same time he is committed to paying his instalments punctually. He will use the sum of money to buy tins of solder, which are very expensive.

loans.use: to buy tins of solder.

loans.name: Nayanzaya

texts.en: Mrs. Nayanzaya, 32 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been running a shoe sales business for eleven years and has accumulated a vast amount of experience in choosing high quality shoes from Chinese outlets and managing logistic issues. Her husband is currently unemployed and helps her business. She is requesting a loan of 7,000,000 MNT to purchase an electric car which will be used by her husband for taxi services. The advantage of an electric car is that it contributes to cleaner air in cities because it produces no harmful pollution from the tailpipe from the onboard source of power, such as particulates (soot), volatile organic compounds, hydrocarbons, carbon monoxide, ozone, lead, and various oxides of nitrogen. As her husband begins generating income, her family's living standards will surely increase.

loans.use: to purchase an electric car.

loans.name: Sophal's Group

texts.en:
Sophal is aged 34 and married. She lives with her husband and two children in a rural area located in the Dambae district, Cambodia. She is a farmer who grows rice and cassava on two hectares of farmland annd has been in this business for 14 years. The current business earns her family about 43,000 KHR per day to feed the family, but she manages to save about 18,000 KHR each day.

This is the second loan for Sophal with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to request for a loan of 1,200,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor fees. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her family’s business and earns more income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Susana

texts.es: Susana, de 35 años, es casada y madre de 4 hijos a quienes cuida y educa en su casa propia. Susana se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras regionales, entre ellos tiene ajíes, limones, culantro, yuca, camu camu, cebollas, frijoles y otros productos comerciales. Realiza sus ventas en su puesto propio ubicado en el mercado más concurrido de la ciudad con todo lo que tiene para ofrecer a sus ocasionales clientes. Lleva realizando este trabajo desde hace 2 años y lo complementa eventualmente con la venta de pescados u otras carnes. Durante el tiempo que lleva realizando su labor aprendió muchas cosas ya que las experiencias que ha tenido le enseñaron a ser mas cuidadosa con algunos productos y a poder invertir mas en otros. Espera seguir trabajando mucho ya que su máximo anhelo es que sus hijos culminen sus estudios, además desea establecer un almacén donde pueda comprar y vender productos al por mayor. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 500, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segunda de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado comprará plátanos, frutas regionales, maíz y frijoles al por mayor.
texts.en:
Susana is 35 years old, married, and is the mother of four children who she cares for and educates at home. Susana makes a living selling regional fruits and vegetables, including peppers, lemons, coriander, manioc,  camu camu, onions, beans, and other commercial produce. She sells her goods from her stall in the busiest market in the city, offering all she has to her occasional customers. 

She has worked in this business for two years, which she sometimes supplements by selling fish or meat. Over time, she has learned a lot. Some experiences have taught her to be more careful with some products and to invest more in others. She hopes she can continue to make a living in this way for a long time to come, because her greatest desire is to see her children finish their studies. She would also like to set up a store, where she can buy and sell goods in bulk. 

On this occasion, she is requesting a loan of  500 soles. She is very happy to know that she will be given financial help, because it will help her to feel more secure in moving forward with her business. She is committed to making her loan repayments on time.She will use the loan to buy plantain, regional fruits, corn and beans in bulk.

loans.use: to buy plantain, regional fruits, corn and beans.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.es: Amalia, de 36 años, es madre soltera de 2 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. El trabajo de Amalia, consiste en la venta de cosméticos y productos de aseo personal, vende todo tipo de artículos como perfumes, cremas corporales, cremas faciales, coloretes, rubores, polvos para rostro, desodorantes y otros accesorios femeninos mediante el sistema de venta por catálogo, también tiene un espacio de exhibición en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes. Lleva en esta actividad 9 años, trabaja sola y gana muy buenos ingresos. Le gusta su trabajo ya que ha logrado tener mucha independencia y porque puede generar ella misma sus propia fuente de ingresos. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado comprará perfumes, talcos, cremas de piel, aretes y acondicionadores para ofrecerlos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Amalia is 36 years old, and is a single mother of two children who live with her in her home. Amalia makes a living selling cosmetics and personal care products. She sells many different products, such as perfume, body lotion, face cream, eyeshadow, blusher,  face powder, deodorant and other beauty products for women. She sells her items through catalogs, and also has a display is her home which customers can visit.

She has worked in this business for nine years. She works alone and earns a good income. She enjoys her job because it has given her a lot of independence and the chance to make her own money. 

On this occasion, she is requesting 1500 soles. She is very happy to know that she will receive financial support, since it will help her to feel more secure moving forward with her business. She is committed to making her loan repayments on time. She will use the loan to buy perfume, talcum powder, body lotions, earrings and hair conditioner to offer to her customers.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics such as perfume, talcum powder, body lotions, earrings and others.

loans.name: Lkhagva-Ochir

texts.en:
Mr. Lkhagva-Ochir, is 69-years-old and lives with his wife in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Together with his children, he owns a three-flat apartment and rents two of the flats to business organizations. 

Over the years, the apartment walls, roof and windows have deteriorated and the apartment no longer keeps the heat well. 

Mr. Lkhagva-Ochir is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass, shingles and foam. With these materials, Mr. Lkhagva-Ochir, together with his children, can repair and insulate their old apartment. 

All the income generated by the family comes from rental fees paid by the two business organizations. The renovation will make the working environment better and preserve energy more efficiently.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials.

loans.name: Guljamal

texts.ru: Гулжамал 24 года, незамужем.  У Гулжамал среднее образование, имеет очень хорошие отзывы от своих соседей. Они отзываются о ней как о доброй и трудолюбивой девушке. Гулжамал в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 2008 года занимается торговлей DVD-дисками, начав этот бизнес с 2,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Гулжамал, она смогла развить и расширить свой товар, ее деятельность приносит около 10,000 сом KGS в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. Доходы от бизнеса позволили Гулжамал расширить свой товарооборот. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулжамал обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку оптовых товаров DVD-дисков для дальнейшей перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Гулжамал планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса, а также в будущем намерена купить квартиру.
texts.en: Glujamal is 24 and single. She has a high school diploma, and good references from her neighbors. As the sole source of income for her family, Glujamal has been selling DVDs since 2008. She started the business with 2,000 som KGS. Thanks to her hard work, she has succeeded in developing and expanding her product inventory, and her business brings in nearly 10,000 som KGS per month. This mainly covers her expenses for food and the family's everyday needs. The business's income has enabled Glujamal to increase her sales. With the goal of further expanding her business, Glujamal has applied for a loan at Bai Tushum & Partners in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy wholesale DVDs for resale. Glujamal plans to invest the proceeds from the loan into further expanding her business, and to buy an apartment some day.

loans.use: to buy DVDs for resale

loans.name: Eap

texts.en:
Eap is 53-years-old. She is married and currently lives with her husband and four children in the Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham. 

Eap and her spouse work together, farming rice on a few pieces of farmland to make a living. Eap always wants to grow her business and have a bigger crop, generating more income. Eap has been involved in agriculture for 15 years.

Eap has been with HKL for one loan already and has repaid it. She is now seeking another loan to purchase a motorcycle, which will help her son in his travelling sales business, selling ice-cream and soybean juice in Siem Reap province. 

Eap hopes that she is able to help her son improve his business through the loan support.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to help her son in his travelling sales business.

loans.name: Dorj

texts.en:
Mr. Dorj is 54-years-old. He lives with his wife in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as a driver for one of Mongolia's main political parties since 2005. His wife has been selling furniture and curtains to local people by renting stall at trade center. 

The house they live in has deteriorated over the years and is in need of serious repair. Mr. Dorj is requesting a loan of 3,500,000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials such as bricks, cement, planks, fiberglass and foam. 

Using these materials, he will repair and insulate his own house, making it more comfortable and warmer. The renovated house will enable the family to burn less coal and release less pollutants into air, contributing to the efforts against air pollution.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials.

loans.name: Batsaikhan

texts.en:
Mr. Batsaikhan is 46-years-old. He lives with his wife, two daughters and father in law in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live in their own house on a plot of land. 

Mr Batsaikhan has been operating a transportation business using his own microvan since 2001. His wife currently stays at home after giving birth. Before giving birth, she was a conductor for his microvan. Mr Batsaikhan's father in law has retired from work and gets a state pension. 

Mr Batsaikhan is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials in order to renovate his house. By doing so his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where they will burn less coal for heating. Reduced usage of coal has positive impact on environment because less pollutants are released into air.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials for his house.

loans.name: Djantoyerela Group

texts.fr:
Le  groupe Djantoyerela composé de femmes mariées et de veuves, ont en moyenne 48 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Fala Koulikoro, commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioîla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréales, et de condiments. Les femmes du groupe Djantoyerela sont à leurs vingt troisième prêts solidaires qui sera utilisé pour acheter des céréales et des condiments.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
 La deuxième debout de la droite vers la gauche s’appelle Wassa,  elle compte acheter avec son prêt 10 sacs de sel de 25kg. Dans sa situation actuelle  de veuvage, le bénéfice issu de cette activité sera divisé en deux une partie sera utilisée comme les frais de condiments.
texts.en:
The Djantoyerela group is made up of married women and widows, who average 48 years of age with five children each, and who all live in extended traditional families in the village of Fala Koulikoro, belonging to the Massigui commune, which lies in the Dioïla prefecture in the Kioulikoro region (the Republic of Mali's second administrative region).

They became acquainted through relatives, neighbors and friends. They buy and sell cereals and condiments and they are on their 23rd group loan, which will be used to buy cereals and condiments.

The woman standing second from the right of the photo is called Wassa. With her loan she is planning to buy ten 25kg sacks of salt. In her current situation as a widow, the profits she makes from this business will be divided into two and one part will be used as expenses for the condiments.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Le  groupe Djiguisseme, composé de femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 48 ans, 7 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Fana Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments, de l’habillement, des fruits et légumes etc.                                                             
Les femmes du groupe Djiguisseme sont à leur seizième prêt solidaire. 
La cliente Ami qui est la première personne assise à gauche compte acheter un cartons de concentrée de tomate, de la poudre d’oignon, 1 carton de cube Maggi, 25kg de sel et  des sacs de gombo. La vente se fait au marché et à la maison. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 70.000 FCFA. Ce bénéfice sera réutilisé dans l’activité si possible en augmentant la quantité d’achat.
texts.en:
The Djiguisseme group is made up of married women, who average 48 years of age with seven children each, and who all live in extended traditional families in the town of Fana in the Koulikoro region (the Republic of Mali's second administrative region).

They became acquainted through relatives, neighbors and friends. They buy and sell condiments, clothing, fruits and vegetables etc. and they are on their 16th group loan..

The customer, Ami, who is sitting on the far left of the photo, is planning to buy a carton of tomato purée, onion powder, a carton of Maggi stock cubes, 25kg of salt and sacks of gombo. She sells her products in the market and from home. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 70,000FCFA. This profit will be reinvested in her business, if possible by increasing the amount of goods she buys.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 46-years-old. He is married with six children, four of whom go to school. He is a farmer who grows coffee, cassava and sugarcane for sale. He also rears some cows and pigs at his residence.

Charles wants a loan 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) to buy building materials to complete his residential house. He intends to buy cement and iron sheets and pay for labour. Charles' family's living standard is not good and he hopes to improve it after completing the residential house.

Charles' dream is to educate his children up to higher institutions of learning. However, he is challenged by the changing weather condition.

loans.use: to buy building materials for his house.

loans.name: Zavkiya

texts.ru: Завкия очень добрая и трудолюбивая женщина, она замужем и на воспитании имеет троих детей. Дети взрослые старшему 20 лет, а младшему 12 лет. Её отец умер, когда ей было 19 лет. Она осталась с матерью и маленькими сестрами и братом. Условия жизни у них были очень тяжелые. Несмотря на тяжелые дни, она окончила Педагогический институт столицы. После занятий в институте, она работала в заводе по производства хлеба, чтобы заработать деньги для  содержания семьи. После окончание ВУЗ-а начала преподавать в средней школе. Вышла замуж и родила инвалидную дочь. Муж развелся с ней. Вышла замуж во второй раз. Муж уехал в Россию на заработки, и там проработал 2 года. Приехав на Родину, он начал заниматься скотоводством и электро - мастером. Его заботливая жена помогает ему в ведении бизнеса. Откармливают скот для реализации. Полученный доход используют для лечения дочки. Родители мужа у них на содержании. На заработную плату  нельзя и содержать семью и оплатит учёбу сына. Завкия решила обратиться за займом, так как их единственный сын хорошо учится и поступил в ВУЗ, а оплачивать нечем. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебы сына в университете.
texts.en: Zavkia is a very honest and hardworking woman. She is married and has three children; the oldest is 20, and the youngest is 12. Her father died when she was 19. She was left with her mother, younger sister, and brother. Life was very difficult for them. Despite these difficulties, Zavkia graduated from the capitol city's Teachers' College. After classes, she would work at a bread factory to earn money to support her family. After graduating from college, she started teaching at a high school. She got married and gave birth to an invalid daughter. She got divorced, and remarried. Her husband left to work in Russia, and worked there for two years. After returning home, he began working raising livestock and as an electrician. His thoughtful wife helps him run the business. She fattens the livestock so they can be sold. They use the income to treat their daughter. They also support her husband's parents. On their income, they cannot afford to support the family and pay for their son's college. Zavkia decided to apply for a loan, since their only son is a good student and has been accepted in college, but they cannot afford to pay for it. She is requesting a loan to pay for her son's college tuition.

loans.use: To pay for her son’s education at the university

loans.name: Gina

texts.es: La Sra. Gina  tiene 24 años, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa según la temporada,  ella vende sus productos en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la localidad de Puerto Rico,  este préstamo es su  primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Gina  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de ropa por mayor como chompas y chamarras  para surtir su negocio ya que se acerca la época de frio, y esta época tiene mucha venta e incluso pedidos , su razón para solicitar este préstamo es falta de capital, la Sra. Gina  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia diaria, va a utilizar los beneficios en comprar electrodomésticos para su casa, su deseo para su negocio tener mercadería surtida para ofrecer variedad de productos a su clientes, la Sra. Gina  se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que le permite mejorar en su negocio.
texts.en: Gina is 24 years old. She sells seasonal clothing. She sells her products at her sales spot located in the community of Puerto Rico. This loan is her first cycle with the institution. Gina is going to use this loan to buy clothes wholesale, such as sweaters and jackets to stock her business. The cold season is coming and she sells a lot at that time, she even gets orders. The reason she is asking for this loan is her lack of capital. Gina faces challenges in her business, such as daily competition. She is going to use the profits to buy appliances for her house. She wants her business to have merchandise stocked to offer a variety of products to her customers. Gina is happy and grateful with the institution for the support it has given, since it has allowed her to improve in her business.

loans.use: to buy winter clothing.

loans.name: G.s Marcelino Group

texts.es:
La joven Wendy  es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a  sus 2 hijos y esposo. Su negocio es una pulpería desde hace varios años, la cual es muy visitada y conocida por los vecinos de su colonia. 
Wendy necesita el préstamo para la compra de más productos como manteca, arroz, frijoles, maíz, frijoles, azúcar, refrescos, pan, churros, entre otros que necesita para satisfacer la demanda que le hacen sus vecinos. Con el préstamo ella espera que las ventas aumenten y gracias a esto poder mejorar la calidad de vida de la familia con el aumento de los ingresos en el hogar. 
Wendy al igual que sus compañeros de grupo esperan en un corto plazo su negocio crezca y  con esto poder seguir apoyando a sus familias y que sus hijos continúen con los estudios para que tengan mayores oportunidades en la vida.
Doña Yesenia su negocio es la venta de ropa  desde hace 5 años.
Doña Diana su negocio es la venta de tortillas desde hace 3 años.



Choluteca, Honduras – Julio del  2013
texts.en:
Wendy is a very hardworking and responsible young woman. She lives in a community in southern Honduras with her 2 children and her husband. Her business is a small store she has had for several years. It is visited by and well known to the residents of the neighborhood.

Wendy needs the loan to buy more products, such as lard, rice, beans, sugar, beverages, bread, churros, and more. She needs them to fill the demand of her neighbors. With the loan, she hopes that sales increase and thanks to this she will be able to improve her family's quality of life with the increase in income in the home.
 
Wendy, like the other members of the group, hopes to make her business grow in the short term and this way keep supporting her family, and for her children to stay in schools so they can have better opportunities in life.

Yesenia's business has been selling clothes for 5 years. 
Diana's business has been selling tortillas for 3 years. 



Choluteca, Honduras – July, 2013

loans.use: to buy lard, rice, beans, corn, sugar, beverages, bread, churros, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en:
Samvel is 31-years-old. He lives in Vanadzor with his wife and a small son. Samvel’s wife is unemployed and she takes care of their son. Samvel has no higher education but he manages to run his own business. 

Samvel has a car washing center in a space he rents. He has been in this business for two years and the income is too low. Only having a small family helps Samvel to overcome all the difficulties connected with his family needs and his business.

Samvel is requesting a loan of 300,000 Armenian Drams (AMD) to be able to provide new a carpet cleaning service. He wants to buy equipment for cleaning carpets, a rack for the carpets and a water line installation.

loans.use: to buy equipment for cleaning carpets, a rack for carpets and a water line installation.

loans.name: Yoeurn's Group

texts.en:
Yoeurn is a 47-year-old mother of seven children. Two of her dependent kids are in school. To cover her daily cost of living, she does rice cropping on a one-hectare area, with which she has been involved for 10 years. This is the second cycle for Yoeurn with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Her successful past loan, which she has repaid back completely, has enabled her to sustain her living better than before. 

Now she joins a group of three female members and she is the leader. She is applying for 500,000 KHR while her joint members are seeking 700,000 KHR each. Yoeurn will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer to boost her crop output. She highly believes that she can make a good yield with high income so she can expand her business more.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to boost her crop output.

loans.name: Gandariya

texts.en:
Mrs. Gandariya, 46 years old, lives with her daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been selling children's clothes by renting a stall at a trade center since 2011. Her elder son studies at the university in China. 

She has an idea of making and selling bed covers to local people. For this cause, she is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to purchase textiles and a sewing machine. If her new business succeeds, her family income will be increased and she can invest in her children's education. She is a very hardworking individual and it is not easy to raise two children alone.

loans.use: to purchase textiles and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a very kind and intelligent woman and she lives with her daughter in Vanadzor city. Unfortunately she became a widow several years ago. 

Emma has graduated Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute and she has become a teacher of Armenian language and Literature. 

She works at the nearby village school as a teacher. Emma says that her decision to become a teacher is a result of her Armenian language and literature teacher, who was a very wise and clever woman and whom Emma loved and respected very much. 

Emma also gives paid individual courses at her home and prepares children for the entrance examinations. 

Emma is requesting a loan of 400,000 Armenian Drams (AMD) to buy a computer so that she can develop her educational programs both for her individual courses and for school lessons.

loans.use: to buy a computer so she can develop her educational programs both for her individual courses and for school lessons.

loans.name: Assata

texts.fr:
Madame  Assata  est âgée de 43 ans,  mariée  et mère de six enfants, elle vit chez son mari dans une famille nucléaire dans le village de Banankoro dans la commune de Sanankoroba dans la région de Koulikoro  (2ème  région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ayant été forcée d’abandonner les bancs scolaires très tôt pour des raisons de mariage, elle commença vite le commerce auprès de son mari pour pouvoir subvenir à ses petits besoins. Elle mène cette activité depuis 5 ans et jouit d’une grande clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Elle a une grande réputation dans cette activité car elle dessert les clients de la capitale.
Pour augmenter son fonds dans le double souci de faire face à la demande clientèle et de renforcer son commerce, elle a  fait recours à   Soro Yiriwaso, elle est en relation avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis 12 mois. Après un 1er  prêt  individuel correctement remboursé, elle est à son 2ème prêt individuel  qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter 200 sacs de charbon de bois et un chargement de camion de bois de chauffe, elle s’approvisionne sur place avec les jeunes du village et des villages environnants.
Madame Assata vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes   majoritairement.  Avec ce prêt elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000FCFA, ce dernier lui servira de prendre en charge certaines dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
Mrs. Assata is 43 years old and married with six children. She lives with her husband in a nuclear family in Banankoro in Sanankoroba commune in the Koulikoro region (second administrative region of Mali)
She was forced to leave school at an early age in order to be married, but she quickly started to work in trade with her husband for the purpose of financing her own needs. She has been working for five years now and has a large clientele of mainly women. She enjoys a very good reputation in her business as she serves the customers from the capital.
To increase her stock in the interests of both answering the needs of her customers and enhancing her business, she appealed to Soro Yiriwaso, she has been working with Soro Yiriwaso for 12 months. After a first individual loan correctly repaid, this is her second individual loan which she intends to use to buy 200 bags of charcoal and a lorry load of firewood, she buys her stock locally from the young people of her village and the neighbouring villages.
Mrs. Assata sells her wares for cash or credit to her customers who are mostly women. With this loan she plans to make a monthly profit of 100 000FCFA which will enable her to pay for certain family expenses.

loans.use: To buy charcoal and firewood.

loans.name: Kosal's Group

texts.en:
Originally from Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Kosal is married and blessed with one little kid. For the sake of her child, she does rice cropping with support from her husband, who also uses his spare time in working for others for a fee for extra income. The two years' engagement in her current business has returned her about 33,000 KHR per day. 

Kosal, who has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for four cycles, has been enabled to better support her business as well as her family in a gradual manner. For this cycle, she is the group leader with other two female members. She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and herbicide for her farmland. She highly believes that she can make more income from her crops and send her child to school until graduation.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and herbicide for her farmland.

loans.name: Vjollca

texts.en:
Vjolla is 33 years old. She is married and a mother of 3 children between the ages of 2 and 9 years old. Currently, two of them go to school. Her husband works as a guard with a very low salary and she is a housewife and stay at home mom. 

Because she doesn't have enough money, she could not renovate her old bathroom, which is in urgent need of repair as it has a longstanding problem and is unsanitary. Now she is asking for a loan in order to renovate her bathroom.

The loan will help her to improve the living conditions of her family and create healthy and clean conditions. She is very grateful for this opportunity to improve her family’s health and living conditions and she appreciates all of the lenders!

loans.use: To renovate her bathroom.

loans.name: Murad

texts.en:
Murad is 42 years old, married, and has four children - a son and three daughters. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) from the Agdam region. Murad now lives in the Absheron region with his family. His son go to preschool. 

Murad started his new business a year ago. Now he needs a loan of 1,000 AZN to buy spare parts. He wants to use the profits for his son and daughters' future. In the future, Murad wants to buy a new car. This will be more profitable for his business. Murad is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting him again. This his second loan.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Essowazou Group

texts.fr: Mr Komla est né en 1963. Il est père de famille dont 03 scolarisés. Sa femme est cultivatrice. Il est responsable du groupement nommé ESSOWAZOU constitué de femmes et d’hommes qui ont tous mis leur confiance à la terre. Ils sont tous dans l’agriculture et cultivent du mais, sorgho, riz et du niébé. Depuis 1995, Mr Komla est dans ce domaine et est aidé par 03 personnes. Il veut construire une maison et prendre soin de la famille avec les profits réalisés.
texts.en: Mr. Komla was born in 1963. He has children and three of them attend school. His wife is a farmer. He is in charge of the group named ESSOWAZOU that is made up of men and women who have all invested in land. They work in agriculture and grow corn, sorghum, rice and black-eyed peas. Mr. Komla has worked in this field since 1995 and is assisted by three workers. He hopes to build a house and take care of his family with the profits he will make.

loans.use: To buy tools.

loans.name: Darkhanchimeg

texts.en:
Darkhanchimeg, 38 years old, lives with her husband and children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her husband built their house five years ago. She has been working as a teacher at a high school and recently took her maternity leave. Her husband is a salesman at an outdoor market.

The house Darkhanchimeg and her husband built five years ago has deteriorated over the years and it needs some serious repairs. So, Darkhanchimeg is requesting a loan of 5,000,000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials such as bricks, cement, planks, fiberglass, and foam. Using those materials, she and her husband can make their old house more comfortable and warmer. The renovated house also will enable the family to burn less coal for heating, release less pollutants, and contribute to the efforts against air pollution.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials

loans.name: Sourou-Guetom Group

texts.fr: Nassirou né en 1954 est marié et père de famille. En 1994, il a démarré l’agriculture en RÉGION CENTRALE et aidé par 02 personnes. Son troisième prêt sollicité à WAGES lui permettra d’acheter des outils de travail afin d’agrandir sa superficie cultivable. Il espère avec le profit supplémentaires faire le commerce de planches et assurer le bien – être de la famille. Notons qu’il est responsable d’un groupement nommé SOUROU – GUETOM composé d’agriculteurs, ils cultivent tous le maïs et envisagent de  voir leurs activités et leurs familles se développer.
texts.en: Nassirou was born in 1954 and is married with children. In 1994 he started up agriculture in the Central Region and has two assistants. This is his third loan from Wages and will enable him to buy tools so that he can cultivate a larger surface area. He hopes that with the additional profits he will be able to start a business selling planks and ensure his family's well-being. It should be noted that he is in charge of a group named SOUROU-GUETOM that is made up of farmers who all grow corn and hope to see their businesses and their families develop.

loans.use: To buy tools.

loans.name: Neang's Group

texts.en:
Neang, in her late 20s and the mother of one child, is a local farmer from the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, where her hometown is. To struggle for the family's daily cost of living, she grows cassava and cashew nuts on a one-hectare area each. She has had this business for four years, earning about 30,000 KHR per day. 

Neang is not a new borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has used her past loan wisely to support her business on a timely bases, which has returned her a decent profit to buy decent food for her child. Now, in a group of two, she is the leader. She takes her new loan to pay a plowing fee and to buy potash and insecticide for both of her crops. She hopes to gain a good yield with a high income, better than before.

loans.use: To pay a plowing fee and to buy potash and insecticide for both of her crops.

loans.name: Sum's Group

texts.en:
Sum, 60 years old and a mother of five children, is a farmer from Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district. She earns a living via cassava and bean farming. With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), she is a second-time borrower. Her first loan, which she has fully repaid, enabled her to gain prompt support for her business and to improve her life. 

Now, she leads a group of two to apply for a new loan of 1,200,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to pay a weeding fee and to buy potash for her cassava. She hopes to make a good profit and keep her child in school until the tertiary level.

loans.use: To pay a weeding fee and to buy potash for her cassava.

loans.name: Mach

texts.en:
A local farmer from Sa Ang district of Kandal province, Mach is 40 years old and married. She has four children. Two of her children work at the factory, one helps with the family’s business, and the remaining one is studying at a local primary school. Besides rice cropping on one hectare of farmland, Mach also raises pigs while her husband works at a construction site for extra income. Mach has been involved in her business since she was 20 years old.

Mach is a third-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has paid back her past loans completely and they have enabled her to support her living. Now, Mach is seeking a new loan in order to buy a decent motorbike for her kids to travel back and forth to their workplace, to buy more pigs for raising, and to buy fertilizer and gasoline for her hand tractor, as well as to pay the plowing fee for her farmland. She hopes to triple her income and set aside some money for future needs.

loans.use: to buy a decent motorbike for her kids to travel back and forth to their workplace, to buy more pigs for raising, and to buy fertilizer and gasoline for her hand tractor, as well as to pay the plowing fee for her farmland

loans.name: Sambo

texts.en:
Sambo, originally from Sa Ang district of Kandal province, is 53 years old and has eight kids. Currently, only one school-aged child relies on him. His main sources of income are from rice farming and fishing. His current business that he has had for ages earns him about 19,600 KHR per day. 

Sambo is a new client to VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He is seeking a loan to buy a boat, a small boat machine, and a fishing net. He hopes these purchases will support his fish catching business better than before and increase his income.

loans.use: To buy a boat, a small boat machine, and a fishing net

loans.name: Sreyleab

texts.en:
Sreyleab is 33 years old and a mother of two dependent kids. The rest of her family resides in Bati district of Kandal province.  Her source of income is from working as a factory worker and rice cropping. She has been involved in her current business for five years, earning about 38,200 KHR per day. 

This is not the first loan for Sreyleab with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loan wisely and improved her living conditions. Now, she is seeking a new loan to buy a cow to support her farmland. She hopes to gain a good yield from her crops and to make a good profit.

loans.use: To buy a cow to support her farmland

loans.name: Enkhbaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Enkhbaatar, 52 years old, lives with his wife and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. He has been rendering taxi service to local people for 20 years and secured permanent customers in the outdoor market. His wife currently took her vacation and is not working. His son got married and lives separately. 

He is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to purchase shingles, cement and putties. Using those materials, he wants to renovate his house. By doing so, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is used for heating. Reduction in coal usage will contribute to the efforts against air pollution by releasing less pollutants. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase shingles, cements and putties.

loans.name: Savriniso

texts.en:
Work in education requires much sacrifice and follow-through in teaching/learning. Aware of this, Savriniso works as a history teacher at a school, teaching youngsters of various ages in the school. She impacts knowledge with dignity. Her main concern is educating these people since they the future of the nation and must improve their standards of living. She has been working in this field more than three years. Her colleagues know her as hardworking and smart. 

She is also a good wife and lovely mother of eight children. Her husband is a master of repairing cars. Her children are non-adults. Some of them go to school. She must buy books, notebooks and school uniforms for her children but she has no money. She is asking for a loan of 3,500 somoni. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy books, notebooks and school uniforms for her children.

loans.name: Nazila

texts.en:
Nazila lives in the Absheron region of Azerbaijan with her family. She is 57 years old and has four children. She is looking after her children alone because her husband died. 

Nazila started a cafe business five years ago. Now she needs a loan of 1,800 AZN to buy a fridge for her cafe. In the future, she wants to use her profits to pay for home repairs and, in the future, Nazila also wants to repair her cafe. This will be more profitable for her business. She is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting her.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator for her cafe

loans.name: Sophorn's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager from Kampong Cham province, Sophorn is 44 years old and married. She has four children, two of whom still count on her as they are still in school. The rest of her family relies solely on paddy rice farming and cassava cropping on two-hectare areas each. She has been involved in her current business for ages. From this business, she can earn up to 28,000 KHR per day. 

Sophorn is new to VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads her group of two members to take a new loan. Her entire loan portion will be spent on purchasing fertilizer. She hopes this purchase will help her to boost her crop yield significantly and bring in a good income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Mean

texts.en:
Mean, 60, is a married father blessed with three kids. He lives in Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province, where he does his business. To support his entire household, he does rice cropping on 3 hectares. This is the business that he has had for ages. 

Mean is a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He is seeking his new loan to buy fertilizer and potash and pay for plowing fees. He hopes to make a good yield and more income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and potash and pay for plowing fees.

loans.name: Gorette

texts.en:
Gorette is 43 years old. She is married with three children. She has been in rice production for the past three years. With the loan, she would like to buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production. The profits from the farming will be used for providing food for the family.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Celestin

texts.en:
Celestin is 30 years old. He is a father of three children aged between 7 and 1. With the loan, he would like to buy more fertilizers and support labor costs for use during rice production. The profits from the business will be used to help the living standards of his family.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and support labor costs for use during rice production.

loans.name: Kakha

texts.en:
Kakha is 43-year-old married man living in the town of Kutaisi with his wife, school-age son and father. Kakha’s mother lives and works abroad and sends money to her family. His father earns a living wage by driving. Kakha is jobless at the moment. There is a high unemployment rate in the region, especially among people up to 40. Kakha is a very enthusiastic man and wishes to provide his family with a good income. That’s why he decided to start up a secondhand car parts store. 

As he lacks experience with the new business and does not qualify under income requirements, local credit providers rejected his loan request. However,  It was approved under the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This loan program provides startup and re-startup credits with reduced requirements for the vulnerable poor who do not have access to many credit products, as they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the amount he is asking for, Kakha will purchase damaged cars for a bargain price, pull them into pieces and sell parts with a price markup. Kakha is a hardworking person with a great desire to ensure that his son receives a good education to progress in life. This credit will be a great support for the family. Kakha is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving him a chance to generate income.

loans.use: to start a used car parts store.

loans.name: Simon's Group

texts.en:
Simon is a 37-year-old married mother residing in the Ou Reang Ov district of Kampong Cham province. She is blessed with four children, three of whom are in school. She does rice cropping and cassava growing on one and a half hectare areas each to support her entire family. This business, in which she has been involved for ages, has returned her about 25,000 KHR per day. 

Simon, a third-time borrower, and her co-borrower, who is a first-cycle client, are seeking a new loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The positive impact of her past loans have enabled her to sustain her living better than before. For this new cycle, Simon will spend her loan portion of 1,000,000 KHR to buy potash for her crop husbandry. She hopes to make a good profit from this business.

loans.use: To buy potash for her crop husbandry.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Chen's Group

texts.en:
Chen, a local villager from Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province, is 33 years old and married. She has three kids in school. Her main business is rice cropping. She has been involved in her current business for 15 years, earning about 19,000 KHR per day. 

This is the first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for Chen’s group, which consists of four female members. Chen and her co-borrowers are seeking 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, Chen will spend her loan portion to buy gasoline for her hand-tractor, rice seed, and insecticide for her crops. She hopes to gain a good yield from her business and to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy rice seed, gasoline for her hand-tractor, and insecticide for her crops

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Kimhean's Group

texts.en:
Kimhean is a villager from Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is a single lady who does rice cropping on two hectares of land. She has been engaged in this business for 10 years and it has earned her about 23,000 KHR per day. 

Kimhean is not a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loan wisely and improved her lifestyle. For this new loan cycle, Kimhean has formed a group of three to get a new loan. As the group leader, Kimhean will spend her loan portion to buy potash for her farmland. She hopes to get a higher yield and more income than before.

loans.use: To buy potash for her farmland.

loans.name: Nak's Group

texts.en:
Nak, a rice and cassava farmer from Srey Snom district of Siem Reap Province, is 36 years old and blessed with four children. 

His business, which he has had for several years, has earned him about 30,000 KHR per day. 

This is the first loan for Nak with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). He leads a group of five to take out a new loan. As the leader, he will spend his loan portion to buy seed, potash, and insecticide for his paddy rice. He hopes to gain a yield from his rice and improve his lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy seed, potash, and insecticide for her paddy rice.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Sinoun's Group

texts.en:
Sinoun is 53 years old and married. She is a villager from Bakan district of Pursat Province. Her main sources of income are from a wedding embellishing business and rice cropping; it is a business that she has had for several years. 

This is not the first loan for Sinoun with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her loan with success to improve her lifestyle better than before. Now, she forms a group of three to apply for a new loan. For Sinoun, as a leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing fees and labor costs. She hopes to gain a good yield from her crops and make a good income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing fees and labor costs.

loans.name: Kisaakya Kimwanyi2 Group

texts.en:
Robinah is a single mother with four children of whom three are school going. 

She is our repeat borrower in her second cycle. She borrowed a loan of UGX 300,000 through the group for the purpose of paying tuition for her children. Her business is selling banana peelings, which she collects from neighboring markets and rubbish pits. 

Robinah is innovative because she turns waste into income. She is so happy with her business because she uses only small capital and yet earns good profits from it. Her main clients are well wishers and farmers within the city and its outskirts who use the peels to feed their animals or spread in their gardens to fertilize them. She wishes to borrow more loans from Ugafode Microfinance Ltd. so as  to buy a plot of land and built a home for her family.

loans.use: To pay school fees.

loans.name: Nizami

texts.en:
Nizami is an IDP (internally displaced person) from the Agdam region. Now he lives in the Absheron region with his family. Nizami is married and has four children - two daughters and two sons.

Nizami started a business raising chickens and ducks one year ago. Now he needs a loan of 1,500 AZN to buy chickens and ducks. He wants to use the money for his family's future. In the future, Nizami wants to have a better farm for poultry. This will be more profitable for his business. Nizami is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting him again. This is his third loan from Kiva.

loans.use: To buy chickens and ducks

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en:
Angelique is 28 years old. She is a mother of three children between one and six years old. 

She has been a rice farmer for the past one and a half years. With the loan, she would like to buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production. The profits from the farming will be used for providing food for the family.
