The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Vidadi

texts.en:
Vidadi is married and has three sons and a daughter. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) from the Agdam region. Vidadi lives in the Absheron region with his family. 

Vidadi started his taxi business 21 years ago. Now he needs a loan of 1,500 AZN to repair his car. He wants to use the profits for his sons' and daughter's future. 

Vidadi is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting him again. This is his second loan. He changed his old car after capital repairs and bought this car on the photo two years ago.

loans.use: to repair his car.

loans.name: Leng's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer from Sampov Meas district of Pursat Province, Leng is married and blessed with seven children. Currently, only two still count on her as they are in school. 

For her, rice farming and vegetable selling are her main source of income, while working others for a fee is the supplementary income from her husband. 

This is the first microloan for Leng's group, consisting of three members, with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Each of the members, including her, are seeking  1,000,000 KHR. For Leng, who is the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy gasoline for her hand tractor and to buy four sacks of potash for her crops. She hopes to gain a good yield and make more income so that she can plant cassava for extra income.

loans.use: To buy gasoline for her hand tractor and to buy four sack of potash for her crops.

loans.name: Roeung's Group

texts.en:
A villager from Moung Russey district of Battambang province where she plants her crop, Roeung is a widowed mother of one child. 

Her main source of income is from her single business, two hectares of rice farming. This is the business that she has had for several years and it has returned her about 15,000 KHR per day. 

Neither Roeung nor her co-borrower have been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before. They are seeking the same loan amount of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She highly believes that she can grow her crops timely and get a good crop output.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Xenia Margarita

texts.es:
Xenia tiene 30 años de edad, es madre soltera de tres hijos de 5,6 y 7 años respectivamente, su esposo la abandono con sus hijos. Ella solo estudio hasta quinto grado en la escuela;  se levanta a las 4:30 a.m. Junto  a sus hijos quienes estudian y dependen de las actividades que ella realiza.

 Xenia  se dedica al comercio de ropa para hombre, mujer y niños; oficio que aprendió de su madre ,para comercializarla  lo hace de forma ambulante en el lugar donde reside y en los cantones aledaños.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar mas ropa para hombre, mujer y niños; con el objetivo de surtir el negocio, ya que lo invierte no es suficiente y de los ingresos que genere podrá darle el sustento a su familia

su deseo es construir su casa de ladrillo, pues en la actualidad es de lamina y en invierno se introduce mucha agua cuando llueve lo que le daña un poco la mercadería y la salud de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Xenia is 30 years old and a single mother of 3 children, ages 5, 6, and 7 respectively. Her husband abandoned her with the children. She only studied up to 5th grade in school. Xenia rises at 4:30 a.m., together with her children who attend school and are dependent on her activities.

Xenia sells clothing for men, women, and children, a business she learned from her mother. She does this on the streets in her neighborhood and in nearby cantons.

The loan she is soliciting through Fundacion Campo is for purchasing more clothing for men, women, and children, with the object of stocking her business, since what she has invested is insufficient. The loan should generate increased income to sustain her family.

Her desire is to construct her home of bricks. Currently, it's made of zinc sheets and in winter, lots of water enters when it rains, which damages her merchandise as well as her children's health.

loans.use: to buy more clothing for men, women, and children to sell.

loans.name: Egide

texts.en:
Egide is 27 years old. He is married and has one child, aged three. He has been a rice farmer for the past nine years. 

With the loan he would like to buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production. The profits after harvest will be used to pay for his children’s school fees. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Deo

texts.en:
Deo is 51 years old. He is a father of seven children between 7 and 22 years old. 

He has been farming rice for the 33 years. With the loan, he would like to buy more fertilizers and support labor costs for use during rice production. The profits from the business will be used to help raise the living standards of his family.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and support labor costs for use during rice production.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is 39 years old. He is the father of one child, 14. He has been a rice farmer for the past 21 years. With this loan, he would like to buy more fertilizer and support labor costs for rice production. The profits from the business will be used to help the living standards of his family.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and support labor costs for rice production.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 30 years old. She is single and engaged and hoping to get married soon. She has been a rice farmer for the past three years. With the loan, she would like to buy more fertilizers and cover labor costs during rice production. The profits from the farming will be used for providing food for the family.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers and cover labor costs during rice production

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga, de 48 años de edad, es casada y tiene un pequeño hijo con quien vive en su casa propia. La actividad que realiza Olga esta orientada a la agricultura, tiene un extenso terreno de 12 hectáreas las cuales  ha destinado a la siembra de diferentes cultivos. Tiene 8 hectáreas sembradas con cacao, sin embargo 4 hectáreas están distribuidas con la siembra de plátanos, cítricos y maíz. Su terreno fue heredado por sus padres y repartido en partes iguales a cada uno de sus hermanos. Adicionalmente tiene 4 hectáreas más de su propiedad en la que espera aumentar sus cultivos sembrados. Inicialmente trabajaba sola, ahora trabaja con ayuda de su esposo y eventualmente de otras personas cuando se incrementa el volumen de su cosecha. Comenta que le gusta la vida en el campo, además ha aprendido a sobrellevar el ritmo del trabajo y sabe como ejecutarlo ya que desde muy joven cumplió esta función con ayuda de sus padres. Sin embargo, asegura que el cansancio físico es constante ya que es una actividad que exige mucho esfuerzo, a pesar de ello le llena de satisfacción los ingresos económicos que percibe ya que eso le permite tener el dinero necesario para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 3000, está muy emocionada al saber que hay personas que le brindan un respaldo económico para continuar desarrollando su actividad laboral, así mismo se compromete a ser una socia puntual y responsable. El monto solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de abono orgánico y de semillas certificadas para ampliar una hectárea más de cacao.
texts.en:
Olga, 48, is married and has one small child who lives with her in her own house.  She earns her living in agriculture and has a large plot of 12 hectares on which she plants different varieties of seeds.  She has 8 hectares of cacao and 4 of bananas, citrus and corn.  The land was passed down from her parents, who divided it equally between her and her siblings.  Olga also has 4 more hectares on which she hopes to plant additional crops.  At first she worked by herself, but she gets help now from her husband and eventually from other people once the size of the harvest increases.  

Olga says she likes country life.  She has learned to endure the rhythm of work and knows how to get the job done because she learned from her parents when she was very young.  She assures us, however, that physical fatigue is incessant because the work requires a great deal of effort.  In spite of that she is fully satisfied with the income she makes because it allows her the money she needs give her family a better quality of life.  

At this time Olga is requesting a loan of 3000 soles.  She is so excited to know that there are people who will provide economic support for her to continue her work.  She promises to be a responsible and punctual member.  She'll invest her loan in the purchase of organic fertilizer and certified seeds so she can plant another hectare of cacao.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and certified seeds to increase production.

loans.name: Samith

texts.en:
Samith is a citizen from Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, where rice is the well known crop in the area. 

She has been growing rice as her main source of income for her family. She supplements her income by selling soft drinks. Her husband works for others for a fee for extra income. The current business, which she has had for 10 years, has generated her about 125,000 KHR per day. 

Samith is in her sixth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loans, which she has repaid completely, have enabled her to improve her family's living conditions gradually. 

Now, she is seeking a new loan of 1,000,000 KHR in order to buy more soft drinks for resale. She hopes to make more profit so that she can set aside some money for when she gets old.

loans.use: To buy more soft drinks for resale.

loans.name: On's Group

texts.en: A mother of one schoolchild and three paid workers who resides in the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, On is 42 years old and a widow. She raises rice for a live, a job that she has had for 10 years. With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), On and her joint borrower are in their third and fourth cycles, respectively.On has managed to use her past two loans wisely to upgrade her lifestyle at a good pace. Now, she is seeking a new loan in order to buy 10 sacks of potash to support her farm. She hopes that she can gain a good income from her business so that she can set aside some money for when she gets old.

loans.use: to buy 10 sacks of potash for her farm.

loans.name: Lok

texts.en: A 44-year-old mother of one little kid from the Sa Ang district of Kandal province, Lok is a local farmer who raises rice on one hectare of land. This job pays her about 18,000 KHR per day. Lok is a second-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She used her past loan wisely to improve her lifestyle. Now, she is seeking a new loan to buy potash and rice seed and to build a decent latrine for her family. She hopes to gain a good yield from her crop and improve her family's hygiene.

loans.use: to buy potash and rice seed and to build a decent latrine for her family.

loans.name: Chong's Group

texts.en:
Chong is 41 years old and married. In the family consisting of five children, Chong needs to support only two kids who are in school. For the sake of her two dependent kids, she grows rice  on one hectare area with the support of her husband; this is the business that she has had for ages. 

Chong is new to VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is leader in a group of three female members to take out a new loan. Chong will spend her loan portion to buy insecticide and to pay for her farmland. She hopes that she can minimize loss due to pests and gain a good yield from her crop instead.

loans.use: To buy insecticide and to pay for her farmland

loans.name: Sreypich

texts.en:
Originally from Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province, Sreypich is 28 years old and married. She is blessed with one little child. She covers her daily food consumption via working at garment factory and rice farming while her husband helps to earn extra income. The six years' involvement in her current business has returned her about 34,000 KHR per day. 

Sreypich is not a first time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  She has fully repaid her past three loans and used them wisely to uplift her lifestyle. For this cycle she is seeking with her loan to buy a decent motorbike for commuting back and forth to her workplace and to buy water pump to support her rice field. She hopes to own a motorbike so that she can reduce her transportation cost which she used to cover and to supply water for her crop in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike and a water pump

loans.name: Rola

texts.en:
Rola is a 45-year-old married Lebanese woman with five children, one of whom is still in school. Her husband works as a taxi driver.

Rola has sold beauty products and cosmetics from her home for thirteen years. She now wants to open her own shop, so she is applying for a 1500 USD loan through Kiva’s partner Vitas s.a.l. With it she will buy makeup, creams, shelves and a new locker to display her products attractively. She hopes to be able to open her own shop as soon possible so she can increase her income.

Rola is very optimistic and is sure the loan will impact her life positively.

loans.use: to buy makeup, creams, shelves and a new locker for her shop

loans.name: Roeuy's Group

texts.en:
Roeuy, 63, is a widowed mother of three children. As a single mother and a breadwinner in the family, she grows rice on a half hectare area and tailors clothes for extra income. The business that she has had for 30 years has enabled her to generate about 27,200 KHR per day. 

Roeuy is a seven-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loans with success to improve her living conditions. Now, in a group of two, she is the leader. She is seeking a new loan of 1,400,000 KHR in order to buy potash and pay for the plowing fee for her farmland. She hopes that she can gain a better yield than last year and make more income.

loans.use: To buy potash and pay for the plowing fee for her farmland.

loans.name: Dismas

texts.en:
Dismas, 46 years old, has been a rice farmer for 28 years. He has requested a Kiva loan to purchase more fertilizers and help pay labor costs during rice production. The profits from the business will be used to help uplift his family's standard of living.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Pov, 46, is a widowed mother of one independent daughter and currently is residing in Sa Ang district of Kandal province. She has been involved in her business, rice cropping, for ages. 

Pov, who is new to VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner), is seeking her loan to buy pre-paid top-up cards for resale to earn extra income and to renovate her house. She hopes this new business will improve her living better than before.

loans.use: to buy pre-paid top-up cards for resale.

loans.name: Sovang

texts.en:
Sovang, 48, is a parent of seven children. She is a villager from Sa Ang district of Kandal province. To strive for a living for her three dependent kids, she works at a factory. She has occupied her job for five years. 

Sovang is not new to VisionFund as she is a third-cycle client with VisionFund. Her past loans have enabled her to support her family and keep her kids in school. With this new loan, she is seeking to buy a decent motorbike for commuting and to renovate her house. She hopes this purchase will minimize the transportation costs which she used to cover and enable her to renovate her house in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy a decent motorbike for commuting and to renovate her house

loans.name: Pha

texts.en:
Pha is 39 years old and has five children, two of whom are in school. For her family, rice growing is a main source of income and she raises pigs to supplement the family’s income. She has been involved with thes current businesses for several years. 

This is the third time for Pha to have a loan with VisionFund. The past loans which she completely repaid have improved her family's living conditions with decent food. Now she is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her farmland and use a portion to pay the plowing fees. She hopes to make a good income to provide her family with better living conditions and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticide for her farmland

loans.name: Alphonse

texts.en:
Alphonse is 35 years old. He is married, with four children. He has been a rice farmer for the past 18 years. With the loan, he would like to buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during rice production. The profits from the business will be used to help the living standards of his family.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generating 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employing approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. 

Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Naihen's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from Kampong Cham province, Naihen is 43 years old and blessed with four children, two of whom are in school. To support her living, she can earn up to 20,000 KH per day from her rice paddy farming and cassava planting.

Naihen, who is new to Kiva partner VisionFund, is leading a group of two to request a loan. She will spend her portion to buy potash and to pay the transplanting fee for her crops. She strongly believes she can raise her business income and better her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy potash and pay the transplanting fee for her crops

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Célibataire, Akossiwa revend des produits cosmétiques, des pagnes dans sa boutique et par moment de façon ambulante. N’arrivant plus à satisfaire les besoins des clients, elle sollicite un premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter des marchandises de quoi répondre aux besoins de ses derniers. Elle espère à l’avenir, réinvestir dans l’activité pour tirer plus de profit et se lancer plus tard dans la vie maritale.
texts.en: A single woman, Akossiwa sells cosmetics and "pagnes" (lengths of African print cloth) in her little shop and sometimes door-to-door. As she is not able to satisfy the needs of her customers, she has requested a first loan from WAGES to buy merchandise that will satisfy her clientele's demand. She hopes in future to reinvest in her business so as to have more profit and later launch herself into married life.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and lengths of African print cloth.

loans.name: Nantiele

texts.fr: Revendeuse de tubercules et divers dans un marché de la ville de Lomé, madame Nantiele est mariée à un chauffeur. Ils ont 02 enfants tous sur les bancs de l’école. Âgée de 35ans, elle s’est lancée depuis quelques temps dans cette activité et elle le fait avec plaisir. Pour renforcer son activité, elle sollicite de WAGES son second prêt pour acheter des tubercules. Avec le profit, elle veut augmenter le capital, élargir son activité. Comme perspectives d’avenir, elle veut au coté de son mari, assurer l’éducation des enfants.
texts.en: A seller of tubers and various items in a market in the town of Lomé, Madame Nantiele is married to a driver. They have two children, both attending school. Aged 35, Madame Nantiele started up this business some time ago and she takes pleasure in it. To boost her business, she is asking WAGES for her second loan to buy tubers. With the profit, she wants to grow her working capital and expand her business. In future, she would like to cooperate with her husband to ensure that their children are educated.

loans.use: to buy tubers to sell

loans.name: Phea's Group

texts.en:
A rural farmer from Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Phea, in her late 40s, is a mother of five children, one of whom is still in school. She strives for a living via pig-raising and working for others for a fee. Engaged for two years in her current business, she is able to earn up to 20,000 KHR per day.

Phea is not new to Kiva partner VisionFund. Her past loan, since repaid repaid, helped to support her business and send her child to school. Now leading a group of three to request a new loan, Phea will use her portion to buy more pigs to raise. She hopes she can fatten her pigs healthily so that she can make more income in order to renovate and expand her house.

loans.use: To buy more pigs to raise.

loans.name: Teresa Del Carmen

texts.es:
Teresa tiene 57 años de edad, es casada convive junto a su esposo 61,   tres  hijas de 20, 25  y 27 años, y su nieto de aproximadamente 2 años de edad. Es una persona que solo estudio hasta cuarto grado en la escuela, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura. Ella se levanta a las 4:30 a.m. Junto a su esposo e hijas quienes depende de las actividades que ella realiza.

Ella,  se dedica a la agricultura a sembrar maíz; actividad  que aprendió de sus padres.  Para llegar a las parcelas camina 3 Km  y trabaja junto a su esposo y su hijas durante la mañana y en la tarde su esposo se dedica a cuidar una finca. Ademas, de las labores agrícolas, Teresa se dedica al cuido de unas vacas.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar una vaca; para producir leche la cual podrá vender y obtener ingresos para el sustento de su familia

Uno de sus propósitos es, comprar mas vacas lecheras para producir leche y  elaborar lácteos como queso, crema y quesillo y así en un futuro poder construir una casa digna de ladrillo para su familia; ya que actualmente es de adobe.
texts.en:
Teresa is 57 years old.  She is married and lives with her 61-year-old husband; her three daughters who are 20, 25, and 27 years old; and her grandson who is about two years old.  She is a person who only attended school through the fourth grade, and her husband makes a living through agriculture.  She gets up at 4:30 am, along with her husband and daughters who depend on the work that she does.

She makes a living in agriculture by growing corn; an activity that she learned from her parents.  To get to the plots of land she walks three kilometers.  She works alongside her husband and daughters in the morning, and in the afternoon her husband works as a farm caretaker.  In addition to the agricultural work, Teresa makes a living caring for cows.

The loan that she is requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy a cow to produce milk that she will be able to sell and thus get an income to support her family.  One of her intentions is to buy more dairy cows to produce milk and make dairy products like cheese, cream, and quesillo (a traditional small soft cheese); and thus in the future be able to build a suitable brick house for her family because the current one is of adobe.

loans.use: to buy a cow in order to produce milk that she will be able to sell and thus get an income to support her family.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 50 years old and is married with six children aged between 20 and 13, all of whom go to school. He has been a rice farmer for the past 27 years. With this loan, he would like to buy more fertilizers and to support his labor costs during rice production. The profits from the business will be used to improve the living standards of his family. Joseph can be seen in the photo with fellow rice growers in the background.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers

loans.use: To buy more fertilisers and support labor costs on his rice farm

loans.name: Rozafa

texts.en:
Rozafa is a social business that manages 15 artisan handicraft workshops in rural Albania. It would like your help to improve sales and marketing of its artisans’ creations and provide income for rural Albanian women. Aida is the social entrepreneur who founded Rozafa. Up until now she has been a one-woman operation. With Rozafa growing, she needs some help. Aida appears in the video along with some of the women artisans.

Albania is still struggling to find its way after enduring 50 years of communist dictatorship. The country is the 4th poorest in Europe, with a strong tradition of patriarchy, and it is especially difficult for mothers and elderly women from rural areas to find work. At the same time, the villages are oases of traditional Albanian handicraft skills passed down from generation to generation; among the types of handicrafts created are hand-woven carpets, traditional tribal clothing, embroidery, loom weaving, hand knitting, tailoring crafts, rugs, metal furniture and metal filigree. Unfortunately, due to lack of access to broader consumer markets from both information and geographic isolation, sales of these products is rapidly declining. With no reason or means to continue producing, women are no longer passing these skills along to the next generation; the survival of an ancient handcrafting tradition and the livelihoods of women artisans are threatened.

By setting up training workshops in Albania, and organizing sales and distribution of handicrafts domestically and abroad, Rozafa brings stable employment and income to more than 120 women in rural areas, enabling the preservation of the skills and culture of traditional handcrafts. Rozafa makes available training and equipment for the women working in the workshops, processes orders from trade clients, and buys the handicrafts at a fair price. It acts as a bridge between individual workshops and customers. Product quality is high and suitable for export, and customers range from Western European interior design stores, expat Albanian families, to the Albanian hospitality industry and tourists in Tirana. 

Right now, however, Rozafa’s success is hindered by unpredictable demand; limited ability to assess market trends; and excess capacity. YSB has been enlisted to help Rozafa grow by creating and executing a sales and marketing strategy to target lucrative trade clients in Albania and abroad. 

Your loan will be used by Rozafa to develop a market-oriented product portfolio, to create a robust, world-class brand, to provide logistical aid and micro-lending for the workshops, and to develop a new sales strategy (including networking with a wider range of distribution channels and establishing a strong online presence through a brand-new website). Your Kiva loan will contribute towards the first year’s salary of a Sales Manager who will be fully dedicated to developing Rozafa’s commercial presence and achieving its full potential.

Aida and YSB are very glad that you have taken the time to read about Rozafa. Join YSB in creating more opportunities for Albania’s rural women and preserving the skills and culture of traditional handcrafts.

loans.use: To finance a social business that will help 120 poor, rural Albanian women earn a livelihood from making beautiful traditional Albanian handicrafts, and distribute these to the European and international markets.

loans.name: Eloisa

texts.es: Eloisa se ha trasladado a otra parte de la ciudad de La Paz, continúa trabajando como maestra en una unidad educativa, anteriormente recibió ayuda de Kiva para pagar la tesis de su hija, ahora es ella quien desea tomar un curso de post grado y actualizarse, para eso necesita un nuevo crédito, puesto que su situación es más difícil y competitiva que antes
texts.en: Eloisa has moved to another part of the city of La Paz, but she continues to work at a school as a teacher.  She previously received assistance from Kiva in order to pay for her daughter’s thesis.  Now it is she who wants to take a postgraduate continuing education course.  For this reason, she needs a new loan since her situation is more difficult and competitive than before.

loans.use: to pay for a postgraduate continuing education course.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is a 36-year-old farmer from the community of Jagna, Bohol. She is married with six children, ages two months to 10 years old. Elisa has been farming rice for ten years now to support her family. She is asking for a loan of 4000 PHP to buy fertilizer, seeds and a sprayer. The income will be used for her family's consumption and pay for household bills.

In the future, she hopes to have a bigger farm which is more profitable so she can send all her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and a sprayer

loans.name: Kim's Group

texts.en:
Kim is 32 years old and a villager from the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, where she runs her business. She has a 0.5 hectares area for growing crops, works for others for a fee, and raises pigs as the main sources of her income to address her family's hardship. These businesses have returned to her about KHR 18,900 per day. 

Kim is a fifth-time borrower and her co-borrower is a second-time borrower with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner). After the successful past loans that Kim has fully repaid, she has improved her lifestyle better than before. 

Now, she is a group leader and is seeking a new loan to buy potash, insecticide, and to pay for labor costs. Kim hopes that she can increase her income and gain back a good yield.

loans.use: to buy potash, insecticide, and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Callixte

texts.en:
Callixte is 45 years old and has been a rice farmer for the past 18 years.  He has requested a loan so that he can buy more fertilizers and support the labor costs of his rice production. Profits from the business will be used to help the living standards of his family.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs on his rice farm

loans.name: Soknan

texts.en:
A resident from a rural village of Kam Rieng district of Battambang province, Cambodia, Soknan is a 28-year-old married father with one daughter who is too young for school. He earns a living through chicken-raising and he has been in this business for three years. With his current business, he can earn about 13,600 KHR per day. 

This not his first loan with VisonFund. He has successfully repaid the previous loan and it helped his family improve their lifestyle. Now he is seeking a new loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) in the amount of 700,000 KHR to buy chickens to raise. He hopes to improve his family’s lifestyle further.

loans.use: To buy chickens to raise

loans.name: Oscar Humberto

texts.es: Don Oscar de 53 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar pero no poseen luz eléctrica, él el trabaja de jornalero en diferentes casas que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, con el pago  que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, don Oscar  está solicitando un crédito para la compra de una lámpara solar ya que con lo que ganan no le alcanza para poder realizarlo, la lámpara es una estación de carga con energía de paneles solares en forma de lámpara que sirve para los hogares de zonas rurales donde no poseen energía eléctrica, con esta compra él  y su familia se podrán beneficiar ya que por las noches podrán tener luz propia.
texts.en:
Oscar, who is 53 years old, lives with his family in his own home, but they do not have electricity. He works as a day laborer in different houses close to his residence. With the money that he earns, he has been able to resolve some household expenses.

Oscar requests this loan so that he can buy a solar lamp, since he cannot afford this with his salary. The lamp is a station powered by energy from solar panels that is made for homes in rural areas with no electricity.

With this purchase, he and his family will benefit since they will have their own light at night.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Sarorn

texts.en:
A rural villager from Kam Rieng district of Battambang province, Sarorn is 31 years old and a mother of one son, who is too young for school. Sarorn is a farmer who grows rice as a main source of her family's income and also plants soybeans to earn extra income. She has been engaged in farming for one year and she is able to earn about 35,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Sarorn has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is applying for a loan with VisionFund in the amount of 3,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her farmland and she will use some part of the loan to pay for labor fees. She hopes this loan can provide her with high crop yield and good income to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticide for her farmland

loans.name: Francois

texts.en:
Francois is 55 years old.  He is a father of six children, aged between 27 and 16. With the loan, he would like to buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production. The profits from the business will be used to improve the living standards of his family.


The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and cover labor costs for maize production

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Don Francisco tiene 61 años de edad, es casado. Es un hombre que desde muy pequeño le ha gustado trabajar y se ha dedicado a las labores agrícolas, por lo que su nivel de estudio solamente llego hasta el 2° grado; ahora en día su esposa le brinda apoyo en todas las actividades que realizan criando pollos de engorde y cuidando los cultivos. Tienen 2 niñas, una de 9 años que estudia 3° grado y la otra de 11 años que estudia 5°grado, estas dos pequeñas además de estudiar realizan labores en apoyo a sus padres realizando tareas del hogar y ayudando a alimentar los pollos cuando se requiere.

El cliente se dedica a la crianza de pollos de engorde, desde hace 8 años que decidieron emprender este negocio con su pareja y también dedica parte de su tiempo a cultivar pequeñas parcelas de hortalizas, que le ayudan a solventar algunas necesidades económicas, ya que también comercializa verduras en el mercado. Con la ayuda de su esposa tiene que viajar hasta la ciudad, para adquirir los insumos (pollos y concentrados) para su producción y para obtenerlos tienen que caminar casi 1km de distancia para abordar el medio de transporte que los lleva hasta la ciudad que esta aproximadamente como a 18 km y en el regreso con los materiales (bolsas de harina y cajas con pollos) deben de cargarlos en su espalda hasta llegar a su casa.

El crédito será destinado a la compra de mas pollos de engorde, para cubrir la demanda de carne que tienen en el mercado que ellos manejan; por lo tanto el crédito cubrirá la necesidad de aumentar su producción comprando una camada de 100 pollos mas y la harina que será el alimento para su desarrollo y así obtener mayores ganancias para solventar las necesidades de su familia.

En el futuro don Francisco quiere tener unas galeras más grandes que le permita incrementar la producción y que con el apoyo de fundación campo piensa construir para ampliar su negocio, ya que cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa e hijas para el trabajo que se requiere.
Además, él dice que quisiera darles la oportunidad de tener estudios superiores a sus 2 hijas para que puedan valerse por ellas mismas, ya que él no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar quiere que sus hijas se superen y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Francisco, 61, is married and has a second grade education only because ever since he was very young he has enjoyed working on the farm.  His wife helps raise the chickens and care for the crops. They have two daughters, a nine-year-old in third grade and an 11-year-old in fifth grade.  The girls also help their parents with the housework and with feeding the chickens when necessary.

The borrower has been raising chickens for eight years with his wife, and he also spends time cultivating vegetables which he sells at the market to help cover some expenses.  With the help of his wife, he travels to the city to buy supplies (chickens and feed) and must walk a kilometer to catch transportation to the city which is 18 Km away.  The materials (bags of flour and crates of chickens) have to be carried on their backs all the way home.

The loan will be used to buy more chickens to be able to meet the market demand.  The loan will increase production since there will 100 more chickens and the flour will be used to feed them.  This will result in increased profits to cover family needs.

In the future, Francisco wants to have bigger coops so he can increase production.  With the support of the Fundación Campo he hopes to expand his business since he has the support of his wife and daughters when he needs it.  He also wants to give his daughters the opportunity to get a university education so they can become professionals and earn a living,  since he was unable to study.

loans.use: To buy 100 chickens and flour for feed.

loans.name: Paulino

texts.es: Don paulino de 56  años de edad vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos en casa propia pero no posee luz eléctrica, trabaja de jornal en una casa que está cerca de su lugar de residencia con el pago que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Don paulino está solicitando un crédito para la compra de una lámpara solar ya que en la comunidad donde el reside nadie posee luz eléctrica y con lo que gana no le alcanza para poder realizarlo, la lámpara es una estación de carga con energía de paneles solares en forma de lámpara que sirve para los hogares de zonas rurales donde no poseen energía eléctrica, con esta compra se podrán beneficiar con su familia ya que por las noches podrán tener luz propia.
texts.en: Paulino, 56, lives with his wife and three children in their own house which has no electricity.  He works as a hired hand on a house near his home and uses his salary to cover household expenses.   Paulino is requesting a loan to buy a solar lamp because no one has electricity in his community and he does not earn enough to pay for it.  The lamp he wants uses solar panels as energy.  It is useful in homes in rural areas where there is no electricity.  With this purchase his family will benefit by having their own light at night.

loans.use: To buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth tiene 34 años, está casada con Cayo y tiene dos hijos con quienes vive en su casa construida a base de adobe. Elizabeth se dedica a la agricultura y tiene 2 hectáreas de terreno para cultivo que compro junto a su esposo hace más de 10 años y se convirtió desde entonces en su principal sustento económico.
Trabaja todos los días junto a su esposo realizando actividades de mantenimiento  a sus plantaciones de cacao y café para obtener una producción de calidad, el cual vende a los comprandores del lugar logrando recuperar el dinero que suele invertir durante la campaña productiva. Tiene la suerte de tener terrenos muy fértiles que le permiten obtener buenos productos , no obstante suele fertilizar sus terrenos de cultivo con abono orgánico. Tiene la costumbre de contratar a trabajores del lugar para que le apoyen en la cosecha y el deshierbo de sus plantaciones. Lo que más le agrada de su trabajo según comenta es partir las mazorcas de cacao y con la ayuda de una cuchara extraer las almendras de cacao que son secados en grandes toldos a la luz natural. Dentro de sus planes a futuro esta poder construir su vivienda a base de material noble con la intención de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. En está ocasión contar con 2,000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, 34, is married to Cayo and has two children living with her in her house made of adobe.  Elizabeth works in agriculture and has two hectares of farmland she and her husband bought together more than ten years ago; since then it’s been their main source of economic support.

She works alongside her husband every day doing maintenance chores on her cocoa bean and coffee crops in order to yield good quality harvests that she sells to local buyers succeeding in recuperating the money she tends to invest in each planting season.  She’s lucky to have such fertile land that leads to the best products.  

Nevertheless, she tends to fertilize her farmland with organic manure.  She’s also in the habit of hiring local laborers to help with the harvesting and weeding.  What she enjoys the most about her work according to what she says is splitting the cocoa bean stalks with the help of a spoon to extract the cocoa beans that are then dried on large tarps in natural sunlight.

In her future plans is to be able to build her house out of substantial building materials in order to improve her family’s quality of life.  On this occasion she needs 2,000 new soles to buy organic manure.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Yet's Group

texts.en:
Yet, 63, is a mother of six children, living in Battambang province. Three of her children are still in school. 

Selling grocery items is a main source of her family income, while her husband is distilling alcohol to earn an extra income. 

Yet has never been with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner) before. She forms a group of two to apply for a loan with VisionFund Cambodia. 

As the leader, she will use her loan portion to buy grocery items for resale. She hopes to expand her business to make a good income, to provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy grocery items for resale.

loans.name: Santos Alonso

texts.es: Santos de 34 años de edad  vive con su esposa y su hijo de 6 años de edad en casa propia pero no posee luz eléctrica, él trabaja de jornal en diferentes casa que están cerca de su vivienda con el pago que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Santos está solicitando un crédito para la compra de una lámpara solar ya que con lo que ganan no le alcanza para poder realizarlo, la lámpara es una estación de carga con energía de paneles solares en forma de lámpara que sirve para los hogares de zonas rurales donde no poseen energía eléctrica, con esta compra él y su familia se podrán beneficiar ya que por las noches podrán tener luz propia.
texts.en: Santos, 34, lives with his wife and six-year-old son in their own house which has no electricity.  He works as a hired hand at different houses near his home, and uses his salary to cover some of the household expenses. Santos is requesting a loan to buy a solar lamp because he does not have the money to do so.  The lamp uses solar panels as energy.  It is used in rural areas where there is no electricity.  With this purchase, he and his family will benefit by having their own light at night.

loans.use: To buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Aracelly Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Aracelly, habita en el barrio Medardo Andino del municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposo quien es su soporte dia a dia ya que entre los dos luchan para sacar adelante a su familia, el labora para una empresa privada desde hace varios años, mientras que doña Aracelly labora como domestica, su mayor sueño es terminar de construir su casa ya para ellos su prioridad son sus hijos y desean mejorar sus condiciones de vida. se les dificulta recaudar de una sola vez el dinero para la compra de Materiales, pero Gracias a este Financiamiento compraran los necesarios como Cemento, Perlines, etc. Agradece mucho el apoyo que Afodenic le esta brindando en conjunto a Fondos Kiva.
texts.en: Araceli lives in the neighborhood of Medardo Andino in the town of Ticuantepe with her husband who helps her every day.  The two of them provide for the family.  He has worked for a private company for several years and Araceli works as a domestic employee.  Her greatest dream is to finish building her house because her children are her priority and she wants to give them the best living conditions possible.  It is difficult for them to have all the money at one time to buy materials but thanks to this loan they will be able to buy cement, beams, etc.  She is very grateful to Afodenic and Kiva.

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Rosa Emerita

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 40 años de edad, esta acompañada, convive junto a sus hijas de 10, 13 y 17 años. Ella solo logro estudiar hasta séptimo grado, su compañero de vida trabaja en la agricultura; ella por su parte, se dedica al comercio de mariscos, como pescado y camarones;  oficio que aprendió de su madre. Para comercializarlos, lo hace de manera ambulante cargando una hielera para que no se le arruine los mariscos, y lo sale a vender en el lugar donde residen y en los cantones aledaños. Se levanta a las 4:30 a.m. Junto  hijas quienes estudian y dependen de las actividades que ellos realizan.  

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar una hielera más y más pescado, camarones y otro tipo de mariscos para diversificar la oferta. Su demanda es bastante grande, ya que también le realizan pedidos de otro tipo de mariscos y con el préstamo dispondrá del dinero para comprarlos y satisfacer a su clientela. 
	
	su objetivo, es ahorrar para comprar un vehículo y transportar la mercadería (mariscos); ya que actualmente lo hace a pie, le resulta muy difícil y cansado.
texts.en:
Rosa is 40 years old, in a relationship, and lives with her daughters (ages 10, 13, and 17). She only completed school through the seventh grade and her partner works in agriculture. For her part, Rosa sells seafood such as fish and shrimp. She learned this trade from her mother. In order to sell her products, Rosa must travel around and carry a cooler so that the seafood does not spoil. She conducts her sales in her neighborhood and in the surrounding areas. Rosa wakes up at 4:30 A.M. Her daughters study together and are dependent on her business activities.

The loan she is requesting from Fundación Campo will be used to buy another cooler and more fish, shrimp, and other types of seafood in order to diversify her offerings. She is experiencing a large enough demand since she also receives orders for other types of seafood. With this loan, she will have the available funds to buy these items and satisfy her customers. Her goal is to save toward the purchase of a vehicle for transporting her merchandise (seafood). She currently travel by foot, which is both difficult and tiring.

loans.use: to buy a cooler, fish, shrimp, and other types of seafood.

loans.name: Gertrudis

texts.es:
Gertrudis, tiene 21 años de edad y vive con sus abuelos, porque sus padres lo abandonaron. El, se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos,  lo realiza para obtener ingresos y cubrir los gastos del hogar, dicho oficio lo aprendió con su abuelo desde muy pequeño y lleva 5 años de desempeñarlo solo, ya que su abuelo falleció y era quien le ayudadaba, lo desempeña de lunes a sábado de 6:00am a 12:00pm.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar  los insumos agrícolas, tales como: abono, venenos y fóliales. Esta inversión le ayudara a incrementar la producción y mejorar sus ingresos.
Su sueño es mejorar la situación económica para salir adelante con su familia y brindarles una mayor calidad de vida a sus seres queridos; asimismo crecer en la agricultura.
texts.en:
Gertrudis is 21 years old and lives with his grandparents because his parents abandoned him. His work is growing basic grains, which he does so he can have an income and cover the household expenses. He learnt the role from his grandfather from being very small and has been doing this on his own for the last 5 years, because his grandfather who used to help him passed away. Gertrudis works from Monday to Saturday from 6am to midday.

The loan he is asking for will allow him to buy agricultural supplies, such as fertilizer, poisons and foliar feeds. This investment will help him to increase his production and improve his income. His dream is to improve his economic situation so he can move forward with his family and give his loved ones a better quality of life. He also wants to increase his skills in agriculture.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, poisons and foliar feeds.

loans.name: Hermana Unida Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado HERMANA UNIDA está en su ciclo número 3 del programa de comité, es de la ciudad de Concepción, la cual es una zona un poco alejada de la zona céntrica y aun se encuentra en crecimiento. Es una zona de difícil acceso, por lo que las integrantes de este grupo quieren luchar por ir creciendo y dar a la zona donde viven un mejor ambiente y que vayan creciendo lentamente.
La Sra. Anatalia es una de las integrantes, ella es de una colonia pequeña en distrito de la ciudad Concepción donde tiene su pequeño negocio de Venta de frutas y verdura ,mercería, y producto de limpieza y también carnicería,  su local esta en su casa particular  y desea que conforme pase el tiempo, y por medio de la ayuda de todas las personas de su zona puedan ir mejorando su entorno y así ofrecer una mayor seguridad a sus familias, también poder procurar para ellos un mejor futuro.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de insumos para su negocio, como ser comestibles y bebidas y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo con su negocio y dar así a su familia lo que necesitan para tener una vida sin privaciones.
texts.en:
The group called “Hermana Unida” is in its third loan cycle as part of the Committee Program. The members are from the city of Concepción, in a growing area that is some distance away from the downtown section. This area is difficult to access, so the members of this group are determined to grow so that they can create a better environment in their neighborhood and promote steady development.

Sra. Anatalia is one of the members. She lives in a small neighborhood in a district in the city of Concepción. There she has a small business where she sells fruit, vegetables, sewing supplies, cleaning products, and meat. Her shop is located in her home where she passes the time. By helping everyone in her neighborhood, the surroundings improve and families feel more secure. This results in everyone having a better future.

Anatalia is requesting a loan in order to buy products for her business, such as food and beverages. This will allow her business to continue growing. As a result, her family can experience a life without deprivation.

loans.use: to buy food products and beverages to sell in her business.

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es:
Don Juan tiene 61 años de edad, es casado.  Es un hombre humilde que desde muy pequeño se ha dedicado a trabajar en el campo, realizando labores agrícolas y que por las necesidades que sufrieron cuando estaban pequeños, no tuvo tiempo para estudiar porque su padre nunca les dio la oportunidad de asistir a la escuela, él les decía a todos: “ustedes tienen que aprender a trabajar porque de eso van a comer si van a la escuela se van a volver haraganes y no van a poder trabajar” es por eso que no tuvieron la oportunidad de ir a una escuela para aprender; luego que decidió formar su familia su esposa ha sido su apoyo, han logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos de los que a su cargo solo tiene 2 jóvenes, 1 trabaja para ayudar a sus padres y el otro estudia en la universidad; gracias al sacrificio de don Juan para que no se repita la misma historia con sus hijos. 

El cliente se dedica a cultivar granos básicos, desde muy pequeño él recuerda que aprendió cuando su padre lo llevaba, se recuerda que le compro una Cuma pequeña con la que él se divertía al principio, pero poco a poco fue aprendiendo y fue despertando el interés por hacer bien las cosas, para cuando creciera él pudiera trabajar como jornal y ganar su propio dinero. Ahora en día  tiene que caminar 500 mts a pie hasta llegar al lugar donde tiene su cultivo.

El crédito será destinado a la compra de insumos (fertilizantes y herbicidas) para aportar a la nutrición adecuada a su cultivo y preparar la tierra para la siembra de frijoles; por lo que solventara la necesidad de dar un buen manejo a su cultivo para obtener la producción esperada gracias al apoyo de fundación campo. 

En el futuro don Juan, piensa solicitar otro crédito al inicio de la plantación de su cultivo, para dar un mejor manejo a su milpa y tener el control de plagas que le puedan causar pérdidas en su cultivo y si fuera necesario sacar crédito para que su hijo termine sus estudios, quiere tener las puertas abiertas en fundación campo para solventar sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Juan, 61, is married.  He’s a humble man who has worked in the fields since he was very little doing agricultural chores because of the need they had since they were little.  He never went to school because his father never gave them the opportunity to do so.  He’d tell them all: “you must learn how to work because that’s what you are going to eat from; if you go to school you will become slothful and will be incapable of working.”  This is why they never had the opportunity of attending a school to learn.  

Later he decided to form his own family and his wife has been his support.  They’ve succeeded in moving their children forward and only have two of the younger ones still in their care.  One of them works to help his parents and the other attends university thanks to Juan’s sacrifice so that his story won’t be repeated with his children.

He works growing basic grains.  He remembers learning alongside his father who would take him along when he was still little.  He remembers that he bought him a small machete that he’d amuse himself with in the beginning but gradually he learned and started to become interested in doing things well so that when he grew up he’d be able to work as a day laborer and earn his own money.  Today, he must walk 500 meters to the spot where his crops grow.


The loan will be used to buy supplies (fertilizer and herbicide) to provide adequate nutrition to his crop and to prepare the soil to plant beans.  Thanks to support from Fundación Campo, this will cover the need he has of providing good crop maintenance in order to obtain the expected crop yields

In future, Juan plans to request another loan at the beginning of the planting season to provide better care to his cornfield and control the pests that can cause crop losses and if necessary take out a loan so that his son can complete his studies.  He wants to keep Fundación Campo’s doors open to cover his needs.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and to prepare the land to plant beans.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: Víctor contínua viviendo en la ciudad de La Paz y en casa propia. También sigue trabajando como chofer en un sindicato de transporte público durante más de 10 horas al día. Necesita crédito para seguir mejorando su vivienda, lo que quiere decir que le hace falta material de construcción para arreglar las habitaciones de la casa. Si es necesario los arreglos los hará con sus propias manos.
texts.en:
Víctor continues to live in his own home in the city of La Paz. He still works more than 10 hours a day as a driver for a public transportation union.

Víctor needs a loan so that he can continue with improvements to his home. He says that he lacks construction materials for remodeling the rooms in his house. If necessary, he will undertake the renovations himself.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for home improvements.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: Don Daniel de 63 años de edad vive en casa propia desde hace 20 años que se dedica a la agricultura la cual es su principal fuente de ingresos, siembra maíz y frijol con lo que gana de sus cosechas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar. El quiere comprar los insumos necesarios para sus cosechas como abonos, fertilizantes, semillas, herbicidas, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. pero dado que no cuenta con los recursos económicos necesarios para dicha inversión ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito ya que solo de esta forma puede continuar su proceso de cultivo. Al igual que todo campesino, deposita su confianza en la agricultura ya que no poseen otra fuente de ingresos y desea superarse haciendo lo mejor que puede en sus cultivos. Espera obtener una cosecha abundante que le permita tener una mejor calidad de vida y cancelar dicho crédito.
texts.en:
Daniel, 63, lives in his own home, and for 20 years agriculture has been his main source of income.  He grows corn and beans and uses the income from sales to cover some of the household expenses.  He wants to buy the necessary supplies for his crops such as fertilizers, seeds, herbicides, insecticides, etc., but he does not have the economic resources to make the investment.  He decided to request a loan so he can continue with his crop activity.

Just like all farmers, Daniel puts his trust in agriculture because he has no other source of income.  He wants to get ahead by doing the best he can with his crops.  He hopes to obtain an abundant harvest so he can lead a better lifestyle and repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds, herbicides, insecticides, etc.

loans.name: Yean's Group

texts.en:
Originally from the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Yean is 59 years old and the mother of seven children. Her family's sources of income are from cassava and rice farming. This business returns her about 35,000 KHR per day. 

Never having been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before, Yean has formed a group of two to take out a new loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy potash and to pay for a plowing fee. She strongly believes that she can increase her income and gain back a good yield.

loans.use: To buy potash and to pay for a plowing fee

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Khan's Group

texts.en:
A widowed mother of three children, Khan is 44 years old and lives in Kampong Cham province’s Ponhea Krek district in Cambodia. She is a local farmer who grows cassava on three hectares and rubber on one hectare of her farmland to support her family. She has been involved with this current business for 17 years, and she earns about 38,300 KHR per day. 

This is the first time Khan has requested a loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She and her two group members are seeking a loan amount of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion on fertilizer for her cassava plantation. She hopes to make a good income to provide better living conditions to her family and to build a decent house.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her cassava plantation

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive  junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos de primera necesidad como: pan, leche, huevos, alimentos enlatados, agua embotellada, verduras y otros productos más, es una persona muy responsable y amable la cual cuenta con varios clientes a pesar que su tienda no tiene mucha variedad de productos. La clienta solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar mayor cantidad de productos, ya que el mayor deseo de ella es el de poder surtir su negocio y así percibir mayores ganancias y poderle dar a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
This client lives with her husband and their two children.  She owns a store where she sells basic staples like bread, milk, eggs, canned food, bottled water, vegetables and other goods.  She’s a very responsible, kind person who has several regular customers despite her store’s not having a great variety of products.

She’s asking for the loan to have the money she needs to buy larger amounts of products because her greatest wish is to be able to stock her business to earn higher profits and to be able to give her family greater economic stability.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es: Luis de 49 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija de 23 años de edad quien estudia actualmente, él se dedica a realizar viajes en su vehículo por las diferentes colonias que están cerca de su lugar de residencia  tiene mucha clientela por ser un persona responsable a la hora de manejar, con las ganancias que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, luis esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de repuestos y darle mantenimiento a su vehículo para poder seguir con su trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y asi darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luis, 49, lives in his own house with his wife and 23-year-old daughter who is currently studying.  He works making trips in his vehicle through various neighborhoods near his place of residence.  He has a large clientele because he’s a very responsible driver.  He uses profits earned from work to cover some of his household expenses.

Luis is asking for a loan to buy spare parts and to service his vehicle in order to continue working since this is his only source of income and thus provide his family with better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and to service his vehicle.

loans.name: Thang's Group

texts.en:
Thang, a local farmer from a town in Kampong Cham province, is 58 years old and has six children. She has been involved in her current business for ages, earning about 38,000 KHR per day. 

Thang is not new to VisionFund. She is a second-time borrower who has repaid her original loan already; it enabled her to improve her lifestyle and allowed her to buy household appliances. 

For this cycle, she leads a group of three; her joint borrowers are first-cycle clients. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy potash and to pay a plowing fee. Moreover, she will spend a portion of her loan to renovate her house. She hopes to gain a good income from her business and to renovate her house in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy potash and pay a plowing fee, and to renovate her house

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Dilovar

texts.en:
Dilovar has run a bakery business for more than 14 years. There are five people in his family; he lives with his wife and his three children, two boys and a girl. His wife works and her salary is low. 

Since last year, Dilovar has been repairing his house yet there is still some work to be done to finish it completely. He is going to repair all rooms of his house including the bedroom, kitchen, sitting room, etc. 

The loan in the amount of 5,000 TJS is taking for covering some missing building materials for repairing his family's house.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as cement and wood for repairing his house

loans.name: Abulfaz

texts.en:
Abulfaz is an IDP (internally displaced person) from Fizuli city. Now he lives in the Baku region with his family. Abulfaz is 37 years old, married, and has two children. His daughter goes to school, and his son goes to university. His daughter wants to be a journalist. 

Abulfaz started his business, raising chickens, three years ago. Now he needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy chicken and geese. He wants to use the money for his family's future. 

In the future, Abulfaz wants to have a big farm, as this will be more profitable for his business. 

Abulfaz is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting him.

loans.use: to buy chicken and geese

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beauty accessories, hair dye, makeup, clothes, shoes, and toys for which her customers are asking.

loans.name: Primitivo

texts.en:
Primitivo has owned his shoe repair and retail store in Corpus Christi, Texas, for more than two years. At his store, you can receive shoe and boot repairs, leather repairs, and purchase polish and other shoe-care products. Originally from Jalisco, Mexico, Primitivo enjoys Corpus and life here in the United States.

Primitivo learned about Accion Texas Inc. from an Accion employee. The Accion representative explained the many loan programs offered by the nonprofit organization. Once he applied and received his $4,375 Accion loan, Primitivo began using the loan to purchase additional inventory supplies and a shoe stretcher, and upgrade existing equipment. 

Without the loan, Primitivo would not have been able to accept more customers and give them a quick turnaround on their repairs.  The loan helped him do this and increase his revenue. He currently does not employ anyone, but looks forward to hiring an employee in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory supplies and a shoe stretcher, and upgrade existing equipment.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 30-year-old woman from the town of Garcia Hernandez, Bohol. She is married and has one daughter who is 10 years old. She has been raising hogs for four years now, earning an average income of 4,000 PHP per month. She is asking for a loan of 3,000 PHP to buy a piglet, feed, and supplements.

It may take a few months for her to see her profit, but she perseveres and works hard for her family. In the future, she hopes to have a bigger barn with a sow and many piglets for better business profits.

loans.use: to buy a piglet, feed, and supplements

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria began Liz Janitorial Services to clean commercial and residential properties around the El Paso, Texas area.  An acquaintance gave her the idea to open up her own business.  When Maria began, she used her own savings to start her business but needed a way to expand her business.

Through community partner Project Vida in El Paso, she was referred to Accion Texas Inc. for a microloan.  She used her loan to purchase a commercial vacuum so that she can work on additional commercial properties, and also purchased cleaning products to continue operating her business and possibly obtain new clients.

With over 12 years of experience cleaning houses and other properties, she is pleased to be her own boss and support her family.

loans.use: to purchase a vacuum cleaner and obtain more work contracts.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Residing in a rural village of the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province, Heng is 58 years old, married, and has six children. To support the family, she has been growing rice and selling grocery items. This is the main source of her family's income. To earn additional income, her husband has been raising pigs and providing driving services. Heng has been with VisionFund for two cycles. She completely paid back the past loan which helped her to improve her family’s living condition. Now she is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 KHR. She will use a portion of the loan to build a pig house and a portion of it to buy more grocery items to resell. She hopes that her pigs can sell at a good price to increase her income.

loans.use: To build a pig house and buy grocery items to resell

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Nepo

texts.en:
Nepo, aged 24, is married to Molly, and they have two children aged four and two respectively.  He stays with one dependant, a house helper and pays tuition for one of his children. He is a motorcycle mechanic, and it's his major source of income.

Nepo has approached Ugafode for a loan of Ugx.1,500,000 in order to buy motorcycle spare parts for sell. It's his additional source of income because demand for such items has increased due to rapid growth of the trading centre. He promises to pay after the sale of spare parts.

Nepo dreams of developing his business into a one stop shopping centre for all motorcycle spare parts in his town. This will help him to improve the standard of living of his household. However the challenges include competition, which he hopes to overcome when he gets additional loans from Ugafode because he will be able to buy much more equipment. In the photo is the client left and the ugafode credit officer(right).

loans.use: To buy motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Khachatur

texts.en:
Khachatur found a means to earn his living by selling vegetables and different types of home products to local customers. He lives in Gyumri town with his parents and sister and is running his business. Khachatur, by his car, goes from village to village and provides the products that he sells. Due to the fact that the products Khachatur sells are fresh and have good quality, people in the community always buy their products from Khachatur. 

In order to purchase supplies for selling (vegetables and other products), Khachatur has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times, but without any success. His loan request was rejected every time because his business isn't registered as a formal business. Khachatur has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. So, this loan will be a good improvement in Khachatur’s life, as he will be able to continue his business and will ensure better life for his family.

loans.use: to pay for vegetables and other supplies for selling to customers

loans.name: Tiran

texts.en:
Tiran has been involved in furniture manufacturing. He learned how to work with wood from his father, when Tiran was a little boy. And now over these 10 years of hard work he makes high quality furniture and has gained many loyal customers.

Tiran requested a loan from local financial institutions several times, but without any success. His loan request was rejected every time because his business isn't registered as a formal business. Tiran has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. He needs that financial support for purchasing raw materials and making furniture. Thus the loan is very important for Tiran to continue his devoted work and gather income for his family.

Tiran lives in Kapan town with his wife.

loans.use: to pay for raw materials for making furniture

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan, this extremely poor Egyptian Albanian married man and father of a little boy, needs your help again to stock up on second-hand clothing to resell. The so-called "house" in the background of the photograph is their family house and the little boy standing at the door in the dark, is Hasan's only son. 
Hasan's photo could not be taken at his little activity, because unfortunately he does not have any inventory at this time.

loans.use: to purchase thrifty clothes to resell

loans.name: Guilma

texts.es: Guilma de 34 años de edad, es divorciada y vive junto a sus hijos en su casa de adobe. Desde muy niña apoyó sus padres quienes siempre se dedicaron a la agricultura cultivando productos propios de su localidad como el cacao orgánico, café, barbasco; así como el cultivo y venta de frutas como el coco, plátanos y cítricos. Cuando cumplió 18 años se comprometió y tuvo su primer hijo y se independizo de sus padres para trabajar en los terrenos de cultivo que heredó de sus padres. Actualmente posee 2 hectáreas de cultivo donde tiene árboles de cacao, café y árboles frutales que recolecta y vende los fines de semana en la feria de su distrito logrando obtener ganancias adicionales. En cuanto a sus plantaciones de cacao trata siempre de brindarle un buen mantenimiento con la ayuda de trabajadores que contrata para realizar un trabajo uniforme y obtener una calidad óptima de los frutos al finalizar la campaña productiva. Le agrada mucho su trabajo porque puede obtener dinero en beneficio de sus hijos a quienes apoya en todo lo necesario para que puedan lograr ser profesionales en el futuro. En esta oportunidad desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para comprar abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Guilma, 34, is divorced and lives with her children in her adobe house.  Since she was a little girl she helped her parents, who always worked in agriculture growing products native to their area such as organic cacao, coffee, and barbasco.  They also grew and sold fruits such as coconut, bananas, and citrus.  When she turned 18 she got engaged, had her first child, and became independent from her parents to work on the croplands her parents gave her.

Currently she has two hectares of crops where she has cacao trees, coffee, and fruit trees, which she harvests to sell the fruit on the weekend in the market in her area, managing to earn additional profits.  As for her cacao crop, she always tries to maintain it with the help of workers she hires to do a uniform job and get the best quality from the fruit when the growing season ends.

She likes her job a lot because she can earn income to benefit her children, whom she supports in everything that's necessary so they can become professionals in the future.

Currently she wants to have 1,000 nuevos soles [PEN] to buy organic soil amendments.

loans.use: to buy organic soil amendments

loans.name: Katende

texts.en:
Katende is aged 60 years and married with 15 children; out of the children, only 7 are school going and he pays their school fees. He is a farmer mainly  growing sugarcane, coffee, and sorghum and maintaining a piggery as his major sources of income.
